Title: MLOps Field Engineer
Description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.

The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.

We are hiring an MLOps Field Engineer to help global companies embrace AI/ML in their business, using the latest open source capabilities on public and private cloud infrastructure, Linux and Kubernetes. Our team applies expert insights to real-world customer problems, enabling the enterprise adoption of Ubuntu, Kubeflow, MLFlow, Feast, DVC and related analytics, machine learning and data technologies. We are working to create the world's best open source data platform, covering traditional SQL databases and today's NoSQL data stores, as well as the machinery which turns data into insights and executable models.

The people who love this role are MLOps engineers who enjoy customer conversations and solving customer problems during the presales cycle. They are solutions architects who like to solve customer problems through architecture, presentations and training. This role is highly focused on designing ML architectures for external customers. It is not a software development role.

This role is particularly suited to candidates with a technical background who are business minded and driven by commercial success. This role is on our global Field Engineering team and will work closely with enterprise sales leads. We are specifically looking for people interested in solving the most difficult problems in modern data architectures. Training LLMs on multiple Kubernetes clusters deployed on a hybrid cloud infrastructure with GPU sharing across multiple teams? Processing 10M events in real time for financial transactions? Object detection on 10k parallel 4K video streams? These are the problems we solve day to day.

Location: Most of our colleagues work from home. We are growing teams in EMEA, Americas and APAC time zones, so can accommodate candidates from almost any country.

What your day will look like

The global Field Engineering team members are Linux and cloud solutions architects for our customers, designing private and public cloud solutions fitting their workload needs. They are the cloud consultants who work hands-on with the technologies by deploying, testing and handing over the solution to our support or managed services team at the end of a project. They are also software engineers who use Python to develop Kubernetes operators and Linux open source infrastructure-as-code.


Work across the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, storage, to applications,
Architect cloud infrastructure solutions like Kubernetes, Kubeflow, OpenStack and Spark,
Deliver solutions either on-premise or in public cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud),
Collect customer business requirements and advise them on Ubuntu and relevant open source applications,
Grow a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with the company values,
Deliver presentations and demonstrations of Ubuntu Pro and AI/ML capabilities to prospective and current clients,
Liaise with product teams to give them feedback on requirements to influence roadmap,
Work collaboratively with your sales team to reach our common targets,
Global travel up to 30% of time for internal, external events and customer meetings.


What we are looking for in you


Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university,
Undergraduate degree in a technical subject or a compelling narrative about your alternative chosen path,
Experience in data engineering, MLOps, or big data solutions deployment,
Experience with a relevant programming language, like Python, R, or Rust,
Confidence to respectfully speak up, exchange feedback, and share ideas without hesitation,
Track record of going above-and-beyond expectations to achieve outstanding results,
Demonstrated personal interest in continuous learning and development,
Practical knowledge of Linux, virtualization, containers and networking,
Business-minded technology thinker and problem solver,
Knowledge of cloud computing concepts & leaders, such as Kubernetes, AWS, Azure, GCP,
Interest in large-scale enterprise open source - private clouds, machine learning and AI, data and analytics,
Intermediate level Python programming skills,
Passion for technology evidenced by personal projects and initiatives,
The work ethic and confidence to shine alongside motivated colleagues,
Professional written and spoken English with excellent presentation skills,
Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred),
Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability,
A dynamic person who loves to jump in new projects and interact with people,
Appreciative of diversity, polite and effective in a multi-cultural, multi-national organisation,
Thoughtfulness and self-motivation,
Result-oriented, with a personal drive to follow up and meet commitments,
Ability to travel internationally, for company events up to two weeks long, and customer or industry meetings.


What you'll learn


Architect and deploy AI/ML infrastructures, data processing pipelines and multi-cluster distributed training,
Wide range of open source applications and skills,
Work directly with customers in a range of different businesses,
Real-life and hands-on exposure to a wide range of emerging technologies and tools.


What we offer colleagues

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.


Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Annual holiday leave
Maternity and paternity leave
Team Member Assistance Program & Wellness Platform
Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
Priority Pass and travel upgrades for long-haul company events


About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence; in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.


Show more
HTML:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.

The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.

We are hiring an MLOps Field Engineer to help global companies embrace AI/ML in their business, using the latest open source capabilities on public and private cloud infrastructure, Linux and Kubernetes. Our team applies expert insights to real-world customer problems, enabling the enterprise adoption of Ubuntu, Kubeflow, MLFlow, Feast, DVC and related analytics, machine learning and data technologies. We are working to create the world's best open source data platform, covering traditional SQL databases and today's NoSQL data stores, as well as the machinery which turns data into insights and executable models.

The people who love this role are MLOps engineers who enjoy customer conversations and solving customer problems during the presales cycle. They are solutions architects who like to solve customer problems through architecture, presentations and training. This role is highly focused on designing ML architectures for external customers. It is not a software development role.

This role is particularly suited to candidates with a technical background who are business minded and driven by commercial success. This role is on our global Field Engineering team and will work closely with enterprise sales leads. We are specifically looking for people interested in solving the most difficult problems in modern data architectures. Training LLMs on multiple Kubernetes clusters deployed on a hybrid cloud infrastructure with GPU sharing across multiple teams? Processing 10M events in real time for financial transactions? Object detection on 10k parallel 4K video streams? These are the problems we solve day to day.

Location: Most of our colleagues work from home. We are growing teams in EMEA, Americas and APAC time zones, so can accommodate candidates from almost any country.

What your day will look like

The global Field Engineering team members are Linux and cloud solutions architects for our customers, designing private and public cloud solutions fitting their workload needs. They are the cloud consultants who work hands-on with the technologies by deploying, testing and handing over the solution to our support or managed services team at the end of a project. They are also software engineers who use Python to develop Kubernetes operators and Linux open source infrastructure-as-code.

  • Work across the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, storage, to applications,
  • Architect cloud infrastructure solutions like Kubernetes, Kubeflow, OpenStack and Spark,
  • Deliver solutions either on-premise or in public cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud),
  • Collect customer business requirements and advise them on Ubuntu and relevant open source applications,
  • Grow a healthy, collaborative engineering culture in line with the company values,
  • Deliver presentations and demonstrations of Ubuntu Pro and AI/ML capabilities to prospective and current clients,
  • Liaise with product teams to give them feedback on requirements to influence roadmap,
  • Work collaboratively with your sales team to reach our common targets,
  • Global travel up to 30% of time for internal, external events and customer meetings.

What we are looking for in you

  • Demonstrated personal interest in continuous learning and development,
  • Practical knowledge of Linux, virtualization, containers and networking,
  • Business-minded technology thinker and problem solver,
  • Knowledge of cloud computing concepts & leaders, such as Kubernetes, AWS, Azure, GCP,
  • Interest in large-scale enterprise open source - private clouds, machine learning and AI, data and analytics,
  • Intermediate level Python programming skills,
  • Passion for technology evidenced by personal projects and initiatives,
  • The work ethic and confidence to shine alongside motivated colleagues,
  • Professional written and spoken English with excellent presentation skills,
  • Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred),
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability,
  • A dynamic person who loves to jump in new projects and interact with people,
  • Appreciative of diversity, polite and effective in a multi-cultural, multi-national organisation,
  • Thoughtfulness and self-motivation,
  • Result-oriented, with a personal drive to follow up and meet commitments,
  • Ability to travel internationally, for company events up to two weeks long, and customer or industry meetings.

What you'll learn

  • Architect and deploy AI/ML infrastructures, data processing pipelines and multi-cluster distributed training,
  • Wide range of open source applications and skills,
  • Work directly with customers in a range of different businesses,
  • Real-life and hands-on exposure to a wide range of emerging technologies and tools.

What we offer colleagues

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.

Title: AI Expert
Description:
At Sogeti, we believe the best is inside every one of us. Whether you are early in your career or at the top of your game, we’ll encourage you to fulfill your potential to be better. Through our shared passion for technology, our entrepreneurial culture , and our focus on continuous learning, we’ll provide everything you need to do your best work and become the best you can be.  

AI Expert

Är du redo att forma framtiden genom att omvandla information till värde?

Sogeti strävar efter att hjälpa våra kunder genom både strategiska och operativa förbättringar. Vi tror på att utmana befintliga lösningar för att göra dem effektivare och att använda de senaste teknologierna för att skapa värde genom moderna tillämpningar som GenAI.

Din roll:

Sogeti söker AI-experter som vill vara med och driva området i Stockholm i samarbete med kollegor i övriga landet och världen. Vi söker dig som är nyfiken, tekniskt skicklig och driven att förbättra och effektivisera verksamheter. Vi vill att du ska vara en lagspelare som är bra på att arbeta i team men även på att leverera på egen hand. Du är utåtriktad och gillar att hålla dig uppdaterad om de senaste teknologierna. Att hjälpa kunder att identifiera användningsfall och skapa största möjliga värde är något du brinner för.

I denna roll kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i:


Tillämpa stora språkmodeller (LLM) på specifika affärsproblem för att extrahera, bearbeta, klassificera och härleda insikter från ostrukturerade datamängder.
Utveckla domän- eller uppgiftsspecifika språkmodeller för affärsproblem när befintliga modeller inte kan användas.
Utvärdera prestandan för maskininlärningsmodeller och ge rekommendationer för förbättringar.
Hålla dig uppdaterad kring kärnteknologier inom NLP och generativ AI.
Arbeta i tvärfunktionella team och ta gemensamt ägarskap och ansvar för planering, arbete, kvalitet och leverans.
Agera mentor till juniora teammedlemmar för att bidra till en miljö där de får utvecklas genom stöd och support.


Din profil:


Akademisk examen inom Data Science, Data, Machine Learning, Theoretical Linguistics eller motsvarande.
Praktisk erfarenhet av stora språkmodeller (GPT, XLNet, T5, etc.).
God erfarenhet av att använda moderna NLP-verktyg och bibliotek som spaCy, Hugging Face Transformers.
Goda kunskaper i Python-utveckling inklusive bibliotek som NumPy, SciPy och erfarenhet av SQL.
Duktig på att kommunicera och lära ut, förmåga att förklara tekniska koncept för icke-tekniska intressenter.
Flytande i svenska och engelska, både skriftligt och muntligt.
Praktisk erfarenhet av att arbeta med både on-prem och molnplattformar, MS Azure är meriterande.
Kunskap och erfarenhet av vektordatabaser som Pinecone, Milvus eller Weaviate är meriterande.


Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas:


Innovativ miljö: Hos oss får du chansen att jobba med den senaste tekniken och vara en del av ett dynamiskt team som älskar att skapa värde genom innovation.
Karriärutveckling: Vi bryr oss om din framtid och erbjuder utvecklingsprogram och certifieringar i de senaste teknologierna, så att du kan växa och bli den bästa versionen av dig själv.
Flexibelt arbete: Vi förstår att livet är mer än bara jobb. Därför erbjuder vi möjligheter till distansarbete och flexibla arbetstider för att du ska må bra och trivas.
Teamkänsla: Vi är som en stor familj med en härlig teamkänsla. Genom att leva efter våra värdeord som mod, passion, laganda och entreprenörskap - skapar vi en arbetsmiljö där alla kan trivas.


Ansökan:

Vi välkomnar varmt din ansökan idag, urvalet sker löpande! Om du har frågor om tjänsten eller rekryteringsprocessen, vänligen kontakta Team Manager, Johan Alsén på mejl: johan@alsen@sogeti.se

Part of the Capgemini Group, Sogeti makes business value through technology for organizations that need to implement innovation at speed and want a local partner with global scale. With a hands-on culture and close proximity to its clients, Sogeti implements solutions that will help organizations work faster, better, and smarter. By combining its agility and speed of implementation through a DevOps approach, Sogeti delivers innovative solutions in quality engineering, cloud and application development, all driven by AI, data and automation.
Show more

  • Flexibelt arbete: Vi förstår att livet är mer än bara jobb. Därför erbjuder vi möjligheter till distansarbete och flexibla arbetstider för att du ska må bra och trivas.
  • Teamkänsla: Vi är som en stor familj med en härlig teamkänsla. Genom att leva efter våra värdeord som mod, passion, laganda och entreprenörskap - skapar vi en arbetsmiljö där alla kan trivas.

Ansökan:

Vi välkomnar varmt din ansökan idag, urvalet sker löpande! Om du har frågor om tjänsten eller rekryteringsprocessen, vänligen kontakta Team Manager, Johan Alsén på mejl: johan@alsen@sogeti.se

Part of the Capgemini Group, Sogeti makes business value through technology for organizations that need to implement innovation at speed and want a local partner with global scale. With a hands-on culture and close proximity to its clients, Sogeti implements solutions that will help organizations work faster, better, and smarter. By combining its agility and speed of implementation through a DevOps approach, Sogeti delivers innovative solutions in quality engineering, cloud and application development, all driven by AI, data and automation.

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Odense Kommune, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Would you like to drive data innovation in the automotive industry, leveraging cutting-edge technologies and big data solutions? Then you might be the Data Scientist we are looking for!




About Us

We are a global company specializing in online car auctions and IT solutions for the automotive industry. With more than 15 years of data across Europe, we are continuously growing and seeking a Data Scientist to help us commercialize our data and create value for our customers.




The Autorola Group is a global leader in online remarketing and automotive IT solutions, as well as business intelligence solutions for used vehicles and professional fleet management.

Headquartered in Denmark, the Autorola Group currently employs around 850 people and has branches in 19 countries across Europe, North America, Latin America, and the Asia-Pacific region.

Through an extensive network of companies, manufacturers, banks, leasing companies, and fleet managers, Autorola offers dealers worldwide the opportunity to acquire and market vehicles through auctions. Our product portfolio is complemented by our workflow management system, which enables the digital integration of individual customer processes throughout the entire vehicle lifecycle, as well as our artificial intelligence, which provides real-time indicators for developments in the used car market.







Your Role

Reporting to the Head of Data Science in our Business Unit, Indicata, you will play a key role in building and maintaining our big data platform, supporting various markets with data insights, Power BI dashboards, and developing data science solutions that enhance our appraisal engine and forecasting capabilities.




Your key responsibilities include:

Developing and maintaining our big data platform, including building out the data lake.
Engaging in platform discussions and collaborating on data architecture.
Utilizing SQL, Python, R, and Power BI for data analysis and dashboard creation.
Working closely with the Data Engineer to prepare datasets for analysis.
Designing and executing complex data analyses across multiple markets.
Commercializing data insights to add value to our customers.
Ensuring data quality and optimizing existing algorithms.
Supporting and potentially developing machine learning solutions over time.
Collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements and deliver data-driven solutions.







Your Profile

We imagine you have at least 2 years of relevant experience, but we are also open to recent graduates with the right motivation and approach. Additionally, we expect you to have:

Proficiency in SQL, Python, R, and Power BI.
Experience with Spark and Databricks is a plus.
Strong commercial acumen and the ability to translate data insights into business value.
Experience in creating Power BI dashboards for complex data analysis and forecasting.
A methodological approach to problem-solving and improving data-driven solutions.
Familiarity with the “Team Data Science Process” or similar to be able to work structured and independently on own projects.
The ability to work both independently and collaboratively with stakeholders.
A willingness to learn about the automotive industry and its data ecosystem.







What We Offer

Autorola A/S is a global company with over 850 employees and 19 subsidiaries across Europe, Latin America, and Asia-Pacific.

You will get the opportunity to work for a fast-growing company that collaborates with some of the strongest brands in the automotive industry. Our environment is characterized by an informal and easygoing communication culture. Our headquarters is located right by the railway station at Skibhusvej 52 A, 5000 Odense C.




You will be included in the pension scheme and health insurance, as well as have the chance to participate in company social events. We offer a good lunch arrangement, a fitness room, and a Friday bar to end the week on a high note.




Want to Join the Team and Have an Impact on the Future?

We are looking to fill the position as soon as possible, so if you see yourself thriving in the above-mentioned tasks, we look forward to receiving your application.




Even if you do not meet all the ideal requirements, we encourage you to apply, as we strongly believe in inclusion and diversity.




We will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis and reserve the right to remove the advertisement once we find the right candidate.




If you have any questions about the position, feel free to reach out to Christian Gless, Tech Talent Acquisition Partner, by phone at +45 31624481.

Title: AI/ML lead
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
AI/ML lead for fast-moving intelligence company

By leveraging prescriptive intelligence, we aim to proactively showcase emerging business opportunities and recommend actions based on how an organisation’s market is shifting—giving companies foresight and a competitive edge.

Our Mission Is To Collect And Structure The Worlds Information To Enable Professionals To Better Foresee The Future. We Have a Current Focus On E-commerce, Where We Collect And Analyse Data To Forecast And Predict Answers To Questions Such As


Which company is likely to move into a new location within the next 12 months?
Which companies are on track for growth?
How many webshops are delivering certain products in different countries?


Tembi’s vision is realised by a dedicated internal team with expertise in building intelligence-driven SaaS platform. Our team includes data engineers, data scientists, analysts, software engineers, UI/UX designers, and software developers. We are driven by values of innovation, collaboration, and mutual support. We celebrate our successes and continuously seek opportunities to improve and learn. With an agile approach and a start-up mentality, we embrace the fast-paced nature of our work.

We are in the market for a AI/ML Lead wanting to drive predictive analytics and conversational AI in a new type of company.

This role takes responsibility for developing strategy, roadmap and team as a hands-on expert. You will be the mentor that drives your team forward and focus on developing and enhancing data-driven models, with a strong emphasis on predictive intelligence. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to lead our way in how to use AI agents to the growing domain of conversational AI by leveraging natural language processing (NLP) and other advanced machine learning techniques.

If you’re excited to explore how we can understand and predict trends in real-world data and use conversational AI to evolve how our clients interact with the insights we provide, then we’d love to hear from you.

Being part of our tight-knit team means every day is unique. Some days you’ll be deep diving into data, making sense of patterns and anomalies. On other days, you’ll be brainstorming with colleagues to ensure our predictive models and conversational AI tools are in line with the latest trends and customer needs. Agility is our mantra, and your commitment to swift, quality deliveries by cutting only the right corners will resonate deeply with our ethos.

With this comes significant responsibility, as your insights will shape the models and products we present to our clients. We are passionate about individuals with a growth mindset—those who view challenges as intriguing puzzles rather than roadblocks. Our team is on a rapid trajectory of growth and evolution, and adaptability is key. We need people who do not get scared when asked to try new things.

Your Main Responsibilities


You are leading our roadmap and position forward and will be supported by a great team of data engineers & data scientists. You are expected to lead the work but having direct reports depend on motivation and experience.
Drive data science projects forward
Use a variety of machine learning techniques to solve real-world problems, including predictive modelling, classification, clustering, and NLP techniques for conversational AI.
Develop, refine, and validate predictive models, creating sound and long-lasting model pipelines in a fashin that is suitable for a true product company.
Lead and execute on our strategy on predicive modelling, conversational and agentic AI initiatives.
Ensure that our ML models and conversational AI systems are running smoothly and transparently in production.
Communicate complex model performances in an understandable and actionable format towards our clients, including visualisations and interpretability methods.


Other Aspects Of The Role


Explore and improve our current setup—be it through introducing new tools, refining methodologies, or streamlining processes.
Collaborate closely with our tech stack, ensuring familiarity with tools like MLflow and practices like data versioning.
Continually research cutting-edge technologies in both predictive analytics and conversational AI, seeding innovation and continuous improvement within the team.
Facilitate the translation of model results into actionable insights, ensuring our customers can leverage them effectively.
Take the team on company outings to your favourite pastime: running, climbing, biking or something completely different.


Qualifications To Shine In This Role


Solid foundation in Python, and familiarity with platforms like Databricks.
Proficiency in predictive modelling, time-series analysis, and other relevant data science techniques, using libraries such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, or Spark MLlib.
Proven track record of model validation, interpretation, and result presentation for end-users.
Experience with tools like MLflow and practices such as data versioning.
Demonstated experience with NLP tools and methods, including text classification, sentiment analysis, and conversational AI model building.
Understanding of cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, Google).
At least 5 years of relevant experience is our guideline. We value a growth mindset, and encourage less experienced individuals with strong skills and an enthusiasm for the role to apply.


Dive into the data-driven world with us, harnessing the power of predictive analytics and conversational AI to shape the future of businesses. We eagerly await your expertise and fresh perspectives.

What We Offer


A highly entrepreneurial environment with flat hierarchies and short decision paths.
We are 25 colleagues today, have clients in 17 markets, and are building a fast-growing organization. You’ll be part of the ride from nearly the start and learn how to build a software company from the ground up.
Outstanding engineering and product team, shipping high-quality product incredibly fast.
Salary and packages are tailored individually based on experience and fit for the team.
An office full of talented, mission-driven people.
A position with direct feedback from customers.
A strong, collaborative work environment with a history of successful startups.
Enjoyable lunches at our Cantina and a multicultural team that communicates in English.
Office stocked with free snacks, soda, and coffee
Located at Fiolstræde, centrally in Copenhagen near Nørreport. (25 min from Malmö)
Diverse team with members from (Denmark, Sweden, Chile, Iran, Spain, Ukraine, Turkey, UK, US, Lithuania, France, Poland, Venezuela and India)


Application Process

The application process begins with a review by our team. Following this, candidates will undergo interviews conducted via voice or video calls. Successful candidates will then be invited for an in-person interview where they will have the opportunity to meet the team to ensure a good fit. During this process there may be a technical test and personality test. We care about finding the right person for the job with best fit for the team. The final stage includes contract negotiations. The entire hiring process is expected to take anywhere from a few days to a couple of weeks.

This is not a consultant opportunity and we respectfully ask not to be contacted regarding consultancy offers.
Show more
HTML:
AI/ML lead for fast-moving intelligence company

By leveraging prescriptive intelligence, we aim to proactively showcase emerging business opportunities and recommend actions based on how an organisation’s market is shifting—giving companies foresight and a competitive edge.

Our Mission Is To Collect And Structure The Worlds Information To Enable Professionals To Better Foresee The Future. We Have a Current Focus On E-commerce, Where We Collect And Analyse Data To Forecast And Predict Answers To Questions Such As

  • Which company is likely to move into a new location within the next 12 months?
  • Which companies are on track for growth?
  • How many webshops are delivering certain products in different countries?

Tembi’s vision is realised by a dedicated internal team with expertise in building intelligence-driven SaaS platform. Our team includes data engineers, data scientists, analysts, software engineers, UI/UX designers, and software developers. We are driven by values of innovation, collaboration, and mutual support. We celebrate our successes and continuously seek opportunities to improve and learn. With an agile approach and a start-up mentality, we embrace the fast-paced nature of our work.

We are in the market for a AI/ML Lead wanting to drive predictive analytics and conversational AI in a new type of company.

This role takes responsibility for developing strategy, roadmap and team as a hands-on expert. You will be the mentor that drives your team forward and focus on developing and enhancing data-driven models, with a strong emphasis on predictive intelligence. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to lead our way in how to use AI agents to the growing domain of conversational AI by leveraging natural language processing (NLP) and other advanced machine learning techniques.

If you’re excited to explore how we can understand and predict trends in real-world data and use conversational AI to evolve how our clients interact with the insights we provide, then we’d love to hear from you.

Being part of our tight-knit team means every day is unique. Some days you’ll be deep diving into data, making sense of patterns and anomalies. On other days, you’ll be brainstorming with colleagues to ensure our predictive models and conversational AI tools are in line with the latest trends and customer needs. Agility is our mantra, and your commitment to swift, quality deliveries by cutting only the right corners will resonate deeply with our ethos.

With this comes significant responsibility, as your insights will shape the models and products we present to our clients. We are passionate about individuals with a growth mindset—those who view challenges as intriguing puzzles rather than roadblocks. Our team is on a rapid trajectory of growth and evolution, and adaptability is key. We need people who do not get scared when asked to try new things.

Your Main Responsibilities

  • You are leading our roadmap and position forward and will be supported by a great team of data engineers & data scientists. You are expected to lead the work but having direct reports depend on motivation and experience.
  • Drive data science projects forward
  • Use a variety of machine learning techniques to solve real-world problems, including predictive modelling, classification, clustering, and NLP techniques for conversational AI.
  • Develop, refine, and validate predictive models, creating sound and long-lasting model pipelines in a fashin that is suitable for a true product company.
  • Lead and execute on our strategy on predicive modelling, conversational and agentic AI initiatives.
  • Ensure that our ML models and conversational AI systems are running smoothly and transparently in production.
  • Communicate complex model performances in an understandable and actionable format towards our clients, including visualisations and interpretability methods.

Other Aspects Of The Role

  • Explore and improve our current setup—be it through introducing new tools, refining methodologies, or streamlining processes.
  • Collaborate closely with our tech stack, ensuring familiarity with tools like MLflow and practices like data versioning.
  • Continually research cutting-edge technologies in both predictive analytics and conversational AI, seeding innovation and continuous improvement within the team.
  • Facilitate the translation of model results into actionable insights, ensuring our customers can leverage them effectively.
  • Take the team on company outings to your favourite pastime: running, climbing, biking or something completely different.

Qualifications To Shine In This Role

  • Solid foundation in Python, and familiarity with platforms like Databricks.
  • Proficiency in predictive modelling, time-series analysis, and other relevant data science techniques, using libraries such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, or Spark MLlib.
  • Proven track record of model validation, interpretation, and result presentation for end-users.
  • Experience with tools like MLflow and practices such as data versioning.
  • Demonstated experience with NLP tools and methods, including text classification, sentiment analysis, and conversational AI model building.
  • Understanding of cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, Google).
  • At least 5 years of relevant experience is our guideline. We value a growth mindset, and encourage less experienced individuals with strong skills and an enthusiasm for the role to apply.

Dive into the data-driven world with us, harnessing the power of predictive analytics and conversational AI to shape the future of businesses. We eagerly await your expertise and fresh perspectives.

What We Offer

  • A highly entrepreneurial environment with flat hierarchies and short decision paths.
  • We are 25 colleagues today, have clients in 17 markets, and are building a fast-growing organization. You’ll be part of the ride from nearly the start and learn how to build a software company from the ground up.
  • Outstanding engineering and product team, shipping high-quality product incredibly fast.
  • Salary and packages are tailored individually based on experience and fit for the team.
  • An office full of talented, mission-driven people.
  • A position with direct feedback from customers.
  • A strong, collaborative work environment with a history of successful startups.
  • Enjoyable lunches at our Cantina and a multicultural team that communicates in English.
  • Office stocked with free snacks, soda, and coffee
  • Located at Fiolstræde, centrally in Copenhagen near Nørreport. (25 min from Malmö)
  • Diverse team with members from (Denmark, Sweden, Chile, Iran, Spain, Ukraine, Turkey, UK, US, Lithuania, France, Poland, Venezuela and India)

Application Process

The application process begins with a review by our team. Following this, candidates will undergo interviews conducted via voice or video calls. Successful candidates will then be invited for an in-person interview where they will have the opportunity to meet the team to ensure a good fit. During this process there may be a technical test and personality test. We care about finding the right person for the job with best fit for the team. The final stage includes contract negotiations. The entire hiring process is expected to take anywhere from a few days to a couple of weeks.

This is not a consultant opportunity and we respectfully ask not to be contacted regarding consultancy offers.

Title: AI Research Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Us

At Teton, we are redefining the role of healthcare workers through cutting-edge AI technology. Facing a global nursing shortage, our solutions offer vital support to overburdened health systems. We distinguish ourselves by focusing relentlessly on product excellence and user experience, rapidly deploying solutions that make a real difference.

At this stage of our company we require a physical presence in our office in Copenhagen, Denmark. We believe this enables the fastest and most efficient iteration cycles to build an impactful product that users love to use.

The Job

We are looking for a research scientist to help us push the frontiers in our AI’s capabilities. We are looking for a candidate with a strong engineering / research background that is creative and organised. Your code will be deployed to our fleet and therefore being able to create solutions and thoroughly validating them is key to this role.

At Teton You Will Be Working On


Deep learning methods for real-time object detection, pose estimation, depth and segmentation.
Developing tracking and action recognition systems.
Building a scalable training simulator using SOTA within 3D reconstruction (NeRF, 3DGs), procedural generation and diffusion models.
Train deep learning models and deploying them to our fleet
Building data pipelines and software to efficiently handle large amounts of data.


You thrive in an intense, fast-paced environment and are eager to deliver the best technology to healthcare workers and patients. You will probably deploy something new to care workers in a real hospital every week.

You’ll be in close collaboration with the rest of the technical team on a daily basis. This job is in-person in our office in Copenhagen, Denmark.

How is it to work at Teton?

We are a tight, but growing, team of extremely hard working and talented people. The learning curves are steep and expanding one’s skill set is encouraged. It’s a workplace where you get your hands dirty and learn a lot. If you are looking for the vibe of large corporations, this is not the place for you, but if you like to build products and strive to be the best in your field, we believe that Teton is a place where you will thrive.

What We Offer

All full-time employees at Teton are offered to be part of a warrant program (stock options) in the company in addition to your salary. We recently closed our second funding round and are offering sizeable warrant packages.

You get to work with state-of-the-art technology and be a pioneer within your field.

All the amenities that create a great working environment are available in the office.

We are looking for a teammate

We are looking for people who believe in our long-term vision and value ownership and entrepreneurship rather than just another 9-5 job.

With us you will have an opportunity to truly make an impact on the world with the outcomes of your work. So, if you are looking for a ride not just a job – jump on board 😊

Need To Have Experience With


Python, PyTorch (experience with TensoRT is a plus)
Degree in Computer Science, Robotics, Physics, similar field(s) of study, or equivalent practical knowledge
Strong coding skills
Strong knowledge of deep learning: layer details, loss functions, optimization, etc.
Strong skills in computer vision / graphics (experience with 3D vision is a plus)
Ability to rapidly prototype and test new algorithms
Minimum 3 years experience


Nice To Have Experience With


WebSockets, MQTT, etc.
Rust
SQL
CI / CD pipelines
AWS, GCP, etc.
Unity Unreal Engine 5
Show more

Title: Data Science Internship
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Lenus is looking for a Data Science Intern for our Copenhagen Office.

Join the health revolution!

At Lenus we are fundamentally energized by our shared vision: making the world a healthier and happier place. Could you see yourself working for a great purpose in a dynamic, global culture? Then we might be a great match.

Ready to advance your career while helping others achieve their full potential?

At Lenus, we’re passionate about supporting others and driving growth in our coaches' businesses and employees development, providing opportunities for everyone to thrive. Through our internship program, we’re excited to train aspiring talent and support their journey to becoming future product and business leaders.

Throughout this internship, you’ll immerse yourself in our inclusive, growth-oriented company culture and gain real project experience alongside passionate teams across the business. Our supportive leaders will offer mentorship and collaboration opportunities to help you build skills and confidence as you start your career.

You’ll have the chance to make a meaningful impact on the business and help us achieve our mission of making the world a healthier and happier place.

The Role

As a Data Science Intern, you will focus on prompt engineering and optimising AI model performance. Your work will involve analysing data, extracting insights, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure data quality and accessibility. This role provides hands-on experience in AI, data analysis, and cross-functional teamwork.

Key Responsibilities


Optimise AI model performance through prompt engineering and experimentation.
Conduct statistical analyses to extract insights and inform decision-making.
Collaborate with data teams to ensure data quality and accessibility.
Support data science initiatives and contribute to model evaluation.
Document best practices and stay informed about AI advancements.


Who are we looking for:

We value diverse experiences and backgrounds. While not all qualifications are mandatory, the ideal candidate should possess:

Basic Requirements:


Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in Data Science, Computer Science, AI, Statistics, Engineering or a related field.
Collaborative mindset with strong communication and teamwork skills.
Analytical thinking and problem-solving ability.
Basic knowledge of AI/ML concepts and prompt engineering.
Strong interest or experience in Python, statistics and SQL.
Creative and solution-oriented approach to challenges.


Bonus skills and traits:


Experience with statistical analysis and data exploration.
Knowledge-sharing mindset and structured working style.
Familiarity with Python and SQL


We encourage you to apply even if you don't tick all the boxes!

Meet the Team

Join our Data Team, a diverse group of Data Scientists, Engineers, and BI Specialists who transform data into actionable insights. Our mission is to ensure everyone at Lenus has the right data to work smarter and more efficiently. We believe in collaboration, problem solving and keeping the workplace engaging. If you enjoy working with data and being part of a dynamic, social environment, you’ll fit right in!

Your Internship experience:


Be paid to learn: Full time compensated internship to learn, grow, and thrive
Strengthen Your Skills: Dive into learning new tools and techniques to expand your expertise
Achieve meaningful goals: Work on real projects in the Data team
Guidance & Growth: Regular development feedback sessions and mentorship from industry leaders who will help you raise the bar on your future
Wellbeing & Activities: Optional gym classes, sports & activities, like paddle tournaments, Workout Wednesdays, run & Dip, football & more
Have fun!: Join us for team events, monthly socials and company wide gatherings including our annual Lenus summer party
Daily fuel: Our offices are set up with fruits, snack bars, and a selection of drinks
Tools for success: A Macbook and other hardware to support you in your daily work


We'll be going through applications frequently, so if this sounds like a great opportunity for you, hit apply and our Talent Acquisition Team will go through it and be in touch with you!

Key details:


Internship length: 6 months
Ideal start date: 1st June 2025
Interview steps:
Introductory call - A conversation with our Talent Acquisition team.
Interview with Hiring Manager - A chance to discuss your skills and interests.
Coffee chat - A casual chat with future colleagues.

About Lenus

Lenus was founded in Denmark by Bertram Thorslund, in 2016. We are a health technology company that empowers health coaches to scale their businesses through the use of pioneering technology and our in-house business, health, and innovation expertise.

We’re inspiring a new generation of health coaches. People who have the power to move not only bodies but minds too. We are at the forefront of an industry under rapid transformation and our strategic innovations pave the path for the change we want to see. Happier and healthier people.

In 2021, Lenus received the largest series A funding round in Denmark’s history. Since then the company has grown from 5 to over 350 employees and today, Lenus is headquartered in Copenhagen, with offices in New York, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Hamburg, Madrid, Helsinki, Oslo, Toronto, Miami, Southern California & beyond.

At Lenus, we value diverse perspectives and experiences. Even if you don’t meet every qualification, we encourage you to apply. Your unique skills and background could be just what we need to make a difference together.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

We care about your privacy, personal data and information at Lenus.

For specific details on how your personal data and information is processed by Lenus during any recruitment process, please see our privacy policy.

Specific to EU applicants:

Lenus will treat all personal information collected during the recruitment process with the utmost confidentiality and in line with current data protection legislation. We rely on the lawful basis of Art. 6 (1) (b) of the GDPR to process the information provided by you in the recruitment process.

Specific to California applicants:

Lenus will treat all personal information collected during the recruitment process with the utmost confidentiality and in line with current data protection legislation.

At Lenus, we value diverse perspectives and experiences. Even if you don’t meet every qualification, we encourage you to apply. Your unique skills and background could be just what we need to make a difference together.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

We care about your privacy, personal data and information at Lenus.

For specific details on how your personal data and information is processed by Lenus during any recruitment process, please see our privacy policy.

Specific To EU Applicants

Lenus will treat all personal information collected during the recruitment process with the utmost confidentiality and in line with current data protection legislation. We rely on the lawful basis of Art. 6 (1) (b) of the GDPR to process the information provided by you in the recruitment process.

Specific To California Applicants

Lenus will treat all personal information collected during the recruitment process with the utmost confidentiality and in line with current data protection legislation.
Show more
HTML:
Lenus is looking for a Data Science Intern for our Copenhagen Office.

Join the health revolution!

At Lenus we are fundamentally energized by our shared vision: making the world a healthier and happier place. Could you see yourself working for a great purpose in a dynamic, global culture? Then we might be a great match.

Ready to advance your career while helping others achieve their full potential?

At Lenus, we’re passionate about supporting others and driving growth in our coaches' businesses and employees development, providing opportunities for everyone to thrive. Through our internship program, we’re excited to train aspiring talent and support their journey to becoming future product and business leaders.

Throughout this internship, you’ll immerse yourself in our inclusive, growth-oriented company culture and gain real project experience alongside passionate teams across the business. Our supportive leaders will offer mentorship and collaboration opportunities to help you build skills and confidence as you start your career.

You’ll have the chance to make a meaningful impact on the business and help us achieve our mission of making the world a healthier and happier place.

The Role

As a Data Science Intern, you will focus on prompt engineering and optimising AI model performance. Your work will involve analysing data, extracting insights, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure data quality and accessibility. This role provides hands-on experience in AI, data analysis, and cross-functional teamwork.

Key Responsibilities

  • Optimise AI model performance through prompt engineering and experimentation.
  • Conduct statistical analyses to extract insights and inform decision-making.
  • Collaborate with data teams to ensure data quality and accessibility.
  • Support data science initiatives and contribute to model evaluation.
  • Document best practices and stay informed about AI advancements.

Who Are We Looking For

We value diverse experiences and backgrounds. While not all qualifications are mandatory, the ideal candidate should possess:

Basic Requirements

  • Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in Data Science, Computer Science, AI, Statistics, Engineering or a related field.
  • Collaborative mindset with strong communication and teamwork skills.
  • Analytical thinking and problem-solving ability.
  • Basic knowledge of AI/ML concepts and prompt engineering.
  • Strong interest or experience in Python, statistics and SQL.
  • Creative and solution-oriented approach to challenges.
  • Right to work in Denmark; we cannot sponsor visas for this position or support in relocation.

Bonus Skills And Traits

  • Experience with statistical analysis and data exploration.
  • Knowledge-sharing mindset and structured working style.
  • Familiarity with Python and SQL

We encourage you to apply even if you don't tick all the boxes!

Meet the Team

Join our Data Team, a diverse group of Data Scientists, Engineers, and BI Specialists who transform data into actionable insights. Our mission is to ensure everyone at Lenus has the right data to work smarter and more efficiently. We believe in collaboration, problem solving and keeping the workplace engaging. If you enjoy working with data and being part of a dynamic, social environment, you’ll fit right in!

Your Internship Experience

  • Be paid to learn: Full time compensated internship to learn, grow, and thrive
  • Strengthen Your Skills: Dive into learning new tools and techniques to expand your expertise
  • Achieve meaningful goals: Work on real projects in the Data team
  • Guidance & Growth: Regular development feedback sessions and mentorship from industry leaders who will help you raise the bar on your future
  • Wellbeing & Activities: Optional gym classes, sports & activities, like paddle tournaments, Workout Wednesdays, run & Dip, football & more
  • Have fun!: Join us for team events, monthly socials and company wide gatherings including our annual Lenus summer party
  • Daily fuel: Our offices are set up with fruits, snack bars, and a selection of drinks
  • Tools for success: A Macbook and other hardware to support you in your daily work

We'll be going through applications frequently, so if this sounds like a great opportunity for you, hit apply and our Talent Acquisition Team will go through it and be in touch with you!

Key Details

  • Internship length: 6 months
  • Ideal start date: 1st June 2025
  • Interview steps:
    • Introductory call - A conversation with our Talent Acquisition team.
    • Interview with Hiring Manager - A chance to discuss your skills and interests.
    • Coffee chat - A casual chat with future colleagues.
About Lenus

Lenus was founded in Denmark by Bertram Thorslund, in 2016. We are a health technology company that empowers health coaches to scale their businesses through the use of pioneering technology and our in-house business, health, and innovation expertise.

We’re inspiring a new generation of health coaches. People who have the power to move not only bodies but minds too. We are at the forefront of an industry under rapid transformation and our strategic innovations pave the path for the change we want to see. Happier and healthier people.

In 2021, Lenus received the largest series A funding round in Denmark’s history. Since then the company has grown from 5 to over 350 employees and today, Lenus is headquartered in Copenhagen, with offices in New York, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Hamburg, Madrid, Helsinki, Oslo, Toronto, Miami, Southern California & beyond.

At Lenus, we value diverse perspectives and experiences. Even if you don’t meet every qualification, we encourage you to apply. Your unique skills and background could be just what we need to make a difference together.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

We care about your privacy, personal data and information at Lenus.

For specific details on how your personal data and information is processed by Lenus during any recruitment process, please see our privacy policy.

Specific To EU Applicants

Lenus will treat all personal information collected during the recruitment process with the utmost confidentiality and in line with current data protection legislation. We rely on the lawful basis of Art. 6 (1) (b) of the GDPR to process the information provided by you in the recruitment process.

Specific To California Applicants

Lenus will treat all personal information collected during the recruitment process with the utmost confidentiality and in line with current data protection legislation.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
As part of the MLOps team, you’ll work closely with data scientists, software engineers, and other stakeholders to bring machine learning models to life—ensuring they’re deployed, maintained, and monitored efficiently in production. You’ll have the opportunity to improve model performance and infrastructure, all while contributing to Trustpilot’s AI-based solutions.




What you’ll be doing:

Model Deployment: Collaborate with data scientists to take machine learning models from development to production, ensuring quality work and scalability.
Build Pipelines: Develop and maintain data and model pipelines, integrating seamlessly with our existing systems to support reliable, efficient workflows.
CI/CD for ML: Design and implement continuous integration and delivery pipelines to streamline the deployment of machine learning models.
Model Monitoring: Help monitor the performance of machine learning models post-deployment, ensuring reliability, scalability, and quality over time.
Collaboration: Work with cross-functional teams to design solutions that meet business needs while adhering to best practices in machine learning and software engineering.
Optimize: Continuously improve our infrastructure, ensuring we remain at the forefront of AI model production and delivery.




Who you are:

Solid technical foundation in both machine learning and software engineering.
Experience deploying machine learning models in production environments.
Proficiency in Python and relevant ML libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn).
Familiarity with cloud platforms like GCP, AWS, or Azure.
Experience with CI/CD pipelines for machine learning (e.g., Vertex AI).
Experience with data processing frameworks and tools, particularly Apache Beam/Dataflow is highly desirable.
Knowledge of monitoring and maintaining models in production.
Proficiency in employing containerization tools, including Docker, to streamline the configuration of deployment settings.
Problem-solving skills with the ability to troubleshoot model and pipeline issues.
Good communication skills, enabling effective collaboration across teams.




What’s in it for you:

A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
Competitive compensation package + bonus
25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy, LinkedIn Learning, and Blinkist
Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
Paid parental leave
Central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It’s complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
Employee discounts to restaurants and shops




Still not sure?

We want to be a part of creating a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive world of work for all. We’re excited to hear about your experiences as well as how you will contribute to our working culture. So, even if you don’t feel you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

#LI-SV1

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about data and analytics, and eager to drive business value through actionable insights? Do you thrive in dynamic environments and love turning complex data into clear, impactful solutions?




We’re looking for an exceptional Data Scientist to join the team in Copenhagen for a 12 month period. You will play a pivotal role in our Customer Insights initiatives, helping us understand customer behaviors and enhance decision-making across the organization.




Would you like to…




Lead and steer data tracks of projects, conducting exploratory data analysis (EDA) to uncover trends and insights within large datasets
Develop and maintain AI-driven codebases, including predictive models, classification algorithms, and clustering techniques
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to seamlessly integrate AI and data science solutions into business operations
Provide BI expertise by creating and maintaining dashboards using tools like PowerBI
Translate complex data findings into clear, concise, and actionable insights for stakeholders at all levels of the organization
Develop and implement data models to support business intelligence and reporting initiatives




We would like you to be…




Highly proficient in SQL and PySpark, with experience in data modeling for business intelligence
Experienced in traditional Machine Learning projects, including predictive modeling, classification, and clustering
Skilled in Python for data analytics, with the ability to implement and optimize models
Hands-on with Databricks or Dremio for large-scale data processing and analysis
Strong in data visualization, particularly with PowerBI or similar dashboarding tools
Familiar with Natural Language Processing (NLP) concepts and their application in customer insights (a plus)




Would you like to join…




A team that values creativity, collaboration, and continuous learning
An environment where your insights directly impact business decisions and customer satisfaction
A culture that encourages innovation and the sharing of ideas




Please note Designit can only consider applicants with the right to work in Denmark.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Our vision is to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. We are well on our way—but there’s still an exciting journey ahead. Join us at the heart of trust.

As part of the MLOps team, you’ll work closely with data scientists, software engineers, and other stakeholders to bring machine learning models to life—ensuring they’re deployed, maintained, and monitored efficiently in production. You’ll have the opportunity to improve model performance and infrastructure, all while contributing to Trustpilot’s AI-based solutions.

What You’ll Be Doing

Model Deployment: Collaborate with data scientists to take machine learning models from development to production, ensuring quality work and scalability.
Build Pipelines: Develop and maintain data and model pipelines, integrating seamlessly with our existing systems to support reliable, efficient workflows.
CI/CD for ML: Design and implement continuous integration and delivery pipelines to streamline the deployment of machine learning models.
Model Monitoring: Help monitor the performance of machine learning models post-deployment, ensuring reliability, scalability, and quality over time.
Collaboration: Work with cross-functional teams to design solutions that meet business needs while adhering to best practices in machine learning and software engineering.
Optimize: Continuously improve our infrastructure, ensuring we remain at the forefront of AI model production and delivery.

Who You Are

Solid technical foundation in both machine learning and software engineering.
Experience deploying machine learning models in production environments.
Proficiency in Python and relevant ML libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn).
Familiarity with cloud platforms like GCP, AWS, or Azure.
Experience with CI/CD pipelines for machine learning (e.g., Vertex AI).
Experience with data processing frameworks and tools, particularly Apache Beam/Dataflow is highly desirable.
Knowledge of monitoring and maintaining models in production.
Proficiency in employing containerization tools, including Docker, to streamline the configuration of deployment settings.
Problem-solving skills with the ability to troubleshoot model and pipeline issues.
Good communication skills, enabling effective collaboration across teams.

What’s In It For You

A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
Competitive compensation package + bonus
25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy, LinkedIn Learning, and Blinkist
Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
Paid parental leave
Central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It’s complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
Employee discounts to restaurants and shops

Still not sure?

We want to be a part of creating a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive world of work for all. We’re excited to hear about your experiences as well as how you will contribute to our working culture. So, even if you don’t feel you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

About Us

Trustpilot began in 2007 with a simple yet powerful idea that is more relevant today than ever — to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. Trustpilot is open, independent, and impartial — we help consumers make the right choices and businesses to build trust, grow and improve.

Today, we have more than 320 million reviews and 70 million monthly active users across the globe, with 140 billion annual Trustbox impressions, and the numbers keep growing. We have more than 1,000 employees and we’re headquartered in Copenhagen, with operations in Amsterdam, Denver, Edinburgh, Hamburg, London, Melbourne, Milan and New York.

We’re driven by connection. It’s at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh –– it’s built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be the universal symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations worldwide and over 50 nationalities, we’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose to help people and businesses help each other is a tall order, but we keep it real. We’re a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense. A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you –– we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you’re ready to grow, let’s go.

Join us at the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive and where different viewpoints and experiences are valued and respected. Trustpilot will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, religious beliefs, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, neurodiversity, disability, age, parental or veteran status. Together, we are the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is a global company and our data practices are designed to ensure that your personally identifiable information is appropriately protected. Please note that your personal information will be transferred, accessed, and stored globally as necessary for the uses and disclosures stated in our Privacy Policy.
