Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Do you want to be a part of a dedicated team that works with creating digital services? Are you eager to turn customers’ pains into new solutions which accelerate the sustainable transition of the electricity grid? Do you enjoy discovering new insights from diverse data sources? Are you excited about working on proof-of-concept projects that lead to commercial solutions?

Here Is What The Job Entails

In the position as Data Scientist your primary responsibility will be to conduct data experiments to identify and develop innovative solutions that address customer issues by leveraging the hidden value within data obtained from meters and grid sensors. You will do this through direct and consistent contact with Product Managers, Software Developers, customers, UX Designers, and Hardware Developers.

More specifically, you will be responsible for:


Proof-of-concept projects and collaborating with our software development team who will develop the final commercial solution
Doing data discovery on new and existing data sources
Framing new ideas for data analytics based on dialogue with internal and external stakeholders
Working on PoC projects together with customers
Designing and developing algorithms for customer-facing products



In this role, you will gain a thorough understanding of how utilities operate and how data science is applied within this sector. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to develop your skills within data science while seeing your solutions make a real difference for our customers and their transition to a more sustainable energy future.

Meet your future team

With direct reference to our Head of Product Portfolio Management, you will become part of a team of 6 highly skilled colleagues who work every day to bring smart metering solutions and services to our markets. The team consists of many backgrounds ranging from highly technical profiles to profiles with a commercial and strategic focus and background. This diversity in background helps us achieve a high level of quality and development in our work, which is something we value highly in our department.

Did you know? You will be part of a dedicated cross-functional team within the team focusing on developing and testing and launching new data-based services for our customers.

Less About Us, More About You

We are looking for a talented Data Scientist who can take our analytical platform to new heights in collaboration with partners and customers worldwide. Your curiosity drives you to innovate and create new data solutions that are centered around customer needs.

In order to succeed, we imagine that you:


Have a master’s degree in engineering or natural sciences, which has given you an understanding of concepts used in power systems.
Have experience with programming and data analysis in Python, as well as machine learning techniques
Are proficient in collaborative coding using tools like git
Have a strong drive to translate customers’ needs into commercial solutions
Have excellent collaboration skills, thriving in interactions with both internal stakeholders and customers



As we are an international organization it is important that you are fluent in English. Knowledge of Danish will be seen as an asset.

We want to support a diverse and inclusive workplace, so while you may not meet all the qualifications listed above, you could still be a good candidate for the position. If you find the role intriguing, do not hesitate to apply.

We are more than an ordinary workplace

We cherish the good colleagueship which we all contribute to, the only limit is your engagement. As we are a big organization you are bound to find one or more colleagues who share the same interest as you. This might be in our board game club, on our cycling team, during our yearly summer festival, or on the padel court. For example, our Team lead, Service Delivery is also our volunteer padel instructor while one of our Software Test Engineers run weekly spinning classes.

Besides the best colleagues you could imagine, we also offer:


Work life balance through flexible working hours
Employee benefits including a healthy canteen, fitness facilities, in-house dental clinic, hairdresser, and a free health clinic
An active employee association that fosters a collaborative and supportive workplace community
Beneficial health care and insurance package



Do you want to be a part of Kamstrup?

Please submit your application by using the link below. Applications are reviewed on a continuous basis, and you can expect a response within six weeks.

The job will be located at Kamstrup's headquarters in Stilling, between Aarhus and Skanderborg.

If you have any questions about the position, please contact Head of Product Portfolio Management, Lauge Andreas Kjær on phone: +45 89 93 10 00.

Get to know us

At Kamstrup, you'll become part of a close-knit community that genuinely cares about one another, fostering connections both in and out of the workplace. Our team comprises innovators, dreamers, and doers, united by an unyielding passion to challenge the status quo, find better solutions, and constantly push the boundaries of what's possible all with the purpose of securing clean water and energy to the maximum number of people. With an unwavering commitment to growth, we offer opportunities for you to leverage your skills and drive our business to new heights, empowering you to leave your mark on our future and grow with us.

Explore more on our website, see our annual report, and stay updated through LinkedIn for the latest news and job openings.
Show more
HTML:
Do you want to be a part of a dedicated team that works with creating digital services? Are you eager to turn customers’ pains into new solutions which accelerate the sustainable transition of the electricity grid? Do you enjoy discovering new insights from diverse data sources? Are you excited about working on proof-of-concept projects that lead to commercial solutions?

Here Is What The Job Entails

In the position as Data Scientist your primary responsibility will be to conduct data experiments to identify and develop innovative solutions that address customer issues by leveraging the hidden value within data obtained from meters and grid sensors. You will do this through direct and consistent contact with Product Managers, Software Developers, customers, UX Designers, and Hardware Developers.

More specifically, you will be responsible for:

  • Proof-of-concept projects and collaborating with our software development team who will develop the final commercial solution
  • Doing data discovery on new and existing data sources
  • Framing new ideas for data analytics based on dialogue with internal and external stakeholders
  • Working on PoC projects together with customers
  • Designing and developing algorithms for customer-facing products


In this role, you will gain a thorough understanding of how utilities operate and how data science is applied within this sector. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to develop your skills within data science while seeing your solutions make a real difference for our customers and their transition to a more sustainable energy future.

Meet your future team

With direct reference to our Head of Product Portfolio Management, you will become part of a team of 6 highly skilled colleagues who work every day to bring smart metering solutions and services to our markets. The team consists of many backgrounds ranging from highly technical profiles to profiles with a commercial and strategic focus and background. This diversity in background helps us achieve a high level of quality and development in our work, which is something we value highly in our department.

Did you know? You will be part of a dedicated cross-functional team within the team focusing on developing and testing and launching new data-based services for our customers.

Less About Us, More About You

We are looking for a talented Data Scientist who can take our analytical platform to new heights in collaboration with partners and customers worldwide. Your curiosity drives you to innovate and create new data solutions that are centered around customer needs.

In order to succeed, we imagine that you:

  • Have a master’s degree in engineering or natural sciences, which has given you an understanding of concepts used in power systems.
  • Have experience with programming and data analysis in Python, as well as machine learning techniques
  • Are proficient in collaborative coding using tools like git
  • Have a strong drive to translate customers’ needs into commercial solutions
  • Have excellent collaboration skills, thriving in interactions with both internal stakeholders and customers


As we are an international organization it is important that you are fluent in English. Knowledge of Danish will be seen as an asset.

We want to support a diverse and inclusive workplace, so while you may not meet all the qualifications listed above, you could still be a good candidate for the position. If you find the role intriguing, do not hesitate to apply.

We are more than an ordinary workplace

We cherish the good colleagueship which we all contribute to, the only limit is your engagement. As we are a big organization you are bound to find one or more colleagues who share the same interest as you. This might be in our board game club, on our cycling team, during our yearly summer festival, or on the padel court. For example, our Team lead, Service Delivery is also our volunteer padel instructor while one of our Software Test Engineers run weekly spinning classes.

Besides the best colleagues you could imagine, we also offer:

  • Work life balance through flexible working hours
  • Employee benefits including a healthy canteen, fitness facilities, in-house dental clinic, hairdresser, and a free health clinic
  • An active employee association that fosters a collaborative and supportive workplace community
  • Beneficial health care and insurance package


Do you want to be a part of Kamstrup?

Please submit your application by using the link below. Applications are reviewed on a continuous basis, and you can expect a response within six weeks.

The job will be located at Kamstrup's headquarters in Stilling, between Aarhus and Skanderborg.

If you have any questions about the position, please contact Head of Product Portfolio Management, Lauge Andreas Kjær on phone: +45 89 93 10 00.

Get to know us

At Kamstrup, you'll become part of a close-knit community that genuinely cares about one another, fostering connections both in and out of the workplace. Our team comprises innovators, dreamers, and doers, united by an unyielding passion to challenge the status quo, find better solutions, and constantly push the boundaries of what's possible all with the purpose of securing clean water and energy to the maximum number of people. With an unwavering commitment to growth, we offer opportunities for you to leverage your skills and drive our business to new heights, empowering you to leave your mark on our future and grow with us.

Explore more on our website, see our annual report, and stay updated through LinkedIn for the latest news and job openings.

Title: AI Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Your Role In Our Mission

We are looking for an AI Engineer to help us take systems that understand large technical documents and turn them into code. This is a job of excitement and exploration, requiring AI expertise and software engineering skills to build complex systems. Knowledge of semiconductors is a plus.

At Normal Computing, you will contribute to cutting-edge machine learning applications across various aspects of our business, working on solutions from the early stages of research and development to production deployment for our customers.

Responsibilities


Contribute to AI projects from concept to production deployment
Design and build systems using large language models to process complex technical documents
Develop solutions for multi-modal data handling (PDFs, logs, tables)
Solve challenging AI and software engineering problems
Work with other teams to integrate AI into our products
Create robust AI evaluation frameworks
Develop strategies to manage AI-specific challenges (latency, variance, errors)
Keep up with AI advancements, especially in language models and multi-modal AI


What Makes You A Great Fit


Experience with engineering projects, ideally related to ML or AI
Strong software engineering skills, especially with distributed systems
Proficiency in Python and ML frameworks (PyTorch, Hugging Face)
Experience with prompt engineering and deploying language models
Ability to handle and preprocess large, diverse datasets
Understanding of AI safety and responsible development
Knowledge of AI evaluation and benchmarking
Clear communication of complex AI concepts


Bonus Points For


Experience deploying AI in production environments
Cloud platform knowledge for AI deployment
Familiarity with advanced AI techniques (few-shot learning, meta-learning)
Open-source AI contributions or relevant publications
Ability to balance AI innovation with production-ready systems
Adaptability in a fast-paced, evolving AI landscape


Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

Normal Computing is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status.

Accessibility Accommodations

Normal Computing is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please let us know at accomodations@normalcomputing.ai.

Privacy Notice

By submitting your application, you agree that Normal Computing may collect, use, and store your personal information for employment-related purposes in accordance with our Privacy Policy.

Title: Data Scientist, Lystrup
Place: Aarhus Municipality, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to push the boundaries of AI and Machine Learning, building intelligent solutions that make a real impact for the Defense Industry?

Terma is at the forefront of an exciting journey, marked by growth, innovation, and the delivery of mission-critical solutions for the defense and aerospace industries. Our technologies provide safety and security for people on land, at sea, and in the air. In space, we contribute to pioneering missions that address emerging global challenges.

To support this mission, we are seeking a Data Scientist to join our Advanced Analytics team. This is more than just a job – it’s an opportunity to shape the future of defense technology and contribute to a safer world.

Your role in our team

Since early 2022, the global security landscape has evolved rapidly. Denmark, together with its NATO allies, is facing increasing challenges that demand innovative solutions. In this dynamic environment, the ability to deliver cutting-edge technology swiftly is essential. At Terma’s Advanced Analytics team, we develop and maintain AI-driven solutions that support decision-making and enhance situational awareness.

We are a passionate and dedicated team that takes full ownership of our AI products – from ideation to delivery and maintenance. Our work goes beyond coding; we collaborate closely with our customers to understand their needs, ensuring that our solutions make a real impact. This means you will engage directly with end users, gaining insights that go far beyond the traditional developer role.

You will be part of a team that values innovation, diversity, and psychological safety. We support and challenge each other, fostering an environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to meaningful solutions.

How You Will Make a Meaningful Contribution

As a Data Scientist at Terma, you will:


Develop advanced AI solutions – Work with sometimes large and sometimes small amount of data, leveraging deep learning models to push the boundaries of what’s possible.
Take ownership for data and AI modeling for key projects – Take responsibility for AI solutions that address real-world challenges in multi-domain operations (maritime, land, air, space, and cyberspace).
Ensure top-tier quality and security – You’ll be handling classified information and mission-critical systems, requiring both innovation and adherence to military-grade security standards.
Collaborate and engage with end users – Your work will directly impact defense operations, so understanding real-world applications is crucial.


This role is perfect for someone who is eager to take on responsibility, think outside the box, and be part of a team that values both skill and dedication.

Bring your world class expertise into play

Mindset And Team Culture


You believe in teamwork and thrive in an environment built on mutual trust and collaboration.
You take ownership of your work, embracing challenges with a problem-solving mindset.
You are motivated by the impact of your work and excited about developing solutions that truly matter.
You enjoy an informal but professional work culture where ideas are shared, and learning is continuous.


Education & Experience


A degree in Engineering, Physics, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
Strong technical skills, including proficiency in statistical analysis, machine learning algorithms, and AI/ML frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Experience with AI/ML deployment, programming (Python), data manipulation, and visualization tools.
Familiarity with Linux environments and containerization tools such as Docker.


Most importantly, we value passion and creativity – if you have funny hobby projects or unique experiences, we want to hear about them!

At Terma, you will be part of a company that not only pushes technological boundaries but also values its people. We are committed to creating an inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and empowered to contribute. If you are ready to take on exciting challenges, grow professionally, and be part of a team that makes a difference, we encourage you to apply.

Let’s build the future of defense technology together!

______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Benefits At Terma

At Terma, we prioritize the well-being of our employees, ensuring they are well taken care of. Joining our team comes with a multitude of perks designed to enhance your social life, cultural experiences, and health.

Development Opportunities: Benefit from a personalized development plan, access to our e-learning program, and specific career courses.

International Environment: Explore career opportunities with colleagues around the world.

Flexible Working Hours: Enjoy the opportunity to work flexible and the option to work from home up to two days per week. Internet connection at home is paid by Terma.

Comprehensive Benefits Package: Receive a 10% paid pension along with a beneficial health care and insurance package. Enjoy discounts from various business partners.

Well-being Perks: Opportunity to enroll in our on-site massage-offer

Social and Professional Events: Participate in various events including sports and talks, and join our book club, bicycle club, student network, wine club, motorcycle club, and more.

Competence networking across professional experts in Terma: Professional presentations and knowledge sharing across the organization

______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

We encourage all individuals to apply for our job openings, as we are dedicated to fostering a diverse, equitable, inclusive, and welcoming workplace. Our commitment to these DEIB principles means we value and celebrate the unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences of each team member. We strive to ensure that every employee has equal opportunities to succeed, feels respected and valued, and experiences a strong sense of belonging within our organization.

We encourage you to leave out photo, age, and name.

We do not expect you to write an application, but please send us a motivated resume. To ensure that your application will reach us and is properly processed, we only accept applications via www.terma.com. Applications will be processed continuously.

______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Any unanswered questions?

Feel free to contact Hiring Manager on this e-mail: MJLA@terma.com in case of any further questions regarding this position.

Bear in mind that candidates for this position must be able to obtain a security clearance by the Danish Defense Intelligence Service. This entails that the candidate, as a minimum, have stayed within NATO/EU for the last 7 years only interrupted by short stays abroad.

The Denmark based high-tech Terma Group develops products and systems for defense and non-defense security applications, including command and control systems, radar systems, self-protection systems for aircraft, space technology, and aerostructures for the aircraft industry. TERMA | Allies in innovation

The high-tech and innovative Terma Group develops products and systems for defense, non-defense and security applications, including command and control systems, radar systems, self-protection systems for aircraft and vessels, space technology, and aerostructures for the aircraft industry.

Headquartered in Aarhus, Denmark, Terma has subsidiaries and operations across Europe, in the Middle East, in Asia Pacific as well as a wholly-owned U.S. subsidiary, Terma Inc., with offices in Washington D.C., Georgia and Texas.

Application Deadline

As soon as possible

Title: Data Scientist, Denmark - BCG X
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

As a Data Scientist and Senior Data Scientist, you'll be part of our rapidly growing team. You'll have the chance to apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across a variety of industries to drive significant business impact. You'll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions.

Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X. Successful candidates are intellectually curious builders who are biased toward action, scrappy, and communicative.

We Are Looking For Talented Individuals With a Passion For Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research And Transforming Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following


Comfortable in a client-facing role with the ambition to lead teams
Likes to distill complex results or processes into simple, clear visualizations
Explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner
Love building things and are comfortable working with modern development tools and writing code collaboratively (bonus points if you have a software development or DevOps experience)
Significant experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data
Deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and can translate this into business implications for our clients
Have strong project management skills


#BCGXjob

What You'll Bring

Technologies

Programming Languages: Python

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

Title: DATA SCIENCE CONSULTANT COPENHAGEN
Description:
Currently hiring for a September 2025 start date.




Role:




Statistical data processing (Data Mining)
Artificial Intelligence (AI), including generative AI
Predictive modeling using Machine Learning and Data Science techniques
Time-series modeling (ARIMA and panel data models) and simulation models (Monte Carlo)
Development, validation and audit of financial, risk, marketing and business-oriented models
R&D projects




Requirements:




Recent graduates or final year students.
Should desirably have knowledge of Artificial Intelligence modeling techniques (logit, GLM, time series, random forests, clustering, XGBoost), statistical programming languages (SAS, R, Python, Matlab), big data tools and platforms (Hadoop, Hive, etc.) and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).
Solid academic record.
Strong computer skills.
Postgraduate studies and/or specialized courses are an asset, especially in Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Quantitative Finance or similar.
Knowledge of other languages is desirable.
Get-up-and-go attitude, maturity, responsibility and strong work ethic.
Strong ability to learn quickly.
Able to integrate easily into multidisciplinary teams.




What we offer:




We offer you the possibility to join a firm that provides all you need to develop your talent to the fullest:




Working in the highest-profile consulting projects in the industry,
for the largest companies, leaders of their respective markets,
alongside top industry management as they face challenges at the national and global level,
as part of an extraordinary team of professionals whose values and corporate culture are a benchmark for the industry




Training:

Ongoing training plan, with approximately 10% of business turnover spent on training.
Specialist knowledge courses, external expert courses, professional skills courses and language courses.
Last year our staff as a whole received over 350,000 hours of training spanning more than 150 courses.




Career plan:

Clearly defined career plan.
Internal promotion based solely on merit.
Partnership-based management model offers all professionals the opportunity to become part of the Firm’s group of partners




Complementary experiences:




University: we maintain a close relationship with the world’s most prestigious universities.
Social Action: we organize more than 30 community support activities.
Sports Club: internal and external tournaments.




How to apply:




If you are interested in our offer, please complete our application form online at https://www.managementsolutions.com/en/professional-careers-send-us-your-cv

  • Strong ability to learn quickly.
  • Able to integrate easily into multidisciplinary teams.


What we offer:


We offer you the possibility to join a firm that provides all you need to develop your talent to the fullest:


  • Working in the highest-profile consulting projects in the industry,
  • for the largest companies, leaders of their respective markets,
  • alongside top industry management as they face challenges at the national and global level,
  • as part of an extraordinary team of professionals whose values and corporate culture are a benchmark for the industry


Training:

  • Ongoing training plan, with approximately 10% of business turnover spent on training.
  • Specialist knowledge courses, external expert courses, professional skills courses and language courses.
  • Last year our staff as a whole received over 350,000 hours of training spanning more than 150 courses.


Career plan:

  • Clearly defined career plan.
  • Internal promotion based solely on merit.
  • Partnership-based management model offers all professionals the opportunity to become part of the Firm’s group of partners


Complementary experiences:


  • University: we maintain a close relationship with the world’s most prestigious universities.
  • Social Action: we organize more than 30 community support activities.
  • Sports Club: internal and external tournaments.


How to apply:


If you are interested in our offer, please complete our application form online at https://www.managementsolutions.com/en/professional-careers-send-us-your-cv

Title: AI/ML Engineering Manager
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Our vision is to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. We are well on our way—but there’s still an exciting journey ahead. Join us at the heart of trust.

Engineering Manager

Calling All Transformative Engineering Managers!

Are you a natural leader with a passion for empowering teams and driving operational excellence in AI and machine learning? Whether you come from a ML/AI engineering, data engineering or software engineering background, Trustpilot is looking for a driven Engineering Manager to lead our AI Platform team!

The Mission Awaits

As an Engineering Manager at Trustpilot, you’ll lead a team focused on building and maintaining the infrastructure, tools, and processes that enable scalable, reliable, and efficient AI and ML operations. Your leadership will be key in defining and evolving best practices for deploying, monitoring, and managing AI and ML models in production. Your technical expertise and leadership will shape the future of AI and ML operations at Trustpilot.

Your Role As An Engineering Manager


Lead, mentor, and inspire a team of engineers, fostering a collaborative and high-performance environment.
Drive the team’s technical vision, ensuring alignment with business goals and best practices in AI and ML operations.
Own the delivery process, ensuring initiatives are implemented on time and to the highest standards of quality, scalability, security, and reliability.
Identify opportunities for process improvement, removing roadblocks and driving innovation in how we productionise AI and ML models.
Support career growth for your team, creating pathways for learning and development, and providing regular feedback.
Collaborate with Data Science, Platform, and Product teams to ensure AI and ML models are deployed, monitored, and maintained effectively.
Promote best practices in model deployment, observability, CI/CD for ML, and responsible AI principles, helping engineers embed these into their workflows.
Oversee the development and implementation of scalable AI and ML pipelines, ensuring efficient experimentation, versioning, and monitoring of models.
Partner with other engineering and product leaders to shape Trustpilot’s overall AI and ML strategy while fostering cross-functional collaboration.
Champion operational excellence in AI and ML, ensuring models are reliable, reproducible, and continuously improved.


Ideal Qualifications


Experience managing and leading ML/AI Ops, Data platform or software engineering teams.
Strong technical background as a ML, Data, Software Engineer or a Data Scientist.
Strong understanding of engineering principles and a willingness to learn and work with AI and ML operational challenges.
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills, able to navigate complex technical and business challenges and turn them into actionable goals.
A passion for building teams and coaching engineers to grow in their careers, whether from an AI, ML, data, or software background.


Our Commitment To Diversity & Inclusion

At Trustpilot we want to create a strong feeling of belonging, for every Trustie, where you don’t feel like you have to ‘fit in’, you can just be you, your really awesome self. A place where you’re treated fairly, your perspective is valued, and you’re empowered to do the best work of your life. Trustpilot is committed to this vision. We want to be a part of creating a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive world of work for all. Join us in breaking barriers and reshaping the tech industry!


A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
Competitive compensation package + bonus
25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy, LinkedIn Learning, and Blinkist
Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
Paid parental leave
Central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It’s complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
Employee discounts to restaurants and shops


Still not sure?

We are Open to All, which means we want everyone to feel like they can see themselves at Trustpilot. We're keen to hear about your experiences as well as how you can help to create a fantastic culture for our amazing Trusties. So, don't worry if you're looking at this job description and feel like you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

About Us

Trustpilot began in 2007 with a simple yet powerful idea that is more relevant today than ever — to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. Trustpilot is open, independent, and impartial — we help consumers make the right choices and businesses to build trust, grow and improve.

Today, we have more than 300 million reviews and 64 million monthly active users on average across the globe, with 140 billion annual Trustbox impressions, and the numbers keep growing. We have more than 1,000 employees and we’re headquartered in Copenhagen, with operations in Amsterdam, Denver, Edinburgh, Hamburg, London, Melbourne, Milan and New York.

We’re driven by connection. It’s at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh –– it’s built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be the universal symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations worldwide and over 50 nationalities, we’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose to help people and businesses help each other is a tall order, but we keep it real. We’re a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense. A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you –– we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you’re ready to grow, let’s go.

Join us at the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive and where different viewpoints and experiences are valued and respected. Trustpilot will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, religious beliefs, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, neurodiversity, disability, age, parental or veteran status. Together, we are the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is a global company and our data practices are designed to ensure that your personally identifiable information is appropriately protected. Please note that your personal information will be transferred, accessed, and stored globally as necessary for the uses and disclosures stated in our Privacy Policy.

Title: Machine Learning Researcher
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Imagine working with cutting-edge machine learning models, crunching high frequency data sets and sparring with exceptional and fun colleagues, all while taking part in scaling our business even further.

Does this sound highly appealing to you? Then you might be our new Machine Learning Researcher at Alipes Capital.

At Alipes Capital, we have been the market leader in automating the financial markets since we started back in 2008, shaping a fully automatic natural language processing system for reading and interpreting financial news.

To accomplish our mission of being the best at what we do, we understand the importance of elevating our predictive modeling standards to the highest levels. Your work will involve leading the efforts in creating a world class modeling workflow, enabling the team to seamlessly turn massive data sets of financial information into mathematical models that accurately predict movements in the financial markets.

In doing so, you will get a chance to tackle a variety of software infrastructure challenges, such as:

Development and optimization of calibration and benchmarking frameworks

Building out and implementing best practices for data preparation and dataset generation pipelines

Prototyping and releasing novel predictive architectures, especially with respect to time-series models.

You will get instant validation of your work and experience short feedback cycles, where going from inception to deployment can be a matter of hours. There will be no red tape to cut and no sales people to consult.

About the team

All of this will happen in an informal atmosphere where technical discussions are valued, and you are encouraged to take ownership of, and pride in, your work. You will impact the direction of the team, prioritize your work and choose the tools that get the job done. We are a tight-knit modeling team with fourteen passionate quantitative researchers covering 6 nationalities – eleven PhD’s and three MSc’s with expertise in statistical analysis, mathematical modeling and machine learning. We enjoy collaboration and are always willing to lend a helping hand. We are working alongside two other teams of software developers and traders that implement and conceive the mathematical models together with us. What makes this constellation work great is that all of the individual team members write code and understand that a seemingly trivial change can actually require a lot of work, and vice versa.

About you


Fluency within mathematics and statistics

Experience working with the full Machine Learning stack from data generation through model calibration and real-life validation and monitoring

Programming experience with Python, in particular data-wrangling and numerical programming

Proficiency with computer science fundamentals

A scientific and inquisitive mind

Nice to have

Experience working with ‘out-of-core’ datasets

Experience working with tools like PyTorch, Tensorflow, XGBoost and/or Catboost

Programming experience with languages like C# and C/C++

PhD or MSc degree in engineering, physics, computer science, mathematics or economics

What we can offer you

Flat hierarchy and high levels of trust and autonomy

Exciting problems to solve

Collaborative team made up of really smart and curious people

Nice office in Nordhavn with a hybrid work model

Pension, Health Insurance and 30 days of vacation

Practicalities

To apply, please send us your CV and, in lieu of providing a cover letter, concisely answer the questions on the application. If your profile looks like a good match, we will get in touch to coordinate an online technical test as a first step in the interview process.


Should you have questions about the role that you would like clarified before applying, you're welcome to send an email to quant_jobs@alipescapital.com. Please note that applications should not be sent to the email address but rather via the job link. 

Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist i AI & Data Innovation
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Hvem er vi hos AI & Data Innovation

AI & Data Innovation er en del af Operational Excellence i Danica, og vi er dedikeret til at støtte forretningsvækst og effektivitet gennem AI- og datadrevne løsninger. Vi arbejder tæt sammen med forskellige afdelinger for at identificere muligheder for AI og datainnovation og sikre, at vores løsninger opfylder regulatoriske og forretningsmæssige krav. Vores fokus ligger på at levere effektfulde løsninger, der imødekommer behov inden for livs- og pensionssektoren.

Hvordan ser teamet ud

Vores team, AI & Data Innovation, arbejder målrettet på at identificere, udvikle og implementere innovative AI-løsninger, der forbedrer forretningsprocesser og skaber værdi for Danica. Vi spiller en central rolle i at fremme AI-agendaen og samarbejder tæt med teams på tværs af organisationen, herunder kolleger i Indien, for at skabe integrerede løsninger, der understøtter forretningsenheder og kundebehov. Vores team er dynamisk og samarbejdende, hvor erfaringsudveksling og konstant læring er centrale elementer. Vi værdsætter en uformel omgangstone, hvor arbejde kombineres med socialt samvær.

Hvordan ser rollen ud?

Som Data Scientist hos AI & Data Innovation vil du spille en central rolle i at fremme AI-agendaen. Du vil være med til at identificere og evaluere nye AI-muligheder inden for forretningsområderne. Dine primære ansvarsområder vil hertil inkludere:


Udvikle Proof of Concepts (POCs) for at demonstrere værdien af AI i forretningsprocesser, samt udarbejde nødvendig dokumentation og identificere skalerbarhed.
Sikre god datakvalitet i samarbejde med forretningsområderne.
Samarbejde med vores indiske kolleger i udvikling og implementering af vores AI- og dataløsninger i forretningen.
Dyrke stærke relationer med dataspecialister og forretningseksperter på tværs af organisationen.
Kommunikere resultater og fund til interessenter
Holde teamet opdateret med de seneste teknologiske fremskridt inden for AI.


Hvem leder vi efter?

Vi søger en motiveret erfaren Data Scientist, der har relevant erhvervserfaring med anvendelse af ML-modeller og gerne GenAI-modeller i forretningsprocesser. Du har en videregående uddannelse inden for relevante områder og en interesse for de nyeste teknologier inden for ML og AI. Analytiske færdigheder og nysgerrighed er essentielle for at udforske nye tilgange og se tingene udefra med et ML og AI perspektiv. Hertil leder vi efter en kandidat med følgende kvalifikationer:


3+ års erfaring inden for advanced analytics eller data science (fordelagtigt indenfor finans- eller forsikringsbranchen).
Erfaring med at udvikle POCs for at demonstrere værdien i AI
Du kan forklare tekniske aspekter for aktører på alle niveauer og er proaktiv og løsningsorienteret, med en stærk interesse for innovation og teknologi.
Du er struktureret og fokuseret på at anvende de rette værktøjer, med evnen til at forstå både detaljen og helheden.
Stærk erfaring med Python og fortrolig med SQL
Tidligere erfaring med cloud-tjenester som AWS vil være en stor fordel
Evne til at kommunikere effektivt på engelsk.


Har vi fanget din interesse?

Send dit CV og ansøgning snarest, da vi løbende afholder interviews. Har du spørgsmål til rollen, er du velkommen til at kontakte Thomas Mogensen Dyerberg, Head of AI & Data Innovation, på telefon +45 31 18 44 48 eller via e-mail på tmd@danicapension.dk.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist & Machine Learning Engineer, Tryg Privat
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Vi udvider vores forretningsorienterede Data Science & AI Modelling-team i Trygs privatforretning. Derfor søger vi nye kollegaer med baggrund som Data Scientist, Machine Learning Engineer eller Softwareudvikler. Vi leder efter personer med stærke kompetencer inden for modellering, machine learning, data og softwareudvikling, som også har lyst til et tæt samarbejde med forretningen omkring udvikling, implementering og anvendelse af vores modeller for at optimere salg og styrke fastholdelsen af vores kunder.

Om rollen | Understøt kunderejsen i Tryg

I din nye rolle, vil du sammen med teamet udvikle full-stack løsninger, der typisk baserer sig på moderne anvendt statistik og machine learning-algoritmer. Du vil få berøring med flere dele af værdikæden, herunder at identificere behov, bygge business cases, etablere datagrundlag, modellere, implementere, monitorere og lave effektmålinger.

Mere konkret vil du og teamet arbejde med:


Churn-modellering og fastholdelse
Lead-generering og produktanbefaling
Optimering af salg, f.eks. "Next Best Offer" samt tilhørende databehandling og datamodellering samt opbygning af software-infrastruktur hertil.


Uanset din baggrund, får du mulighed for at præge dine arbejdsopgaver i en retning, hvor de skaber størst forretningsværdi og dine kompetencer udnyttes på bedste vis. Vi mener nemlig, at de bedste løsninger opstår i tæt samarbejde med forretningen. Derfor er en vigtig del af jobbet også at kommunikere direkte med stakeholders i forretningen for at forstå deres processer og udfordringer, så du kan hjælpe med at yde effektiv beslutningsstøtte og understøtte den gode kundeoplevelse.

Vores tech-stack inkluderer en række forskellige teknologier, som du vil arbejde med, heriblandt:


Virtuelle maskiner i Azure
Kafka, Mongo- og SQL-databaser
Docker og Kubernetes
En Python-baseret kodebase i Gitlab


Output fra vores løsninger distribueres typisk til produktionssystemer via web services. Vores analytiske platform er under løbende udvikling, hvilket betyder, at du skal være parat til at håndtere udfordringer inden for data, værktøjer og infrastruktur. Vi er dog godt på vej i den rigtige retning og ser frem til at fortsætte denne udvikling med din hjælp.

Om dig | Kompetent, erfaren og forretningsorienteret

Din baggrund kan både være som Data Scientist med erfaring i at bygge machine learning-applikationer i en forretningskontekst, eller som Machine Learning Engineer eller Softwareudvikler med erfaring inden for data science området. Det vigtigste er, at du trives med forretningsdialog og besidder gode kommunikationskompetencer, så du kan formidle dine idéer og sikre en god forståelse mellem analyse og forretning. Derudover, har du en interesse i Trygs forretning, systemer og processer, da det kræver et godt domænekendskab for at kunne levere værdiskabende modeller og løsninger.

Vi forventer, at du har:


Stærke data- og modelleringskompetencer kombineret med et godt forretningsmindset
Praktisk erfaring med implementering af data pipelines og machine learning-modeller i produktion, og især i Engineer-rollen erfaring med at opbygge infrastruktur hertil.
Bred viden indenfor statistiske metoder, herunder machine learning-modeller, neurale netværk, boosting metoder, A/B-testing og overlevelsesanalyse især i Data Scientist-rollen.
En relevant uddannelsesbaggrund i machine learning, statistik, matematik, økonomi, datalogi, IT eller lignende.


Derudover er det en fordel, hvis du har:


Erfaring med følgende sprog, pakker og værktøjer, som vi anvender: Python, SQL, NO-SQL, Gitlab, Kafka, MongoDB, Kubernetes, Docker, Azure, Linux, Cloud Computing, Webservices, Jupyterlab, PyTorch og Sci-kit Learn.
Interesse i GDPR, AI act, dataetik m.v. således at du kan sikre en stærk compliance i dit arbejde.


Da vi er ved at udvide teamet, har vi mulighed for at være fleksible med sammensætningen af kompetencer og profiler i teamet, så uddyb gerne hvilken del af profilen du brænder for og kan bidrage med.

Om os | Et stærkt analysemiljø

Du bliver en del af vores Data Science & AI Modelling-team, som er placeret tæt på forretningen i Technical Excellence i Trygs privatforretning. Foruden Data Science & AI Modelling består Technical Excellence af vores Portfolio Management- og Pricing teams, hvor vi har mange års erfaring med at arbejde med data og modeller i en forretningskontekst. Derudover bliver du en del af et stærkt fagligt netværk på tværs af Trygs forretningsområder.

Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!

Hvis du har spørgsmål, er du velkommen til at kontakte leder af Technical Excellence, Bjørn Sandqvist på bjoern.sandqvist@tryg.dk eller +45 21753879, eller leder af Data Science & AI Modelling afdelingen, Tobias Sommer Thune på tobias.thune@tryg.dk. Vi opfordrer dig til at søge hurtigst muligt, da vi afslutter rekrutteringsprocessen, når de rette kandidater er fundet.

Ansøgningsfrist: 18. april 2025.

Diversitet & inklusion skaber et stærkere Tryg

Vi mener, at mangfoldighed i tankegang er afgørende for vores fremtidige succes, og vi ønsker at afspejle det samfund, vi er en del af. Derfor arbejder vi målrettet på at sikre en mangfoldig og inkluderende arbejdsplads, hvor du føler dig respekteret, kan være dig selv og har lige muligheder for at udvikle dig og gøre karriere.

Vi opfordrer derfor alle, uanset køn, alder, oprindelse eller baggrund, til at søge stillingen.

Læs mere om, hvordan det er at arbejde i Tryg

Sammen om din karriereudvikling

Hos Tryg har vi høj medarbejdertilfredshed og et stærkt tværfagligt miljø med gode karrieremuligheder. Udvikling og læring er en konstant proces hos os, og vi ønsker, at du vokser og udvikler dig sammen med os.

Uanset om du vil udvide dine faglige kompetencer, tage næste skridt i karrieren eller udforske nye områder, støtter vi dig på din udviklingsrejse.

Udforsk dine muligheder her

Er vores kendetegn også dine?

Vis tillid

Hos Tryg bygger vi på hinandens tillid, når vi bevæger os ud på ukendt grund som morgendagens tryghedsskaber. Vi tror på, at tillid og frihed under ansvar motiverer din nysgerrighed og dit mod til at gå nye veje. Du får ledere og kolleger, der lægger vægt på både trivsel og resultater.

Hos Tryg oplever du en kultur, der bygger på tillid, ansvar og udvikling hele vejen rundt..

Tag ansvar

Når du starter i Tryg, vil du hurtigt opdage, at ansvar er noget, der fylder. Jo mere ansvar, du vil have, jo mere får du, når du viser, at du kan leve op til det.

Her får du mandat til at udforske nye muligheder, koncepter og løsninger, der skaber tryghed for kunder, kollegaer og samfund i dag og i morgen.

Skab udvikling

I Tryg går du forrest og skaber udviklingen sammen med dine kolleger. Det kræver både mod, vilje og evnen til at gå nye veje. Her tør vi tage chancer, og det giver dig frihed til at forfølge dine idéer og skabe noget nyt.

Det giver store muligheder for dig, som kan, vil og tør sætte tryk på din egen og på Trygs udvikling.
Show more

Derfor søger vi nye kollegaer med baggrund som Data Scientist, Machine Learning Engineer eller Softwareudvikler. Vi leder efter personer med stærke kompetencer inden for modellering, machine learning, data og softwareudvikling, som også har lyst til et tæt samarbejde med forretningen omkring udvikling, implementering og anvendelse af vores modeller for at optimere salg og styrke fastholdelsen af vores kunder.

Title: AI/ML Engineering Manager
Description:
Engineering Manager

Calling All Transformative Engineering Managers!

Are you a natural leader with a passion for empowering teams and driving operational excellence in AI and machine learning? Whether you come from a ML/AI engineering, data engineering or software engineering background, Trustpilot is looking for a driven Engineering Manager to lead our AI Platform team!




The Mission Awaits:

As an Engineering Manager at Trustpilot, you’ll lead a team focused on building and maintaining the infrastructure, tools, and processes that enable scalable, reliable, and efficient AI and ML operations. Your leadership will be key in defining and evolving best practices for deploying, monitoring, and managing AI and ML models in production. Your technical expertise and leadership will shape the future of AI and ML operations at Trustpilot.




Your role as an Engineering Manager:

Lead, mentor, and inspire a team of engineers, fostering a collaborative and high-performance environment.
Drive the team’s technical vision, ensuring alignment with business goals and best practices in AI and ML operations.
Own the delivery process, ensuring initiatives are implemented on time and to the highest standards of quality, scalability, security, and reliability.
Identify opportunities for process improvement, removing roadblocks and driving innovation in how we productionise AI and ML models.
Support career growth for your team, creating pathways for learning and development, and providing regular feedback.
Collaborate with Data Science, Platform, and Product teams to ensure AI and ML models are deployed, monitored, and maintained effectively.
Promote best practices in model deployment, observability, CI/CD for ML, and responsible AI principles, helping engineers embed these into their workflows.
Oversee the development and implementation of scalable AI and ML pipelines, ensuring efficient experimentation, versioning, and monitoring of models.
Partner with other engineering and product leaders to shape Trustpilot’s overall AI and ML strategy while fostering cross-functional collaboration.
Champion operational excellence in AI and ML, ensuring models are reliable, reproducible, and continuously improved.




Ideal Qualifications:

Experience managing and leading ML/AI Ops, Data platform or software engineering teams.
Strong technical background as a ML, Data, Software Engineer or a Data Scientist.
Strong understanding of engineering principles and a willingness to learn and work with AI and ML operational challenges.
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills, able to navigate complex technical and business challenges and turn them into actionable goals.
A passion for building teams and coaching engineers to grow in their careers, whether from an AI, ML, data, or software background.




Our Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:

At Trustpilot we want to create a strong feeling of belonging, for every Trustie, where you don’t feel like you have to ‘fit in’, you can just be you, your really awesome self. A place where you’re treated fairly, your perspective is valued, and you’re empowered to do the best work of your life. Trustpilot is committed to this vision. We want to be a part of creating a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive world of work for all. Join us in breaking barriers and reshaping the tech industry!




What’s in it for you:

A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
Competitive compensation package + bonus
25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy, LinkedIn Learning, and Blinkist
Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
Paid parental leave
Central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It’s complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
Employee discounts to restaurants and shops




Still not sure?

We are Open to All, which means we want everyone to feel like they can see themselves at Trustpilot. We're keen to hear about your experiences as well as how you can help to create a fantastic culture for our amazing Trusties. So, don't worry if you're looking at this job description and feel like you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

Show more

Title: Graduate Program 2025 - Data Science & Analytics
Place: Ballerup Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you looking to kick off your career journey?

Do you like the idea of joining the European PayTech?




If so, you are at the right place!




Our graduate program offers you the chance to create your unique career path within our diverse international team, operating in more than 25 countries. Rotate among different departments, learn from experienced professionals, and make a difference by working on real business cases.




About the program

Our Graduate Program is more than a learning path - it's a journey where you will work on real business cases and have a direct impact on business results.




What can you expect?

Permanent position in one of the business departments from the start of your employment.
Two rotations between different business departments during the 12-month program.
Project Management and Communication training path after the first six months.
Continuous learning and skill improvement through structured training sessions at our Digital PayTech University.
Opportunity to develop business ideas, implement them, and build your network of stakeholders within a group of highly skilled business leaders from all over Europe.




Exciting Opportunities in Data Science and Analytics

As part of our Data Science and Analytics team, you will contribute to data-driven decision-making in the Paytech industry. You'll work in positions such as Data Scientist, Data Engineer, and BI Data Engineer.




In this department, you'll analyse large datasets, transform data into insights, develop predictive models, and create data visualisations to support business strategies. This role offers the opportunity to work with cutting-edge tools and technologies, enhancing your analytical skills and significantly impacting our company's success.




As part of our selection process, the top candidates will be invited to participate in an exciting hackathon at our office location. This is a fantastic opportunity to showcase your skills, collaborate with peers, and potentially secure a spot on our team. Stay tuned for more details!




What makes you stand out as the ideal participant for this program?

If you see yourself in the description that follows, you should definitely take the first step and apply!

You have a master's degree in Engineering, STEM or Economics & Business, graduated within the last 12 months or will graduate in 2025.
You are a career starter with no more than one year of working experience.
You are fluent in English and in the local language of the country you are applying for (any additional language is beneficial).
You can easily imagine working in an international environment and actively collaborating with colleagues from all over Europe (if you have study or work-related international experience from abroad, that will be considered a beneficial qualification).
You are committed to your work, have an exciting university career with proven great results, enjoy learning new things, feel confident to own projects by yourself and like being part of a team.
For you, formal training is a starting point - you always look for more and want to make a difference in everything you work on.




Apply Now!

Don't miss out on this amazing opportunity. Apply today and discover what's in it for you!




We are committed to creating a diverse culture where talents from all walks of life can feel like they truly belong. By applying to our Graduate Program, you're one step closer to joining us.




We're excited to learn more about you!

Show more

Title: Machine Learning/AI konsulenter
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Er du konsulent med erfaring i Machine Learning/AI, og er du bosiddende i Danmark, med minimum 5 års professionel erfaring fra IT relaterede projekter ude hos kunder, og har du ikke før haft kontakt med os, så kunne et partnerskab med emagine måske være interessant for dig?

emagine er et high-end konsulenthus med hovedkvarter i København, der leverer skræddersyede ydelser og ekspertise ved brug af et netværk af ekspertkonsulenter.

Som freelance konsulent kan du blive inddraget i opgaver, enten som ekspertrådgiver, som en del af et emagine team, eller som en betroet konsulent ude på opgave i en af vores kunders organisation.

I Danmark har vi kontorer i København, Aarhus og Aalborg, med over 900 konsulenter ude på opgaver lige nu. I Europa har vi over 5.000 konsulenter på opgave.

Tilmeld dig vores database og få muligheden for at arbejde med nogle af de mest innovative virksomheder i branchen.

At blive medlem af vores konsulentdatabase har mange fordele, herunder:


Adgang til en bred vifte af projekter med internationale virksomheder, så du kan anvende dine færdigheder og ekspertise til projekter, der betyder noget.
Opgaver, der matcher dine færdigheder og ekspertise, hvilket sikrer, at du arbejder på projekter, der stemmer overens med dine styrker.
Kurser og kompetenceudvikling på alle niveauer med særlig erfaring inden for undervisning i projekt- program- og porteføljeledelse.
Muligheder for at udvide din portefølje af projekter og fremme din karriere


Som konsulent med Machine Learning/AI kompetencer, bør du have erfaring med en del af følgende:


Artifical Intelligence (AI)
Machine Learning (ML)
Retrieval-augmented generation (RAG)
Python
Deep Learning
SQL
Neurale Netværk
Large Language Model (LLM)
Microsoft Azure AI Studio
AutoGen
Docker
R
Algoritmer
NLP Engineering
Kubernetes

Title: Principal Data Scientist - AI & Data Science
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Er du passioneret omkring AI og Machine Learning? Vil du være med til at løse kritiske forretningsudfordringer med innovative løsninger? Vi søger en erfaren Principal Data Scientist, der kan drive AI- og ML-projekter fra koncept til produktion og fungere som teknisk leder for vores voksende team.

Om rollen

Som Principal Data Scientist vil du fungere som en seniorressource på kundeprojekter, hvor du arbejder hands-on med at forstå forretningskontekster, designe, bygge og evaluere AI- og ML-systemer. Du vil arbejde tæt sammen med forretningsinteressenter, data science-teamet og vores softwareudviklere for at skabe værdiskabende løsninger.

I rollen vil du have en vigtig teknisk lederfunktion, men uden direkte personaleansvar. Du vil derimod være en central sparringspartner og mentor for teamet, sætte strategiske retninger og etablere best practices for data science-udvikling.

Dine ansvarsområder


Forstå kunders forretningskontekster og omsætte forretningsbehov til tekniske løsninger.
Designe, bygge og evaluere AI- og ML-systemer, der løser konkrete forretningsudfordringer.
Samarbejde tæt med softwareudviklingsteamet om implementering og CI/CD-processer.
Lede end-to-end udviklingen af data science-projekter fra koncept til produktion.
Påvirke strategi og etablere best practices for data science-udvikling.
Yde teknisk mentorskab til junior data scientists.
Kommunikere komplekse tekniske resultater til både tekniske og ikke-tekniske interessenter.


Minimumskvalifikationer


Videregående uddannelse inden for Statistik, Datalogi, Matematik eller et relateret felt.
Flere års erfaring inden for data science, inklusiv erfaring i en senior rolle.
Ekspertviden om statistisk modellering, ML og datamanipulation.
Stærke færdigheder i Python, SQL og en bred data science værktøjskasse.
Flydende dansk - både skriftligt og mundtligt, da vi arbejder med Generative AI-projekter på dansk.
Dokumenteret erfaring med at bygge og implementere ML-modeller i produktionsmiljøer.
Evne til at omsætte forretningsbehov til tekniske løsninger.
Grundlæggende kendskab til CI/CD og softwareudviklingsprocesser.


Foretrukne kvalifikationer


Erfaring med SAP AI (via BTP eller SAP Business AI).
Erfaring med AI-tjenester via Azure eller andre hyperscalere.
Kendskab til CI/CD og MLOps-processer.
Erfaring med Generative AI og LLM-teknologier.
Konsulenterfaring med kundekontakt og projektstyring.


Hvad vi tilbyder


En mulighed for at arbejde med cutting-edge AI-løsninger i en innovativ og dynamisk organisation.
En kultur, hvor faglig sparring, læring og innovation er i fokus.
Mulighed for at påvirke strategien og etablere best practices inden for data science.
Fleksible arbejdsforhold og mulighed for hjemmearbejde.
Et team af dygtige og engagerede kolleger, der brænder for AI og ML.


Vil du være med?

Er du klar til at lede transformative projekter sammen med et af de mest innovative teams inden for dokumenthåndtering og forretningsoptimering? Send os et par ord om dig selv sammen med dit CV – vi vender tilbage hurtigst muligt! Vi beder venligst om, at du ikke inkluderer et billede i dit CV. Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!

Har du spørgsmål?

Hvis Du Har Spørgsmål Til Stillingen Eller NTT DATA Business Solutions Som Arbejdsplads, Er Du Velkommen Til At Kontakte

Mikkel Boel Faurby

Talent Attraction & Development Consultant

📧 Email: Mikkel.Faurby@nttdata.com

📞 Telefon: +45 26 86 88 07

Om NTT DATA Business Solutions

NTT DATA er anerkendt som en Global Top Employer i både 2024 og 2025!

NTT DATA Business Solutions er en international og hastigt voksende IT-virksomhed og en af verdens førende SAP-partnere. Vi leverer alt fra rådgivning til implementering af SAP-løsninger – herunder drift og support. I Norden beskæftiger vi ca. 500 medarbejdere fordelt på kontorer i Danmark, Norge, Sverige og Finland.

Mens verden taler om digital transformation, er vi i fuld gang med at transformere os selv og vores kunder. For os er AI, AR, VR, IoT, robotteknologi, droner, blockchain-teknologi og 3D-print ikke bare buzzwords – de er en del af vores virkelighed. Disse teknologier integreres løbende i vores løsninger, og vi stræber efter at dække det hele.

Title: R/D Assistant
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Us

REDUCED is committed to producing high-quality, upcycled savory taste solutions. REDUCED is looking for a dedicated Intern, the focus of the role will be to carry out different fermentation trials and perform chemical and microbiological analysis of the products obtained from these trials.

Position Overview

You’ll be pivotal in executing and organizing fermentation trials in a BSL-2 microbiological laboratory, and microbiological and chemical analysis (enzymatic assays, HPLC and GC-MS). The role requires that you have in-depth microbiological knowledge, knowledge of good microbiological practices, and fermentation.

Key Responsibilities


Plan, design, and execute fermentation trials. You need to be able to carry out these tasks autonomously making sure to have a correct set-up and correct controls. You need to be organised, plan well and in advance. You need to work in a sterile environment, and avoid any contamination. You need to know how to prepare micrbiological media, assess microbial growth via plate counting, and OD measurements, and have a basic microscopy knowledge.
Carry out chemicals and microbiological analysis. You need to prepare samples for enzymatic assays, HPLC and GC-MS analysis. This can involve sample preparation such as correct dilution, filtration, manual derivatisation, preparation of mobile phases and chemicals needed for these analysis. You need to be able to prepare microbiological media, and work in a BSL-2 lab


Who We’re Looking For

You are structured with a sharp eye for detail, you are analytical, and operate in an organised manner. You ensure your safety and safety of the samples you produce. You work tidly, keep good track of the protocols, samples, and data deriving from various trials and analysis you execute. You are a fast learner and enjoy working in the lab.

The Ideal Candidate Has The Following Qualifications


Minimum a Bachelor’s degree in Food Science, Microbiology, Molecular Biology, or related discipline.
Strong knowledge of microbiology and food microbiology.
Knowledge of statistical analysis (e.g., Excel, Rstudio, MatLab, Pyton).
Fluent in English.


Personal Attributes


Strong drive and adaptability suited for a dynamic R&D workplace.
Good with numbers and classic microbiological calculations
Enjoys practical work as well as data analysis.
Good at planning and working in a structured manner.
Independent and proactive attitude.
Excited to learn new things.
Not afraid to try and fail


Reports To: Fermentation Scientist

Apply Now!

If you’re ready to take on this challenge at REDUCED and work in a cool and dynamic setting, we’d love to hear from you!
Show more

Title: Data Scientist, Computer Vision
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Data Scientist in our Computer Vision section, you will develop and deploy deep learning models to improve the understanding, alignment and correspondence between 3D models of the construction site and video data gathered using our vSLAM system. As part of an R&D team, you will work on discovery of new solutions through research and rapid prototyping, and translating the findings into delivery of high quality solutions to complex computer vision problems.

Your background

We believe you…


Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
Have a hands-on experience with software development using C++, Python or C#. It is important that you have reached solid coding standards and strive for continuous improvement.
Have a machine learning experience or trained in the area. Hands-on experience with PyTorch and MLFlow is a plus.
Have computer vision experience or trained in the area. Hands-on experience with OpenCV is a plus.
Can work both independently and as part of a team.


Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our machine learning solutions.

Our tech...


C++
OpenGL
Python
PyTorch
MLFlow
Kubernetes


We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

What To Expect As a Daluxian

In our organization the way from idea to product is short, combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.

You will become a part of a highly skilled team of passionate individuals driven by the wish to explore new and reshape existing technologies. As Dalux is a software company, we want half of the company to consist of Software Developers. All our software development happens at our head office at Vibenshuset in Copenhagen.

We offer...


Central location in Copenhagen, focus on work/life balance without any overtime, and no dress code.
An active social environment with monthly events and social clubs.
Flat communication in our organization, where the way from idea to product is short combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.
You’ll join a highly specialized, international team with room for creativity and professional growth.
Strong focus on diversity and inclusion – your ideas are heard, and opportunities are available to all.
Attractive employee benefits such as health insurance, lunch plan, coffee and fruit, free fitness facilities, and parking garage.
Focus on your development and well-being, with support for both professional goals and personal growth.


Ready for the next step

If Dalux sounds like a place where you could develop and contribute to the high-quality software, we would gladly accept your application. We will be having ongoing interviews.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Simone Jena Berg Christensen.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Dalux’ products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the world’s 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. Our user-friendly digital tools and Building Information Modelling-technology (also known as BIM) is used in more than 160 countries globally.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Application deadline:

Ongoing

Title: Machine Learning Engineer, Computer Vision
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:

Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Machine Learning Engineer in our Computer Vision section, you will be a key part in delivery of the solutions into production. You will participate in the full lifecycle of the ML systems we build, while spearheading the model deployment, performance monitoring and maintenance, to ensure the reproducibility of our experiments and traceability of our pipelines in production. As part of the R&D team, you will be expected to keep up to date with the state-of-the-art in the ML/CV area as well as new techniques and processes.
