Attractive employee benefits such as health insurance, lunch plan, coffee and fruit, free fitness facilities, and parking garage.
Focus on your development and well-being, with support for both professional goals and personal growth.


Ready for the next step

If Dalux sounds like a place where you could develop and contribute to the high-quality software, we would gladly accept your application. We will be having ongoing interviews.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Simone Jena Berg Christensen.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Dalux’ products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the world’s 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. Our user-friendly digital tools and Building Information Modelling-technology (also known as BIM) is used in more than 160 countries globally.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Application deadline:

Ongoing
Show more
HTML:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Machine Learning Engineer in our Computer Vision section, you will be a key part in delivery of the solutions into production. You will participate in the full lifecycle of the ML systems we build, while spearheading the model deployment, performance monitoring and maintenance, to ensure the reproducibility of our experiments and traceability of our pipelines in production. As part of the R&D team, you will be expected to keep up to date with the state-of-the-art in the ML/CV area as well as new techniques and processes.

Your background

We believe you…

  • Have 3+ years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, MLOps Engineer, or similar.
  • Have a proven track record of bringing machine learning models to production.
  • Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
  • Can work both independently and as part of a team.

Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our machine learning solutions.

Our tech...

  • Python
  • PyTorch
  • C++
  • OpenCV
  • AWS
  • MLFlow
  • Kubernetes

We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

What To Expect As a Daluxian

In our organization the way from idea to product is short, combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.

You will become a part of a highly skilled team of passionate individuals driven by the wish to explore new and reshape existing technologies. As Dalux is a software company, we want half of the company to consist of Software Developers. All our software development happens at our head office at Vibenshuset in Copenhagen.

We offer...

  • Central location in Copenhagen, focus on work/life balance without any overtime, and no dress code.
  • An active social environment with monthly events and social clubs.
  • Flat communication in our organization, where the way from idea to product is short combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.
  • You’ll join a highly specialized, international team with room for creativity and professional growth.
  • Strong focus on diversity and inclusion – your ideas are heard, and opportunities are available to all.
  • Attractive employee benefits such as health insurance, lunch plan, coffee and fruit, free fitness facilities, and parking garage.
  • Focus on your development and well-being, with support for both professional goals and personal growth.

Ready for the next step

If Dalux sounds like a place where you could develop and contribute to the high-quality software, we would gladly accept your application. We will be having ongoing interviews.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Simone Jena Berg Christensen.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Dalux’ products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the world’s 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Title: AI Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Amsterdam, Rotterdam, Copenhagen hybrid




DEPT®/AI has a single mission: to make the best work in the industry using AI to enhance everything we do. This role sits within our Global Data & AI practice, which has deep expertise in leveraging AI. The team includes data strategists, consultants, data scientists and analysts that work alongside DEPT® teams around the world across different services – from commerce, to full-funnel media, content engineering to internal operations. You will be solving some of the hardest and most challenging problems facing some of the best loved brands in the world – and doing this alongside an experienced team.




Job Purpose

We are seeking for a talented and passionate Mid-Level AI Engineer to join our growing team. As an AI Engineer, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and deploying innovative AI solutions for our clients across various industries. You will collaborate with a team of experts to solve complex business challenges using cutting-edge AI technologies.




Key Responsibilities

Design and architect solutions using state-of-the-art frameworks and cloud technologies
Build machine learning models for marketing attribution, predicting customer propensity, segmenting customer groups based on behavioural data, and recommending products and/or content.
Fine-tune Large Language Models to business-specific use cases.
Deploy MLOps pipelines together with our ML engineers.
Work closely with data engineers, fellow data scientists/AI engineers and consultants to ensure seamless integration and deployment of AI solutions that create business impact.
Communicate with clients about complex solutions in an understandable way, deliver progress reports and demonstrations of AI solutions.




What We Are Looking For

Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Information Management, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in AI development.
Strong understanding of machine learning, deep learning, and other AI techniques.
Proficiency in Python and relevant AI libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Experience with data processing and analysis tools (e.g., Pandas, SQL).
Experienced with cloud platforms such as Amazon Web Services, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform.
Ability to work with version control systems (e.g., Git).
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills.
Direct availability to start working in the Netherlands or Denmark.

Nice to have:

Experience with natural language processing (NLP) or computer vision (CV).
Knowledge of MLOps and model deployment pipelines.
Familiarity with AI ethics and responsible AI principles.
Experience working with large datasets and distributed computing.
Contributions to open-source AI projects.




WE OFFER:

The benefits depend upon the location where you apply from, so feel free to check with the recruiter.
A flexible, hybrid working policy (2 days from the office, depending on location).
Social and Cultural Events, plenty of opportunities to connect with colleagues through organised activities and celebrations.
Inspirational Talks, bringing the outside in with regular guest speakers and events.
Learning and Development, supporting your growth with continuous opportunities to learn and advance.
Buddy Programme: You will be paired with a ‘Buddy’ to help you through your first weeks’ at DEPT®.
A reputation for doing good. DEPT® has been a Certified B Corp® since 2021 and named ‘Agency of the Year’ at both The Lovies and The Webby Awards.
Awesome clients. Whether big or small, local or global — at DEPT® you’ll get the opportunity to work with clients of all sizes and across all industries. And we celebrate all of our successes together!
The opportunity for possibility. We want to enable you to do what you do best and help you develop your skills further with training, development and certifications.
Global annual DEPT® Cares Month in which employees come together and donate their skills to support local charities.




WHO ARE WE?

We are pioneers at heart. What does that mean? We are always looking forward, thinking of what we can create tomorrow that does not exist today. We were born digital and we are a new model of agency, with a deep skillset in tech and marketing. That’s why we hire curious, self-driven, talented people who never stop innovating.




Our culture is big enough to cope and small enough to care. Meaning, that with people across 30+ countries, we’re big enough to provide you with the best tools, global opportunities, and benefits that help you thrive. While acting small by investing in you, your growth, and your team, and giving you the autonomy to solve our client's problems, no matter where you are in the world.




DEPT® is committed to making a positive impact on the planet and since 2021 has been Climate Neutral and B Corporation certified.




DIVERSITY, EQUITY & INCLUSION

At DEPT®, we take pride in creating an inclusive workplace where everyone has an equal opportunity to thrive. We actively seek to recruit, develop, nurture, and retain talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, with varying skills and perspectives.




Not sure you meet all qualifications? Apply, and let us decide! Research shows that women and members of underrepresented groups tend not to apply for jobs when they think they may not meet every requirement, when in fact they do. We believe in giving everyone a fair chance to shine.




We also encourage you to reach out to us and discuss any reasonable adjustments we can make to support you throughout the recruitment process and your time with us.

Want to know more about our dedication to diversity, equity, and inclusion? Check out our efforts here.

Title: Seeking a Process Data Scientist to our Process Science Analytics Team
Place: Hillerød, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for a Process Data Scientist to help us translate our manufacturing and supporting processes pain points, into first class Manufacturing Intelligence Use Cases via data analytics /science. If you thrive by being a key stakeholder in establishing the site’s process data, then you just might be a great colleague to our highly skilled Process Analytics organization.

Your New Role

The Process Data Scientist is a critical role within FUJIFILM Diosynth Biotechnologies Denmark (FDBD) as the business is expanding and we are introducing new technologies, programs, and customers continuously – with data excellence being one of the mission enablers. We will provide ongoing support to our new site in Holly Springs, NC, USA.

You will be a key stakeholder in establishing the site’s process data usage and analytics value chain, whilst being the owner of already validated monitoring applications, e.g., an electronic chromatogram review setup and machine learning batch performance models. We continuously strive to identify opportunities to improve internal systems and practices, as well as provide direction and development of digital/data offerings to our partners.

Your Primary Tasks Will Be


Support process investigations, root cause analysis, optimization with data support and analysis
Process Analytics systems support to manufacturing across all product modalities
Develop, validate, and deploy ETL pipelines and help build the process data ecosystem
Support process trending, continued process verification (CPV) and annual product reviews (APQR)
Support development of applications with models for process characterization and scale-up/out
Develop, validate, and deploy multivariate batch monitoring models
Support innovation and systems improvement initiatives in the Process Analytics space



The Skills & Knowledge We Hope You Possess


You have a master’s degree in in a relevant science or engineering discipline (i.e., Engineering, Bioinformatics or similar) with 2 years of industry experience or a Bachelors in the same area with 4 years of industry experience.
You have working-knowledge of SQL and a solid understanding of data science and the Python data science ecosystem (NumPy, SciPy, pandas, Scikit-learn, Jupyter Notebook).
Familiarity with SIMCA-online, TIBCO Statistica, Visual Basic and Git version control are a plus.
It would be considered an advantage if you also have GMP experience, having worked on delivering GxP applications.



We value candidates who are naturally curious, greet people with a smile, and possess a can-do attitude. You demonstrate humility and respect for those around you. As someone who is pragmatic and structured, you have a keen focus on quality and enjoy working independently. You are proactive in dynamic entrepreneurial environments. Most importantly, you possess strong communication skills and appreciate the support of a cross-functional team.

The team

The Process Analytics team is embedded in the Process Science (PS) organization and provide leadership and subject matter expertise to existing production-ready process data business processes, while also seeking to develop and introduce new Manufacturing Intelligence in clinical, PPQ and commercial processes primarily in the large-scale Cell Culture manufacturing.

We are a growing team of highly professional dedicated scientists/engineers with data management and data science expertise - but also broad experience within pharmaceutical development and manufacturing of monoclonal antibodies.

The work environment is international and informal. The role is based in our Hillerød, Denmark location, and we offer a flexible work arrangement where a defined number of working hours can be carried out in the employee’s home.

We keep a high pace and focus on a vital work life balance while having fun. We put a strong emphasis on psychological safety through trust and empowerment within our teams and hope that this is something that speaks to you as well.

Application

Has this sparked your interest, then please upload your CV and cover letter as soon as possible, as we screen candidates on a continuous basis and call in for interviews.

The Company

FUJIFILM Diosynth Biotechnologies is an industry-leading Biologics Contract Development and Manufacturing Organization (CDMO) with locations in Hillerød, Denmark, Teesside, UK, RTP, North Carolina and College Station, Texas, USA. We use our skills, dedication, and ambition to enable impact for the world’s most innovative biotech and biopharma companies reimagining healthcare’s potential. We work across the entire lifecycle of our customers’ products – enabling success throughout. Every cure, vaccine, biologic, and advancement we contribute to starts with our people and our passion. We fuel one another’s passion, help accelerate progress, expand capabilities, strengthen innovation, and improve processes to improve lives.

We offer the chance to be part of a global workplace where passion, drive and commitment are met with opportunities for professional and personal development. Deeply committed to diversity and inclusion, we ensure that everyone no matter their background or gender has an opportunity to develop. We take pride in enriching our communities, caring for our environment, and cultivating a world of opportunity for future generations.

We aim to foster a collaborative, innovative and rewarding environment, where diverse perspectives and people come together united by a common purpose and shared values. We pursue our fullest potential as individual contributors and team members. We strive to be the employer of choice and offer a competitive compensation and benefit package.

FUJIFILM Diosynth Biotechnologies Denmark (FDBD) is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identify or any other protected class.

To all agencies: Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee of FUJIFILM about this requisition. All resumes submitted by search firms/employment agencies to any employee at FUJIFILM via-email, the internet or in any form and/or method will be deemed the sole property of FUJIFILM, unless such search firms/employment agencies were engaged by FUJIFILM for this requisition and a valid agreement with FUJIFILM is in place. In the event a candidate who was submitted outside of the FUJIFILM agency engagement process is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid.

Title: IT Platform Engineer for MLOps (Machine Learning) Area
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

In Data Science Platform Squad, we Build and maintain a generic, scalable and govern platform for Data Science model of online models to enable an automated, compliant and efficient Model Life Cycle process. We use technologies like Open-Shift to build Containerized platform for Hosting Model execution & Deployment.

Our squad is responsible for hosting Python statistical and machine learning models, primarily serving the Data Science communities who develop these models on behalf of various enterprise domains within the bank. We manage AAPF (Advanced Analytical Platform for Fraud), which works alongside CMDEP (Containerized Management Deployment and Execution platform) to execute machine learning models for scoring payment transactions for fraud, including e-banking domestic/international and District International models deployed in CMDEP. Additionally, we are tasked with transforming the current On-Prem infrastructure into a Cloud-Native platform.

As a MLOps IT Platform Engineer, you will work closely with the Product Owner and Chapter Lead in a “2 in a box” model, using agile methodologies. You will be responsible to develop and maintain scalable ML pipelines on futured MLOps platform built on AWS and Databricks. You will be tasked with ensuring seamless and automated transition of models from development to production using CICD workflows, implement the infrastructure as code. You will ensure that our machine learning models operate reliably, efficiently and at scale.

You will:


Implement automated pipelines for model training, validation and inference
Build and maintain CI/CD workflows using Github actions to ensure model code is versioned and seamlessly deployed to production
Utilize tools like MLflow for model tracking, versioning and deployment
Use terraform to provision and manage scalable secure infrastructure required for ML workloads
Leverage docker containers to build, deploy and manage containerized ML models


About you:


Minimum of 2 years of practical experience in MLOps platform to build model development deployment, execution and maintenance of ML pipelines
In-depth knowledge of AWS services and Databricks
Proficiency in Python, Pyspark
Experience in CI/CD tools Terraform and container orchestration
Problem-solving and debugging skills
Understanding and practical experience with PubSub and Kafka streaming services would be beneficial
Upper-Intermediate English skills


“We believe that the most valuable asset is human potential.”

We offer:

If you are hired in Lithuania, the applicable salary range will be from 3280 EUR to 4920 EUR gross (based on your competencies relevant for the job).

Additionally, each Danske Bank employee receives employee benefits package which includes:


Growth opportunities: professional & supportive team, e-learnings, numerous development programs; (incl. professional certificates); 100+ professions for internal mobility opportunities.
Health & Well-being: a diverse, inclusive, work & life balance work environment; additional health insurance; mental well-being practices; partial psychologist counselling compensation; silence and sleep zones at the office; game rooms.
Hybrid working conditions: Work from home up to two days a week; home office budget (after the probation period); modern Danske Campus workplace developed with anthropologist for the best employee experience.
Additional days of leave: for rest, health, volunteering, exams in higher education institutions, and other important activities. Moreover, for seniority with Danske Bank.
Monetary compensation package: accidents & critical diseases insurance; financial support in case of unfortunate events, travel insurance; IIIrd Pillar Pension Fund contribution.


See all the benefits HERE.

Your title in job contract will be IT Platform Engineer.

If you're interested in this role and joining my team, feel free to contact me - Dinesh Chaudhari via LinkedIn or email dinc@danskebank.dk, and I will answer your questions!

#DK

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

  • Growth opportunities: professional & supportive team, e-learnings, numerous development programs; (incl. professional certificates); 100+ professions for internal mobility opportunities.
  • Health & Well-being: a diverse, inclusive, work & life balance work environment; additional health insurance; mental well-being practices; partial psychologist counselling compensation; silence and sleep zones at the office; game rooms.
  • Hybrid working conditions: Work from home up to two days a week; home office budget (after the probation period); modern Danske Campus workplace developed with anthropologist for the best employee experience.
  • Additional days of leave: for rest, health, volunteering, exams in higher education institutions, and other important activities. Moreover, for seniority with Danske Bank.
  • Monetary compensation package: accidents & critical diseases insurance; financial support in case of unfortunate events, travel insurance; IIIrd Pillar Pension Fund contribution.

See all the benefits HERE.

Your title in job contract will be IT Platform Engineer.

If you're interested in this role and joining my team, feel free to contact me - Dinesh Chaudhari via LinkedIn or email dinc@danskebank.dk, and I will answer your questions!

#DK

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

Title: Research Scientist
Place: Måløv, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about development and documentation of analytical methods for future diabetes, bleeding disorders, obesity, and rare disease products? And do you thrive in an open, dynamic, and collaborative environment where scientific expertise and stakeholder management are paramount?

If so, you might be our next Research Scientist in the development teams. Apply today!

The Position
As Research Scientist within the development team, you will be joining a dedicated team of experienced colleagues, including scientists and laboratory technicians. Your role will involve the analytical development and optimization of methods for drug substances and injectable products, with a specific focus on chromatographic methods (HPLC/UHPLC).

As our new Research Scientist, you will:



Plan and coordinate experiments for method development and document the results
Act as the responsible analytical person in the projects, closely collaborating with project managers, scientists and technicians across the organisation
Take responsibility for ensuring that analytical equipment is fully functioning
Troubleshoot analytical equipment and methods
Collaborate with colleagues to contribute to the ongoing optimization, automation, and digitalization of processes and systems




Qualifications

As our ideal candidate, you have:



A Master’s degree in Life Sciences (Pharmacy, Engineering, or related discipline) along with a PhD or equivalent experience
Experience in HPLC/UHPLC and/or LC-MS analytical development within the pharmaceutical industry
Profound knowledge of general protein chemistry and a natural flair for thinking in new digital and automated solutions
Stakeholder management as a part of your DNA




Experience with analysis at CMOs are an advantageFluency in both written and spoken English is required, while proficiency in Danish is a plus. As a person you have a positive and open-minded approach, which is helpful in an ever-changing project environment. You have a natural way of establishing new networks and strong communication skills that allow you to build fruitful relations to both colleagues and stakeholders. Finally, you are a team player and contribute to reaching our team goals.

About The Department

The CMC Analytical Development is an integral part of CMC Analysis and Characterisation, located in Novo Nordisk Park, Måløv, greater Copenhagen. The department comprises four highly skilled analytical teams with a total of 86 employees, divided into two analysis teams and two development teams. The analysis teams are responsible for all GMP activities, including analysing all in-process, drug substance, and drug product samples during development. The development teams, for which the available position is intended, are responsible for all analytical development activities. The analytical platform in department primarily utilizes HPLC/UHPLC, iCIEF, CE-SDS, and LC-MS.

Providing analytical support to all parts of Novo Nordisk, the department acts as link between the Research and Product Supply, spanning from early development to phase 3 clinical trials and registration. The responsibility for the analytical support across the organisation also means that stakeholder management is a key focus in the department.

Working at Novo Nordisk
We are a proud life-science company, and life is our reason to exist. We’re inspired by life in all its forms and shapes, ups and downs, opportunities and challenges. For employees at Novo Nordisk, life means many things – from the building blocks of life that form the basis of ground-breaking scientific research, to our rich personal lives that motivate and energise us to perform our best at work. Ultimately, life is why we’re all here - to ensure that people can lead a life independent of chronic disease.

Contact
For further information, please contact Christina Grønberg +45 30 77 75 64

Deadline
21 April 2025

Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis. To ensure an efficient and fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your CV.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Drive meaningful change

At our Data & Analytics department, we specialize in data visualizations, BI tools, analytical consulting, statistics, forecasting, and modern data platforms. Working closely with various departments across Abacus, we combine our analytical expertise with a deep understanding of pharmaceutical markets—from product development to delivery.


We believe that robust Data Science and AI can give Abacus Medicine a competitive edge, uncovering trends and behaviors that drive smarter decision-making. Our advanced machine learning techniques transform complex market data into actionable forecasts. Join us on our growth journey and help shape the future of the pharmaceutical industry.

Get a glimpse of our world
The Data Science team consists of five highly skilled professionals, all dedicated to improving access to medicines by delivering critical data and insights that drive informed decision-making.

In this role, you will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams—including data analysts, data engineers, product managers, and key business stakeholders—to develop scalable, data-driven solutions that scale.

Are you ready to embark on this journey with us?

As a Senior Data Scientist, you will play a key role in developing and deploying machine learning models that power business insights and operational efficiencies and support tactical and strategic decision-making across Abacus Medicine.

Your responsibilities will include:

Proactively identify potential data science applications for value creation.
Design, develop, and deploy advanced models, including machine learning, deep learning, and algorithmic solutions, to solve complex business problems.
Analyze datasets to generate actionable insights, ensuring data-driven decision-making.
Design and maintain scalable MLOps pipelines for seamless model deployment, monitoring, and lifecycle management.
Promote best practices in Data Science by optimizing workflows and expanding the DS/ML toolbox with tools that enhance model accuracy, runtime, and maintainability.
Strengthen our technical infrastructure by integrating modern technologies that enhance efficiency, scalability, and long-term maintainability.
Drive innovation by evaluating and integrating emerging ML/AI methodologies, including LLMs, to enhance model performance.
Translate complex model results into actionable insights for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Share expertise through mentoring, knowledge sharing, and sparring sessions.
Helping shape the data science strategy and contributing to the broader Data & Analytics roadmap.

Fuel for your success in the role

We imagine you have:

Master’s degree in a data science-related field (e.g., computer science, cognitive science, IT, mathematics/statistics, economics).
3+ years of experience in applied data science, with a strong focus on machine learning and predictive modeling.
Advanced Python programming skills.
Expertise in supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques.
Proficient in Data Science skills – ML frameworks (scikit-learn, deep learning frameworks), data wrangling, data analysis, and visualization.
Proficient in the following technologies: MLOps and model deployment, Cloud platform (e.g. Azure/AWS), mlflow, SQL, Spark, ETL processes, CI/CD processes, Linux commands, Web APIs, Git.
Excellent English communication skills with the ability to present complex data clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
Show genuine care for both team dynamics and the success of the organization, fostering a positive and inclusive work culture.

Preferred qualifications:
Databricks environment for building, deploying and managing ML models.
Leveraging LLMs for enhancing the performance of ML models through prompt engineering and embedding extraction


Interested?

If you want to apply for the position, please follow the link and attach your CV and cover letter.

If you have any further questions about the role, please do not hesitate to contact the hiring manager,
Mihai Popovici, Advanced Analytics, Data Science & Tech Lead at mihai.popovici@abacusmedicine.com


Would you like to know more about us?

Follow us on Instagram and LinkedIn and get an insight into everyday life at Abacus Medicine. For job openings, check our Career page.


Moving Healthcare. Moving You.

In Abacus Medicine Group, you’ll experience the power of Moving Healthcare. With our change mindset, we're moving the industry and improving healthcare as we broaden access to medicine.

But it's not just about moving healthcare, it's about Moving You. You’ll be part of a caring community of more than 1,300 people across the World. With us, you will be valued, empowered, and have a direct impact on driving change. Let's access the future of medicine and make a difference together. Your move.

Kindly note that the position will remain open until we have identified the right candidates, at which point the job advertisement will be taken down. Therefore, we encourage interested applicants to submit their applications as soon as possible

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Kongens Lyngby, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
En personlig hilsen til “dig” – vores kommende teammedlem

Lad os spole et år frem: Vi er samlet som team for at fejre de imponerende resultater, vi har skabt sammen. De virksomhedskunder, vi samarbejder med – virksomheder inden for retail, utilities og manufacturing – deler deres historier om, hvordan vores løsninger har transformeret deres forretning, øget effektiviteten og skabt nye vækstmuligheder.




Du har været kernen i disse resultater. Du har leveret projekter med stor effekt, strømlinet komplekse processer og opbygget tillid hos vores kunder. Undervejs har du udviklet dine tekniske og rådgivningsmæssige kompetencer – hvad enten det er gennem avancerede machine learning-teknikker, evnen til at omsætte data til strategiske indsigter eller håndtering af de unikke udfordringer ved vores enterprisekunder.




Dine problemløsningsevner og innovative idéer har ikke kun skabt succes for kunderne, men også bidraget til vækst og inspiration i vores team. I dag fejrer vi ikke kun vores resultater; vi fejrer vores rejse, vores team og den banebrydende forskel, vi har skabt for alle vores kunder – sammen.




English version below




Din hverdag i Inspari

Vi brænder for at drive datadrevet transformation for vores enterprisekunder inden for retail, utilities & manufacturing. Vi fokuserer på at optimere processer og skabe målbare resultater gennem banebrydende AI- og Data Science-løsninger.




Vi tror på at give vores teams ejerskab og ansvar som selvstændige konsulenter. Vores projekter spænder fra at optimere forsyningskæder til at forbedre kundeoplevelser – alle med avancerede Data Science- og AI-teknikker som omdrejningspunkt.




Rollen

Som Senior Data Scientist får du en nøglerolle i at forme og levere avancerede løsninger til vores enterprisekunder. Du vil samarbejde tæt med kundernes interessenter for at forstå deres processer, identificere optimeringsmuligheder og implementere modeller og strategier, der skaber forretningsværdi.




Ansvarsområder og opgaver

Som erfaren konsulent og Data Scientist i Inspari vil din rolle være at drive alle faser i ML-projekter. Det indebærer b.la.:

Samarbejde med vores enterprisekunder om at identificere og forstå deres forretningsmæssige udfordringer.
Designe og implementere machine learning-modeller, algoritmer og datadrevne strategier for at optimere processer og styrke beslutningstagning.
Omsætte komplekse dataindsigter til konkrete anbefalinger for ikke-tekniske interessenter.
Lede projektteams og sikre rettidig levering af løsninger i høj kvalitet.
Agere som betroet rådgiver og guide kunder på deres datadrevne transformationsrejse.
Være mentor for yngre teammedlemmer og fremme en kultur for læring og vækst.
Ansvar for eget budget og bidrage til teamets udvikling og vækst.




Dine kvalifikationer

Vi ønsker os, at du har:

Erfaring: Minimum 5 års erfaring inden for data science eller lignende, gerne fra konsulent- eller enterprisevirksomheder.
Teknisk ekspertise: Solid erfaring med Python-programmering. Kendskab til vores primære biblioteker som Pandas, PySpark, MLFlow, scikit-learn og Dash er en fordel. Erfaring med eller grundlæggende viden om Cloud-tjenester som Microsoft Azure, Azure Machine Learning, Azure Databricks, Microsoft Fabric, Data Lake og Blob.
Forretningsforståelse: Evne til at forstå og optimere forretningsprocesser inden for retail, utility eller manufacturing.
Konsulentfærdigheder: Stærke kommunikations- og samarbejdsevner samt erfaring med kundekontakt.
Selvstændighed: Evne til at arbejde selvstændigt og lede projekter fra ide til levering.




Bemærk venligst: Hvis ovenstående lyder interessant, og du kommer med relevant erfaring til at løfte ansvaret og opgaverne, så vil vi meget gerne undersøge dine muligheder hos os.




Din tjekliste

Generelt er du godt på vej, hvis du tilmed kan genkende dig selv i nedenstående linjer:




Du er passioneret omkring nye teknologier orienteret mod Data Science & AI.
Du motiveres af at rådgive og lave tekniske løsninger for vores kunder, der optimerer deres dagligdag.
Du stortrives i arbejdet med at indsamle og klargøre data, som du kan analysere, modellere og formidle.
Du inspirerers af at indgå og bidrage i et fagligt fakultet, hvor vi i fællesskab løfter hinandens kompetenceniveau til fordel for kunder lige så vel vores egen trivsel.
Du er ambitiøs og kan lide en dynamisk arbejdsuge, hvor du får en bred eksponering til kunder og forskellige løsninger.
Du har lyst til at fortælle vidt og bredt om de mange muligheder, der åbner sig inden for DS/AI i disse år.




Hvad vi tilbyder

Et dynamisk og samarbejdsorienteret arbejdsmiljø med fokus på innovation og effekt.
Mulighed for at arbejde på forskellige projekter med stor betydning for førende enterprisevirksomheder.
En stærk kultur for faglig udvikling med adgang til træning, mentorordninger og karriereudvikling.
Konkurrencedygtig løn og attraktive personalegoder.
At blive en del af vores unikke Heartwork kultur hvor ambitioner og forventninger går hånd i hånd med passion og holdånd.




Lokation: Du tilknyttes vores kontor i Kgs. Lyngby med en hybrid arbejdsmodel.




Rejseaktivitet: Du skal forvente, at der kan være en vis rejseaktivitet.




Send os dit CV og en ansøgning:

Vi vil gerne høre om et projekt, hvor du har skabt målbar forretningsmæssig indflydelse ved hjælp af data science-teknikker.




English version:




A personal note to “You?” our future team member

Fast forward a year: We’re gathered as a team, celebrating the remarkable successes we’ve achieved together. The enterprise clients we’ve partnered with—leaders in retail, utilities, and manufacturing—are sharing how our solutions have reshaped their operations, increased efficiency, and unlocked new opportunities for growth.




You’ve been at the heart of these successes. You’ve delivered impactful projects, streamlined complex processes, and built trust with clients. Along the way, you’ve honed your technical and consulting skills—whether mastering advanced machine learning techniques, refining your ability to turn data into strategic insights, or navigating the unique challenges of enterprise-level consulting.




Your problem-solving and innovative ideas have not only driven client success but also inspired growth within our team. And today, we’re not just celebrating results; we’re celebrating our team, the journey and the pioneering difference we’ve have made for all our customers - together.




About Us

We are dedicated to driving data-driven transformation for enterprise clients in retail, utilities, and manufacturing. Our focus is on optimizing processes and delivering measurable impact through cutting-edge AI and Data Science solutions.

We believe in empowering our teams to take ownership and act as self-driven consultants. Our projects range from optimizing supply chains to enhancing customer experiences—all leveraging advanced Data Science and AI techniques.




The Role

As a Senior Data Scientist, you will play a pivotal role in shaping and delivering cutting-edge solutions for our enterprise customers. You’ll work closely with client stakeholders to understand their processes, identify opportunities for optimization, and implement models and strategies that drive business results.




Key Responsibilities

Collaborate with enterprise customers to identify and understand their business challenges.
Design and implement machine learning models, algorithms, and data-driven strategies to optimize processes and enhance decision-making.
Translate complex data insights into actionable recommendations for non-technical stakeholders.
Lead project teams, ensuring timely delivery of high-quality solutions.
Act as a trusted advisor, guiding clients through their data-driven transformation journey.
Mentor junior team members, fostering a culture of learning and growth.
Your own budget and achieving it, as well as contributing to the involvement and employment of others




What We’re Looking For

Experience: 5+ years in data science or similar, preferably in consultancy or enterprise settings.
Technical Expertise: Extensive experience with Python programming. Familiarity with some of our primary libraries is an advantage: Pandas, PySpark, MLFlow, scikit-learn, Dash. Experience with/basic knowledge of Cloud services, such as Microsoft Azure, Azure Machine Learning, Azure Databricks, Microsoft Fabric, Data Lake, and Blob.
Business Acumen: Ability to understand and optimize business processes in retail, utility, or manufacturing.
Consulting Skills: Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with experience in client-facing roles.
Self-Driven: Capable of working independently and leading projects from concept to delivery.




Please note: If the above sounds interesting and you have experience that is relevant (transferable) to take on the responsibilities and tasks, we would be happy to explore your options with us.




What We Offer

A dynamic and collaborative work environment with a focus on innovation and impact.
Opportunities to work on diverse, high-impact projects with leading enterprise clients.
A strong culture of professional growth, with access to training, mentorship, and career development.
Competitive compensation and benefits package.




Location: You will be attached to our office in Kgs. Lyngby with a hybrid work model.




Travel Activity: You should expect that there may be some travel activity.




Send us your CV and a cover letter.

We’d love to hear about a project where you drove measurable business impact using data science techniques.




Med venlig hilsen/Best regards,

Steffen Krogsgaard (Talent Acquisition Director)

Inspari - a valantic company

Show more

  • Omsætte komplekse dataindsigter til konkrete anbefalinger for ikke-tekniske interessenter.
  • Lede projektteams og sikre rettidig levering af løsninger i høj kvalitet.
  • Agere som betroet rådgiver og guide kunder på deres datadrevne transformationsrejse.
  • Være mentor for yngre teammedlemmer og fremme en kultur for læring og vækst.
  • Ansvar for eget budget og bidrage til teamets udvikling og vækst.


Dine kvalifikationer

Vi ønsker os, at du har:

  • Erfaring: Minimum 5 års erfaring inden for data science eller lignende, gerne fra konsulent- eller enterprisevirksomheder.
  • Teknisk ekspertise: Solid erfaring med Python-programmering. Kendskab til vores primære biblioteker som Pandas, PySpark, MLFlow, scikit-learn og Dash er en fordel. Erfaring med eller grundlæggende viden om Cloud-tjenester som Microsoft Azure, Azure Machine Learning, Azure Databricks, Microsoft Fabric, Data Lake og Blob.
  • Forretningsforståelse: Evne til at forstå og optimere forretningsprocesser inden for retail, utility eller manufacturing.
  • Konsulentfærdigheder: Stærke kommunikations- og samarbejdsevner samt erfaring med kundekontakt.
  • Selvstændighed: Evne til at arbejde selvstændigt og lede projekter fra ide til levering.


Bemærk venligst: Hvis ovenstående lyder interessant, og du kommer med relevant erfaring til at løfte ansvaret og opgaverne, så vil vi meget gerne undersøge dine muligheder hos os.


Din tjekliste

Generelt er du godt på vej, hvis du tilmed kan genkende dig selv i nedenstående linjer:


  • Du er passioneret omkring nye teknologier orienteret mod Data Science & AI.
  • Du motiveres af at rådgive og lave tekniske løsninger for vores kunder, der optimerer deres dagligdag.
  • Du stortrives i arbejdet med at indsamle og klargøre data, som du kan analysere, modellere og formidle.
  • Du inspirerers af at indgå og bidrage i et fagligt fakultet, hvor vi i fællesskab løfter hinandens kompetenceniveau til fordel for kunder lige så vel vores egen trivsel.
  • Du er ambitiøs og kan lide en dynamisk arbejdsuge, hvor du får en bred eksponering til kunder og forskellige løsninger.
  • Du har lyst til at fortælle vidt og bredt om de mange muligheder, der åbner sig inden for DS/AI i disse år.


Hvad vi tilbyder

  • Et dynamisk og samarbejdsorienteret arbejdsmiljø med fokus på innovation og effekt.
  • Mulighed for at arbejde på forskellige projekter med stor betydning for førende enterprisevirksomheder.
  • En stærk kultur for faglig udvikling med adgang til træning, mentorordninger og karriereudvikling.
  • Konkurrencedygtig løn og attraktive personalegoder.
  • At blive en del af vores unikke Heartwork kultur hvor ambitioner og forventninger går hånd i hånd med passion og holdånd.


Lokation: Du tilknyttes vores kontor i Kgs. Lyngby med en hybrid arbejdsmodel.


Rejseaktivitet: Du skal forvente, at der kan være en vis rejseaktivitet.


Send os dit CV og en ansøgning:

Vi vil gerne høre om et projekt, hvor du har skabt målbar forretningsmæssig indflydelse ved hjælp af data science-teknikker.


English version:


A personal note to “You?” our future team member

Fast forward a year: We’re gathered as a team, celebrating the remarkable successes we’ve achieved together. The enterprise clients we’ve partnered with—leaders in retail, utilities, and manufacturing—are sharing how our solutions have reshaped their operations, increased efficiency, and unlocked new opportunities for growth.


You’ve been at the heart of these successes. You’ve delivered impactful projects, streamlined complex processes, and built trust with clients. Along the way, you’ve honed your technical and consulting skills—whether mastering advanced machine learning techniques, refining your ability to turn data into strategic insights, or navigating the unique challenges of enterprise-level consulting.


Your problem-solving and innovative ideas have not only driven client success but also inspired growth within our team. And today, we’re not just celebrating results; we’re celebrating our team, the journey and the pioneering difference we’ve have made for all our customers - together.


About Us

We are dedicated to driving data-driven transformation for enterprise clients in retail, utilities, and manufacturing. Our focus is on optimizing processes and delivering measurable impact through cutting-edge AI and Data Science solutions.

We believe in empowering our teams to take ownership and act as self-driven consultants. Our projects range from optimizing supply chains to enhancing customer experiences—all leveraging advanced Data Science and AI techniques.


The Role

As a Senior Data Scientist, you will play a pivotal role in shaping and delivering cutting-edge solutions for our enterprise customers. You’ll work closely with client stakeholders to understand their processes, identify opportunities for optimization, and implement models and strategies that drive business results.


Key Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with enterprise customers to identify and understand their business challenges.
  • Design and implement machine learning models, algorithms, and data-driven strategies to optimize processes and enhance decision-making.
  • Translate complex data insights into actionable recommendations for non-technical stakeholders.
  • Lead project teams, ensuring timely delivery of high-quality solutions.
  • Act as a trusted advisor, guiding clients through their data-driven transformation journey.
  • Mentor junior team members, fostering a culture of learning and growth.
  • Your own budget and achieving it, as well as contributing to the involvement and employment of others


What We’re Looking For

  • Experience: 5+ years in data science or similar, preferably in consultancy or enterprise settings.
  • Technical Expertise: Extensive experience with Python programming. Familiarity with some of our primary libraries is an advantage: Pandas, PySpark, MLFlow, scikit-learn, Dash. Experience with/basic knowledge of Cloud services, such as Microsoft Azure, Azure Machine Learning, Azure Databricks, Microsoft Fabric, Data Lake, and Blob.
  • Business Acumen: Ability to understand and optimize business processes in retail, utility, or manufacturing.
  • Consulting Skills: Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with experience in client-facing roles.
  • Self-Driven: Capable of working independently and leading projects from concept to delivery.


Please note: If the above sounds interesting and you have experience that is relevant (transferable) to take on the responsibilities and tasks, we would be happy to explore your options with us.


What We Offer

  • A dynamic and collaborative work environment with a focus on innovation and impact.
  • Opportunities to work on diverse, high-impact projects with leading enterprise clients.
  • A strong culture of professional growth, with access to training, mentorship, and career development.
  • Competitive compensation and benefits package.


Location: You will be attached to our office in Kgs. Lyngby with a hybrid work model.


Travel Activity: You should expect that there may be some travel activity.


Send us your CV and a cover letter.

We’d love to hear about a project where you drove measurable business impact using data science techniques.


Med venlig hilsen/Best regards,

Steffen Krogsgaard (Talent Acquisition Director)

Inspari - a valantic company

Title: 3D Vision Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Us

At Teton, we are redefining the role of healthcare workers through cutting-edge AI technology. Facing a global nursing shortage, our solutions offer vital support to overburdened health systems. We distinguish ourselves by focusing relentlessly on product excellence and user experience, rapidly deploying solutions that make a real difference.

At this stage of our company we require a physical presence in our office in Copenhagen, Denmark. We believe this enables the fastest and most efficient iteration cycles to build an impactful product that users love to use.

The Job

We’re looking for a dynamic and innovative 3D Vision Engineer who will transform our AI system outputs into essential tools for healthcare workers. You will play a critical role in developing new features, enhancing the core product, and lifting model detections and reasoning into 3D. Your contributions will directly impact the efficiency and effectiveness of healthcare delivery, providing much-needed support to healthcare professionals.

In this role, you will focus on the following areas of interest.


Computer vision 3D modelling
Training deep learning models for 3D understanding
Camera models, including 360 fisheye
Object detection and tracking in 3D


Qualifications


Experience with 3D modelling and camera geometry
Experience with Structure from Motion / SLAM
Solid deep learning understanding. Trained models for 3D geometry.
Python, PyTorch (experience with TensoRT is a plus)
Minimum 3 years experience
Show evidence of exceptional ability.


What We Offer


Participation in our warrant program (stock options).
Work with state-of-the-art technology in a pioneering field.
A vibrant, learning-focused work environment.
A role where you can make a significant impact on healthcare delivery.


Join Our Team

We're looking for individuals who share our vision and value ownership and entrepreneurship over a conventional job. At Teton, you'll have the chance to make a real impact with your work. If you're ready for more than just a job, come aboard and be part of our mission to transform healthcare.
Show more

Title: AI Solutions Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you an experienced professional, passionate about LLMs and NLP? Can you build production ready tools that bring value to decision-makers? If so, this is the perfect opportunity you.




What we do:

ADC is a Data & AI Consultancy committed to the responsible adoption of data and AI, driving real impact for organizations that matter. We help clients achieve their goals through data-driven solutions, with deep industry expertise.

What makes ADC unique is our impact-driven and collaborative approach. Our team is composed of top talent dedicated to leveraging their advanced data and AI expertise for the greater good. We work with our clients, not just for them, empowering pragmatic and comprehensive consultants through inclusivity, trust, and ownership. We aim to grow across Europe creating the leading data and AI consultancy. Join us on our growth journey!




What you do:

Deliver value to our clients by helping them develop the best data-driven solutions. These solutions can be strategic (e.g. companies that want to become more data-driven) and/or implementation-oriented (e.g. building AI agents, integrating AI models with clients’ systems, using AI for commercial excellence).
Translate complex business requirements into technical solutions. Align ML strategies with business objectives. Maintain strong client relationships and provide sparring on choice of solutions.
Work hands-on in the cloud: configuring/provisioning infrastructure, building CI/CD pipelines, and ensuring observability.
Collaborate with a team of professionals with whom you are building a fast-growing company.
Develop and challenge yourself during internal and external knowledge-sharing and training sessions.
Be a brand ambassador by embracing our company values: comprehensive, pragmatic, trust and ownership.




What you bring:

3-5 years of working experience in areas such as Data Science, Machine Learning, Advanced Analytics or Artificial Intelligence,
A quantitative degree (e.g., Physics, Mathematics, Econometrics, Data Science, AI, Computer Science)
Hands-on experience and understanding of processing unstructured (text) data, using NLP algorithms or LLMs
Software development skills and hands-on experience deploying to the cloud (e.g. provisioning infrastructure, CI/CD pipelines, monitoring)
Expertise in programming in Python
Consultancy experience is a big plus
Excellent command of the English language and communication skills (Danish is a big plus)




What we offer:

A steep learning curve through taking on responsibility from day one
Projects in which you can immerse yourself in challenges to make a positive impact
Freedom to realize your own initiatives and implement your ideas
A training programme focusing on your self-development, designed to transform people into trusted advisors, specialists, and ADC leaders
A knowledge-sharing culture in the form of peer groups, project presentations
Our Collective Week, a workcation with the entirety of ADC during which we work on pro bono projects and make unforgettable memories
A welcoming office space in the center of Copenhagen, with daily lunches provided by a nearby restaurant
Various social events, including Friday drinks, events, sports activities, etc.




What to do next:

If you are inspired by this opportunity, apply at the link below! For questions, please contact us at recruitment@adc-consulting.com

*ADC is an equal-opportunity employer. We value diversity and promote equality to shape a better future. No characteristics are discriminated against, as indicated in Directive 2000/78/EC. We encourage and welcome all applications. Additional arrangements or adjustments to support your application can be discussed further.

Title: Distinguished Engineer - Machine Learning (VP level)
Description:
About Us

Axelera AI is not your regular deep-tech startup. We are creating the next-generation AI platform to support anyone who wants to help advancing humanity and improve the world around us.

In just three years, we have raised a total of $120 million and have built a world-class team of 180+ employees (including 55+ PhDs with more than 40,000 citations), both remotely from 11 different countries and with offices in Belgium, Switzerland, Italy, the UK, headquartered at the High Tech Campus in Eindhoven, Netherlands.

We have also launched our Metis™ AI Platform, which achieves a 3-5x increase in efficiency and performance, and have visibility into a strong business pipeline exceeding $100 million.

Our unwavering commitment to innovation has firmly established us as a global industry pioneer.

Are you up for the challenge?

Position Overview

As a Distinguished Engineer at Axelera AI, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the company’s AI and machine learning strategy with a long-term, industry-leading perspective. You will work cross-functionally to develop transformative AI technologies, influencing company-wide initiatives, and setting new standards for engineering excellence. This role transcends traditional boundaries, requiring a visionary mindset that anticipates future industry trends and technological advancements.

Key responsibilities:


Own and deliver company-wide AI and ML initiatives with multi-year, multi-team impact, ensuring scalability and adaptability beyond current business needs.
Provide thought leadership and influence Axelera AI’s strategic direction by engaging with senior leadership, external partners, and industry consortiums.
Lead the research and development of next-generation AI and ML models, driving significant breakthroughs in efficiency, performance, and innovation.
Spearhead engineering best practices, setting a high standard for system architecture, code quality, and team processes.
Actively contribute to hiring, mentoring, and coaching senior engineers, fostering a high-performance culture that attracts top talent.
Publish research findings, contribute to industry discussions, and represent Axelera AI at conferences and external engagements.
Bridge the gap between technical capabilities and business needs by collaborating with product and business teams to define roadmaps and strategic opportunities.
Lead large-scale, high-impact projects with exceptional execution, managing ambiguity, tight deadlines, and evolving requirements.
Drive continuous improvement by leveraging industry best practices, customer insights, and cutting-edge research to enhance Axelera AI's AI/ML solutions.
Foster a strong engineering community within Axelera AI by championing hybrid/remote-first collaboration practices, inclusion, and diversity initiatives.
Partner with executive leadership to define a long-term vision for AI and ML at Axelera AI, ensuring alignment with both market demands and technical advancements.
Develop scalable solutions and frameworks that empower multiple teams, enabling efficient ML deployment across Axelera AI’s product ecosystem.
Take ownership of technical decision-making, ensuring optimal solutions for the broader organization while driving innovation and calculated risk-taking.
Model a standard of excellence, accountability, and leadership that inspires teams and influences company-wide culture and strategy.


Qualifications:


PhD in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, or related fields.
10+ years of post-PhD experience in AI/ML research and development, with a track record of leading large-scale projects and driving impactful innovations outside of academia.
Deep expertise in AI/ML frameworks, deep learning algorithms, and hardware-optimized machine learning.
Strong background in neuromorphic computing, hardware-efficient AI, or computational neuroscience is a plus.
Experience managing and mentoring senior engineers, influencing company-wide technical direction, and driving engineering excellence.
Exceptional communication skills with the ability to influence executives, engineers, and external stakeholders.
A robust and continuous (incl. last 2 years) history of contributions to academic research, open-source projects, or industry consortiums is highly desirable.


Location

We offer a flexible working arrangement, with options to:


Work from one of our Axelera AI offices (Leuven in Belgium, Amsterdam and Eindhoven in the Netherlands, Zurich in Switzerland, Florence and Milan in Italy, Paris in France or Bristol in the United Kingdom) if you're already based in the vicinity.
Work fully remotely from any European country (incl. the UK) you are already in.
Relocate from outside Europe/UK to one of the cities where we have an established office.


What We offer 

This is your chance to shape and be part of a dynamic, fast-growing, international organization. We offer an attractive compensation package, including a pension plan, extensive employee insurances and the option to get company shares. 

An open culture that supports creativity and continual innovation is awaiting you. Collaborative ownership and freedom with responsibility is characteristic for the way we act and work as a team. 

At Axelera AI, we wholeheartedly embrace equal opportunity and hold diversity in the highest regard. Our steadfast commitment is to cultivate a warm and inclusive environment that empowers and celebrates every member of our team. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds to join us in shaping the future of AI.

  • Work fully remotely from any European country (incl. the UK) you are already in.
  • Relocate from outside Europe/UK to one of the cities where we have an established office.

What We offer 

This is your chance to shape and be part of a dynamic, fast-growing, international organization. We offer an attractive compensation package, including a pension plan, extensive employee insurances and the option to get company shares. 

An open culture that supports creativity and continual innovation is awaiting you. Collaborative ownership and freedom with responsibility is characteristic for the way we act and work as a team. 

At Axelera AI, we wholeheartedly embrace equal opportunity and hold diversity in the highest regard. Our steadfast commitment is to cultivate a warm and inclusive environment that empowers and celebrates every member of our team. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds to join us in shaping the future of AI.

Title: Senior AI Scientist at Novo Nordisk Engineering
Place: Virum, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Does the idea of working with AI excite you? And do you thrive on working with data and optimising processes using AI? Then you’ll fit right in!

What do we do at NNE?

We are experts in end-to-end pharma engineering, and we design and build pharma facilities that are essential for millions of patients all over the world. Our success is built on our relationships, both with our colleagues and our customers. If you are passionate about working for a noble cause on projects shaping the future of sustainable and intelligent pharma facilities, NNE is the place to be.

About The Role

We are looking for a passionate and skilled Senior AI Scientist to join our dynamic team in this new role. We need your help to explore and implement AI in our engineering work processes so we can work smarter. We need to align and create more structure in data produced during the execution of projects and here you will have a key role.

Location Virum Department Engineering Systems

How You Might Spend Your Days

Experience Minimum 5 Years Employment Type Full Time

As a Senior AI Scientist, you’ll be:


Exploring our business to understand it and see AI possibilities
Identifying new AI initiatives and implementing them
Contributing with inputs to the VP for AI Transformation
Implementing initiatives from NNE’s AI strategy to our VP area
Staying updated with the latest AI advancements and applying new knowledge



Who You Are

We care about who you are as a person. In the end, how you work, and your energy, is what impacts the results we achieve as a team. As a person, you are:


Curious and interested in understanding the business and how we work in NNE
Able to identify and prioritize easy AI initiatives in an engineering company
Independent and thrives with freedom to find and solve the tasks on your own
A specialist with a strategic mindset



The miles you’ve walked

In all positions, there are some things that are preferred, and others, a bonus. If you do not meet all the qualifications listed below, you are welcome to offer alternative experience that you think would be valuable in this role:


A degree in IT or engineering
Experience with engineering, project management, and/or construction projects
Minimum 2 years of experience within AI technologies
Experience with Copilot and other AI technologies
Speak and write English and perhaps also Danish



Why choose NNE?

We provide a range of perks and benefits tailored to enhance your overall experience. Some highlights include:


Vibrant and project-based work environment
Collaboration and innovation-based culture
True empowerment and flexible working conditions
Inclusive environment that values diversity and equity



Unleash your potential

NNE is short for Novo Nordisk Engineering. And for all of us who work here, NNE means so much more. We are the epitome of a people business and, as such, we are dedicated to continuously developing our people. We do not expect you to know it all, and we recognize that a great onboarding experience is key. We therefore greet new colleagues with our award-nominated onboarding program, and in-house talent programs designed to keep our biggest asset – you - developed for the long-run.

Did we spark your curiosity? If you’re ready to join our passion, let’s hear from you.

Deadline of application is 13 April 2025.

Questions before applying? Please contact Senior Manager Maria Bang-Møller on +45 30 75 78 18.

At NNE, we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. To maintain fairness, we request that you refrain from including a photo in your CV.

Please note we only accept applications submitted through our online recruitment system.

You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV.

We will invite to interviews on a running basis.

To learn more about us visit www.nne.com

How You Might Spend Your Days

As a Senior AI Scientist, you’ll be:

  • Exploring our business to understand it and see AI possibilities
  • Identifying new AI initiatives and implementing them
  • Contributing with inputs to the VP for AI Transformation
  • Implementing initiatives from NNE’s AI strategy to our VP area
  • Staying updated with the latest AI advancements and applying new knowledge


Who You Are

We care about who you are as a person. In the end, how you work, and your energy, is what impacts the results we achieve as a team. As a person, you are:

  • Curious and interested in understanding the business and how we work in NNE
  • Able to identify and prioritize easy AI initiatives in an engineering company
  • Independent and thrives with freedom to find and solve the tasks on your own
  • A specialist with a strategic mindset


The miles you’ve walked

In all positions, there are some things that are preferred, and others, a bonus. If you do not meet all the qualifications listed below, you are welcome to offer alternative experience that you think would be valuable in this role:

  • A degree in IT or engineering
  • Experience with engineering, project management, and/or construction projects
  • Minimum 2 years of experience within AI technologies
  • Experience with Copilot and other AI technologies
  • Speak and write English and perhaps also Danish


Why choose NNE?

We provide a range of perks and benefits tailored to enhance your overall experience. Some highlights include:

  • Vibrant and project-based work environment
  • Collaboration and innovation-based culture
  • True empowerment and flexible working conditions
  • Inclusive environment that values diversity and equity


Unleash your potential

NNE is short for Novo Nordisk Engineering. And for all of us who work here, NNE means so much more. We are the epitome of a people business and, as such, we are dedicated to continuously developing our people. We do not expect you to know it all, and we recognize that a great onboarding experience is key. We therefore greet new colleagues with our award-nominated onboarding program, and in-house talent programs designed to keep our biggest asset – you - developed for the long-run.

Did we spark your curiosity? If you’re ready to join our passion, let’s hear from you.

 Deadline of application is 13 April 2025.

Questions before applying? Please contact Senior Manager Maria Bang-Møller on +45 30 75 78 18.

At NNE, we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. To maintain fairness, we request that you refrain from including a photo in your CV.

Please note we only accept applications submitted through our online recruitment system.

You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV.

We will invite to interviews on a running basis.

To learn more about us visit www.nne.com

Title: AI Engineer, Denmark - BCG X
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

Our AI Software Engineers and Senior AI Software Engineers are part of our rapidly growing engineering team and help to build the next generation of AI solutions. You’ll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions. Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X.

We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Software Development, Large-scale Data Analytics And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following


Apply software development practices and standards to develop robust and maintainable software
Actively involved in every part of the software development process
Experienced at guiding non-technical teams and consultants in and best practices for robust software development
Optimize and enhance computational efficiency of algorithms and software design
Motivated by a fast-paced, service-oriented environment and interacting directly with clients on new features for future product releases
Enjoy collaborating in teams to share software design and solution ideas
A natural problem-solver and intellectually curious across a breadth of industries and topics


#BCGXjob

What You'll Bring

Technologies

Programming Languages: Python

#BCGXjob

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.
