Title: Product Developer - American Football (Radar/DSP - Modelling - C++/Python)
Place: Hørsholm, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you have an interest in American Football and Signal Processing? Do you want to develop tracking algorithms used by top athletes and in TV broadcasts all around the world?  Then come and join our American Football product team!

About The Job

We’re looking for a talented and motivated developer to join our team, working on innovative products within the American football space. This is a unique opportunity to shape the future of performance tracking and data-driven insights, with a particular focus on the development of tracking technology used by elite football players and football teams.

Our technology integrates vision tracking with radar tracking to deliver precise ball data measurements throughout its entire flight. In this role, you'll be a key part of our American Football Product Development, working across various domains such as signal processing, and modelling to build innovative solutions for performance analysis and optimization. From initial concept to final development, you’ll play a crucial part in enhancing our tracking solutions, applying your expertise to create real-world applications in American football technology.

As a member of the team, you will be part of a highly-skilled team focusing on the development and optimization of our state-of-the-art tracking algorithms used to measure ball and equipment kinematics across sports. Our products combine Doppler radars and cameras, where the Radar Tracking and Signal Processing team is responsible for converting raw radar signals into accurate and meaningful data on the performance of the athlete, where after the radar data is fused with information from video feeds and other sensors. This valuable information is subsequently made accessible on the user’s mobile device for easy-to-understand feedback and analysis on performance or is used in TV broadcasting for enhancing the viewing experience or in gamification. 

Our world-leading tracking technology is utilized across many sports such as soccer, golf and baseball, and you will specifically play a significant role in enhancing our American football product solution.

Requirements

What are we looking for?

Our ideal candidate is specialized in the following areas

Requirements:


Master’s degree or Ph.D. in computer science, electrical engineering, mathematical modelling, or equivalent
Knowledge of Digital Signal Processing (DSP)
Knowledge of data modeling


We are looking for a generalist with broad skills that include the requirements above. You should be passionate about applying your knowledge to solve real-world challenges and drive product development in an exciting and fast-paced industry.

Other relevant topics include:

You will be joining a team of specialists within these fields and together we strive to remain the best in the world at what we do. Your responsibilities will include development of new and existing products and core processes based on your experience and skills.


Software development and programming skills within C++ and Python
Strong mathematical skills
Optimization algorithms
Statistical signal processing
Software development experience
Strong communication skills
Machine learning
Interested in American football


Responsibilities

Implement tracking algorithms in close collaboration with our Radar Tracking & Signal Processing team and Modelling & Analysis team.

Conduct experiments and iterative testing to compare the effectiveness of different models and approaches for our specific tasks.

Optimize models for performance, accuracy, and efficiency, ensuring they can operate effectively in real-world coaching environments.

We expect that you can work independently as well as contribute in a fast-paced, innovative environment together with highly skilled colleagues. 

The Office

We offer a great office environment and facilities in our brand-new purpose-built Trackman Innovation Center, located at DTU Science Park in Hørsholm. We take great pride in the building we designed and built! The office features bright meeting rooms, coffee areas to catch up with colleagues, a large testing arena with simulators available for employees and a fitness center, everything surrounded by a beautiful forest and respecting the environment. We made sure to utilize the newest technologies to be energy efficient and be mindful of ventilation and sound propagation.

The cherry on top is our canteen: with indoor and outdoor areas to enjoy the fresh food prepared by our own kitchen staff.

Join the home of a powerful sports brand and a one-of-a-kind technology

Our proprietary technology is based on expert knowledge about radar, computer vision, data, and software engineering. Our solutions are developed by specialists who endlessly explore and challenge new technical boundaries. Trackman’s blend of cutting-edge technology, sports, and continued growth make our company an outstanding place to work. Our work culture is entrepreneurial, ambitious, and rewarding as you get to collaborate with inspiring colleagues and interact with the leaders of golf, baseball, and football. Based on a unique brand reputation, we are proud to work in close partnership with the top athletes, organizations, and teams that rely on our technology to stay ahead of the race. 

We are a Danish company founded, owned, and managed since 2003 by three entrepreneurs with a strong passion for sports. Today, we have a global footprint with our headquarters located in Denmark (Hørsholm) and offices in New York, Phoenix, Poland, and Tokyo. We employ over 800 people worldwide, half of which work in Denmark, where most hardware and software products are developed, tested, and manufactured.

Where innovation happens

At Trackman, we know that great people make great products. We believe that teams thrive, and innovation sparks in an atmosphere where people are encouraged to think for themselves, where everybody’s voices are heard, and where the best ideas prevail in the pursuit of exceptional solutions. This mix makes Trackman an inspiring company – for our customers and colleagues.

Share our Passion! 

Apply now
Show more

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Help the world's most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you an experienced software engineer who would like to lend your coding expertise to train AI models?

We partner with organizations to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code. Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems that involve engaging with these models as they learn to code. There is no requirement for previous AI experience.

You must write Danish for this specific AI training opportunity

About The Opportunity


We are looking for talented coders to help train generative artificial intelligence models
This freelance opportunity is remote and hours are flexible, so you can work whenever is best for you


You may contribute your expertise by...


Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models
Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models


Examples of desirable expertise:


Ability to articulate complex concepts fluently in Danish (required)
Currently enrolled in or completed a bachelor's degree or higher in computer science at a selective institution
Proficiency working with one or more of the the following languages: Java, Python, JavaScript / TypeScript, C++, Swift, and Verilog
Excellent attention to detail, including grammar, punctuation, and style guidelines


Payment:


Rates vary based on expertise, skills assessment, location, project need, and other factors. For example, higher rates may be offered to PhDs. For non-core work, such as during initial project onboarding or project overtime phases, lower rates may apply. Certain projects offer incentive payments. Please review the payment terms for each project.

Location: Remote




Job Description:

We have a team who is looking for a Python Developer to help with both automation of data into a chat bot and help with automation in improving the general CI/CD flows of our application.

Python expertise: proven track record building python scripts and/or api services

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Who We Are

Zeta Global (NYSE: ZETA) is the AI-Powered Marketing Cloud that leverages advanced artificial intelligence (AI) and trillions of consumer signals to make it easier for marketers to acquire, grow, and retain customers more efficiently. Through the Zeta Marketing Platform (ZMP), our vision is to make sophisticated marketing simple by unifying identity, intelligence, and omnichannel activation into a single platform – powered by one of the industry’s largest proprietary databases and AI. Our enterprise customers across multiple verticals are empowered to personalize experiences with consumers at an individual level across every channel, delivering better results for marketing programs. Zeta was founded in 2007 by David A. Steinberg and John Sculley and is headquartered in New York City with offices around the world. To learn more, go to www.zetaglobal.com.

THE ROLE

Zeta Global is seeking a talented and versatile Machine Learning Engineer to join our newly formed Exchange team within our highly skilled development office in Copenhagen. This team plays a critical role in developing and deploying Zeta’s next-generation data science and engineering technology, collaborating closely with our global teams in New York, Berlin, and Prague. The Copenhagen office boasts a dynamic and focused environment, comprising a core group of start-up veterans and approximately 30 highly skilled professionals.

As a member of the Exchange team, you will contribute to the analysis, development and maintenance of our complex AI-powered ad-exchange platform, a sophisticated ecosystem of interconnected systems. This newly established team will tackle a continuous stream of challenging projects originating from across the organization, demanding a high degree of expertise and innovation. We are seeking candidates with a strong foundation in data science, machine learning engineering, and data analysis, and a demonstrated interest in exploring the intersections between these disciplines. As we are building production machine learning systems, experience or interest in software development principles, data engineering, and MLOps practices are highly desirable.

Responsibilities

The ideal candidate for the Machine Learning Engineer position at Zeta Global Copenhagen is a highly motivated and analytical individual with a passion for understanding complex systems. You are adept at using data to identify issues, formulate solutions, and develop robust algorithms and software. You thrive in an environment that offers significant autonomy in planning and executing your work, yet you are also a strong collaborator, readily engaging with fellow developers and international product stakeholders.

You will be involved in every stage of the development process, from initial brainstorming to ongoing maintenance, with a primary emphasis on analysis, prototyping, and development. Our development process is a dynamic blend of agile and rapid prototyping methodologies, designed to foster a culture of "flexibility under responsibility." We prioritize focused development time and believe in the power of collaborative problem-solving, encouraging team members to both seek and offer assistance readily.

Requirements

We welcome candidates with a solid background in data analysis or software development, seeking professionals with proven experience rather than recent graduates. Regardless of your background, a crucial element is your intellectual curiosity, self-motivation, and a demonstrable ability to translate real-world challenges into mathematical models, statistical analyses, algorithms, and ultimately, functional code. A strong interest in machine learning and/or the adtech domain, along with its associated technologies, is highly desirable, as well as knowledge of object-oriented programming languages, particularly Scala.


A strong academic background in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, or related disciplines).
Experience in developing and deploying machine learning models in production.
Proficiency in Python or Scala for machine learning and data processing.
Strong data analysis and feature engineering skills.
Experience with MLOps and building scalable ML pipelines.


Desired Qualifications


Demonstrated experience with Scala or Python for production-ready ML applications.
Software engineering experience, including best practices for code optimization and maintainability.
Knowledge of distributed computing frameworks like Spark for large-scale data processing.
Experience with model optimization techniques and hyperparameter tuning.
Familiarity with auction mechanisms and real-time bidding models.
Experience in market segmentation and audience targeting.
Experience using Airflow for ML pipeline orchestration.
AWS cloud expertise, including SageMaker and other ML-related services.


You approach problems with an analytical mindset and a pragmatic approach to solution development. You are a creative thinker, capable of identifying opportunities and weaknesses in proposed solutions, and constructively contributing your own ideas. You thrive in a dynamic environment, adept at juggling multiple projects and connecting them with underlying data. You recognize that exploring new facets of data often yields greater insights than fine-tuning algorithmic parameters. You are equally comfortable implementing and optimizing solutions, and you are eager to tackle new challenges.

What We Offer

Join our dynamic team, largely comprised of Masters and PhDs in fields like Physics, Math, and Computer Science, and play a key role in shaping the future of our technology. You will collaborate with highly skilled professionals in a stimulating environment that fosters both learning and individual initiative. While we are passionate about exploring cutting-edge technologies and algorithms, we maintain a practical approach to implementing solutions.

We believe in empowering our employees with autonomy and flexibility. We offer flexible work arrangements, including adjustable office hours and the possibility of occasional remote work, provided commitments are consistently fulfilled. You will have the freedom to select your preferred operating system (Linux, Mac, Windows) and development tools, with the expectation of independent maintenance and troubleshooting. We encourage the introduction of new technologies, contingent upon demonstrating their value and gaining team buy-in.

Our international presence provides ample opportunities for cross-departmental collaboration and potential career advancement in locations like Berlin, San Francisco or New York. This full-time position (37 hours per week) is based at our Copenhagen office, located at Bernstorffsgade 21. A competitive benefits package is provided, including lunch, telephone/internet, and health insurance. The ideal candidate will be available to start as soon as possible.

Interested candidates are encouraged to apply via LinkedIn, submitting a cover letter along with their application. Interviews will be scheduled on a continuous basis.

This is a hybrid role based out of Copenhagen.

PEOPLE & CULTURE AT ZETA

Zeta considers applicants for employment without regard to, and does not discriminate on the basis of an individual’s sex, race, color, religion, age, disability, status as a veteran, or national or ethnic origin; nor does Zeta discriminate on the basis of sexual orientation, gender identity or expression.

We’re committed to building a workplace culture of trust and belonging, so everyone feels invited to bring their whole selves to work. We provide a forum for employees to celebrate, support and advocate for one another. Learn more about our commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion here: https://zetaglobal.com/blog/a-look-into-zetas-ergs/

ZETA IN THE NEWS!

https://zetaglobal.com/press/?cat=press-releases


Show more

This newly established team will tackle a continuous stream of challenging projects originating from across the organization, demanding a high degree of expertise and innovation. We are seeking candidates with a strong foundation in data science, machine learning engineering, and data analysis, and a demonstrated interest in exploring the intersections between these disciplines. As we are building production machine learning systems, experience or interest in software development principles, data engineering, and MLOps practices are highly desirable.

Responsibilities

The ideal candidate for the Machine Learning Engineer position at Zeta Global Copenhagen is a highly motivated and analytical individual with a passion for understanding complex systems. You are adept at using data to identify issues, formulate solutions, and develop robust algorithms and software. You thrive in an environment that offers significant autonomy in planning and executing your work, yet you are also a strong collaborator, readily engaging with fellow developers and international product stakeholders.

You will be involved in every stage of the development process, from initial brainstorming to ongoing maintenance, with a primary emphasis on analysis, prototyping, and development. Our development process is a dynamic blend of agile and rapid prototyping methodologies, designed to foster a culture of "flexibility under responsibility." We prioritize focused development time and believe in the power of collaborative problem-solving, encouraging team members to both seek and offer assistance readily.

Requirements

We welcome candidates with a solid background in data analysis or software development, seeking professionals with proven experience rather than recent graduates. Regardless of your background, a crucial element is your intellectual curiosity, self-motivation, and a demonstrable ability to translate real-world challenges into mathematical models, statistical analyses, algorithms, and ultimately, functional code. A strong interest in machine learning and/or the adtech domain, along with its associated technologies, is highly desirable, as well as knowledge of object-oriented programming languages, particularly Scala.

  • A strong academic background in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, or related disciplines).
  • Experience in developing and deploying machine learning models in production.
  • Proficiency in Python or Scala for machine learning and data processing.
  • Strong data analysis and feature engineering skills.
  • Experience with MLOps and building scalable ML pipelines.

Desired Qualifications

  • Demonstrated experience with Scala or Python for production-ready ML applications.
  • Software engineering experience, including best practices for code optimization and maintainability.
  • Knowledge of distributed computing frameworks like Spark for large-scale data processing.
  • Experience with model optimization techniques and hyperparameter tuning.
  • Familiarity with auction mechanisms and real-time bidding models.
  • Experience in market segmentation and audience targeting.
  • Experience using Airflow for ML pipeline orchestration.
  • AWS cloud expertise, including SageMaker and other ML-related services.

You approach problems with an analytical mindset and a pragmatic approach to solution development. You are a creative thinker, capable of identifying opportunities and weaknesses in proposed solutions, and constructively contributing your own ideas. You thrive in a dynamic environment, adept at juggling multiple projects and connecting them with underlying data. You recognize that exploring new facets of data often yields greater insights than fine-tuning algorithmic parameters. You are equally comfortable implementing and optimizing solutions, and you are eager to tackle new challenges.

What We Offer

Join our dynamic team, largely comprised of Masters and PhDs in fields like Physics, Math, and Computer Science, and play a key role in shaping the future of our technology. You will collaborate with highly skilled professionals in a stimulating environment that fosters both learning and individual initiative. While we are passionate about exploring cutting-edge technologies and algorithms, we maintain a practical approach to implementing solutions.

We believe in empowering our employees with autonomy and flexibility. We offer flexible work arrangements, including adjustable office hours and the possibility of occasional remote work, provided commitments are consistently fulfilled. You will have the freedom to select your preferred operating system (Linux, Mac, Windows) and development tools, with the expectation of independent maintenance and troubleshooting. We encourage the introduction of new technologies, contingent upon demonstrating their value and gaining team buy-in.

Our international presence provides ample opportunities for cross-departmental collaboration and potential career advancement in locations like Berlin, San Francisco or New York. This full-time position (37 hours per week) is based at our Copenhagen office, located at Bernstorffsgade 21. A competitive benefits package is provided, including lunch, telephone/internet, and health insurance. The ideal candidate will be available to start as soon as possible.

Interested candidates are encouraged to apply via LinkedIn, submitting a cover letter along with their application. Interviews will be scheduled on a continuous basis.

This is a hybrid role based out of Copenhagen.

PEOPLE & CULTURE AT ZETA

Zeta considers applicants for employment without regard to, and does not discriminate on the basis of an individual’s sex, race, color, religion, age, disability, status as a veteran, or national or ethnic origin; nor does Zeta discriminate on the basis of sexual orientation, gender identity or expression.

We’re committed to building a workplace culture of trust and belonging, so everyone feels invited to bring their whole selves to work. We provide a forum for employees to celebrate, support and advocate for one another. Learn more about our commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion here: https://zetaglobal.com/blog/a-look-into-zetas-ergs/

ZETA IN THE NEWS!

https://zetaglobal.com/press/?cat=press-releases

Title: Applied Research Scientist - Digital Enterprise Transformation
Place: Hedehusene, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Req Number: 89881

Time Type: Full Time

Do you want to push the boundaries of machine learning and scale it to users across the world? Do you wish for a product centric work environment, where machine learning and analytics drive action – not just insight?

With a strong focus on the applied machine learning research discipline, you will take part in innovation and design of new products, as well as tweak and mature existing ones. You will join a team of highly talented data scientists and collaborate with several product teams consisting of product owners, backend- and frontend developers and DevSecOps specialists. You will be pushing the applied research agenda, aiming to create and continuously innovate the ML systems of tomorrow.

Join a department focused on our most valuable digital products

You will join the Research and AI Lab team in the Digital Enterprise Transformation department. Our new Research and AI Lab unit is characterized by having an intrapreneurial mindset, and is collaborating holistically with established MLOps, DevSecOps and

Data Science teams that have had ML systems in production on a global scale for several years. We strive to base our work on knowledge and insight rather than hierarchical structures, and we make sure that our decisions are based on conversations between people with different competencies rather than one individual.

Examples of what we have worked on in 2024:



Trained, tuned, and served large generative language models for document processing and for conversation using both text and multimodal data.
Designed a new large machine learning system set for release in early 2025.
Implemented and deployed an ‘attention-free’ transformer model, including functionality for large-scale model training and inference.



Current plans set for 2025:



Establish an industrial research presence, including publishing our work in relevant ML journals/conferences and collaboration with academic research institutions.
Become creators rather than consumers in GenAI and multimodal machine learning.
And more!



You thrive when solving highly complex challenges

The use cases we handle tend to have a high degree of complexity, requiring non-deterministic problem solving (i.e., the use of ML/AI), near real-time data processing, a need for high availability, vertical and horizontal scalability, and a very high volume of transactions. Solving complex problems with the use of machine learning, you need an open and analytical mind, finding pragmatic solutions that balance between the theoretical standpoint and what is possible .

Be the driver of our AI/ML and GenAI journey

As our Applied Research Scientist, your work will be multifaceted. We will work on our research agenda and push for new machine learning applications and methods, while ensuring this work is well-adopted by the existing teams for use in downstream products that will directly impact DSV’s divisions. You will have a mix of independent work and participate in existing project-focused teams.

Responsibilities:



Advance GenAI and multimodal research and development: Spearhead applied research in GenAI and multimodal machine learning, encompassing image, layout, and text/language modeling.
Drive applied research that can be applied to DSV’s product development. Drive cross-project innovation to tackle complex challenges and real-world problems to gain new insights and apply findings to enhance model performance and outcomes.
Foundational model development: Independently architect, train, and evaluate foundational models to advance GenAI LLMs and multimodal systems in DSV’s field of work.



Skills and experience we value and would love you to have already:



Educational Background: Preferably a PhD or master's degree in CS, CE, ML or a related field, with proven research experience.
Strong Theoretical Foundation: A comprehensive skill set in mathematics, statistics, and algorithms is essential for implementing research ideas, building upon existing research to create new, and adapting established work to our domain.
Software Development: A good understanding of core programming and development concepts: data structures, algorithms, and object-oriented programming. You will both be performing rapid prototyping and contribute to large collaborative machine learning codebases. We primarily use Python due to the high availability of machine learning frameworks.
Publications and Open-Source Contributions: Proven track record of first-author peer-reviewed publications that demonstrate your ability to lead research projects and navigate the publication process, along with contributions to open-source projects.
Model Development and Architecture: Proficiency in building from scratch, modifying and optimizing existing models and in advanced model architectures, particularly for GenAI and multimodal applications .
Accelerated and Distributed Compute: Proficiency in accelerated parallel computing, including scalable data processing and leveraging of GPU technology for enhanced performance and model training scalability. We use frameworks such as: PyTorch, Kedro, Apache Beam, and more.
Continuous Learning: Commitment to staying current with the latest advancements in machine learning and applying new academic insights to solve complex business challenges.
Practical Experience: Hands-on experience with large-scale, real-world machine learning projects.
Self-Starter & Ownership: We're looking for someone who is proactive, takes initiative, and can drive projects independently. You should be comfortable taking ownership of objectives and pushing things forward.



We understand that no candidate may meet every single requirement listed here. If you meet some of the qualifications, but not all, we still encourage you to apply! We're looking for passionate individuals who are eager to grow and contribute to our team.

What we offer to you:



Direct Communication: We engage directly with VP and C-level stakeholders, ensuring your insights and contributions are heard at the highest levels.
Influence on MLOps: Play a key role in shaping our mature, in-house MLOps platform, working with a dynamic and growing team.
Global Scale Experience: Leverage our extensive experience with ML systems in production on a global scale, benefiting from our experience in development and operations processes for large-scale machine learning systems.
A proven team: A group which is already self-financed based on realized returns of machine learning business cases.
Research and AI Lab: Be part of our new Research and AI Lab initiative, where you can influence methodologies, the direction, and the research agenda.



If you want to apply

We will be happy to answer any questions you may have regarding the position and about your options in DSV. You are welcome to call Ramus Kær Jørgensen on +45 25452587.

We look forward to receiving your application as soon as possible. We will process the applications as we receive them.

DSV – Global Transport and Logistics

DSV is a dynamic workplace that fosters inclusivity and diversity. We conduct our business with integrity, respecting different cultures and the dignity and rights of individuals. When you join DSV, you are working for one of the very best performing companies in the transport and logistics industry. You’ll join a talented team of approximately 75,000 employees in over 80 countries, working passionately to deliver great customer experiences and high-quality services. DSV aspires to lead the way towards a more sustainable future for our industry and are committed to trading on nature’s terms.

We promote collaboration and transparency and strive to attract, motivate and retain talented people in a culture of respect. If you are driven, talented and wish to be part of a progressive and versatile organisation, we’ll support you and your need to achieve your potential and forward your career.

Visit dsv.com and follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter.

Title: Principal Data Scientist
Place: Kongens Lyngby, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Som Principal Data Scientist hos Inspari vil du indtage en nøgleposition i teamet, hvor din ekspertise er afgørende for at lede og udvikle vores kunder til at nå deres højeste potentiale gennem komplekse AI- og Data Science-udfordringer.

Du vil være frontløber i at transformere strategiske visioner til håndgribelige AI-løsninger.




English version below




Dine ansvarsområder og opgaver

Din rolle vil centrere sig om ledelse, udvikling og rådgivning på AI og Data Science-projekter for at understøtte værdiskabelse for vores kunder. Fra den indledende idéfase til den endelige implementering og adoption.

Du vil stå i spidsen for at dechifrere og omdanne komplekse data science-udfordringer til klare, værdiskabende løsninger og sikre en klar og overbevisende kommunikation af disse løsninger til både interne og eksterne interessenter.




Hertil vil du:

Være fagligfyrtårn og mentor for teammedlemmer og du vil spille en central rolle i at bidrage til det interne kompetenceniveau i din rolle som Principal Data Scientist og konsulent.
Være med til at forbedre og udvikle vores team, samt strategi inden for AI & Data Science.
Være engageret i presales-aktiviteter, facilitering af workshops og initiativer rettet mod uddannelse inden for AI og Data Science.
Være en aktiv bidragsyder til virksomhedens omfattende produktportefølje.




For at sikre, at du forbliver på forkant med den nyeste viden og teknologi inden for AI og data science, vil du være dedikeret til kontinuerlig selvudvikling.




Dine kvalifikationer

Den ideelle kandidat til denne rolle har dybdegående erfaring med AI og data science samt en stærk track record som teknisk driver.




Dertil har du:

En betydelig mængde konsulenterfaring, og en samlet erfaring på mindst 5-10 år, samt en relevant højere uddannelse.
En robust teknisk erfaring med cloud-tjenester som OpenAI, Microsoft Azure, herunder Azure Machine Learning, Azure Databricks, Data Lake og Blob storage, eller lignende platforme som AWS eller Google Cloud.
Erfaring med MLOps, herunder opsætning af CI/CD-pipelines for deployment og vedligeholdelse af analytiske modeller.
Omfattende erfaring med programmering i Python og være velbevandret i biblioteker som Pandas, PySpark, MLFlow og scikit-learn.







Vi forventer, at du kompetencemæssigt:

Har en skarp evne til at omsætte komplekse forretningskrav til ML/AI/GenAI og at du kan tænke i implementering på tværs af forretningsområder.
Besidder stærke analytiske evner som du har bevist bl.a. ved avanceret dataanalyse og anvendt statistik.
Er flydende på både dansk og engelsk, både skriftligt og mundtligt og kendes som en fremragende kommunikator, der kan formidle komplekse koncepter på en forståelig måde for alle interessenter.
Har en dyb forståelse for forretningsprocesser og være i stand til at transformere forretningsbehov til tekniske løsninger.
Er proaktiv og nysgerrig, med en konstant trang til at forbedre processer og løsninger.




Din tjekliste:

Du trives med at arbejde på et højt fagligt niveau, hvor vidensdeling er essential.
Du drives af at omsætte komplekse problemstillinger til værdifulde AI-drevne indsigter.
Du vil være en del af en best-in-class virksomhed som især formår at skabe handling bag rådgivningen og de strategiske planer.
Du ønsker at udfolde din gode energi og skarpe perspektiver, som gør dig til en eftertragtet problemløser og sparringspartner for kolleger og ledere på alle niveauer.
Du har et naturligt behov og fokus på hele tiden at dygtiggøre dig.
Du holder af at have stor fleksibilitet og mulighed for selv at planlægge din hverdag.




Vi tilbyder dig:

Udover et spændende job og kolleger i verdensklasse kan vi tilbyde dig:

Fremragende karrieremuligheder og personlig udvikling, inklusive løbende træning og uddannelse.
At blive en del af vores unikke Heartwork-kultur, hvor ambitioner og forventninger går hånd i hånd med passion og fællesskabsfølelse.
Mulighed for en fleksibel hverdag med hjemmearbejde og en attraktiv løn, der afspejler dine kvalifikationer.
En aktiv personaleforening med et bredt spektrum af aktiviteter.




Lokation og rejseaktiviteter:

Din primære arbejdsplads vil være på vores kontor i Kongens Lyngby, understøttet af en hybrid arbejdsmodel og med en minimal grad af rejseaktivitetet.




Kontakt os snarest muligt

Vi afholder samtaler løbende og ansætter, når vi har fundet det rette match. Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at række ud til:




Steffen Krogsgaard, Head of Recruitment, krog@inspari.dk, +45 61 95 67 25




Vi lover at behandle vores dialog med stor fortrolighed.




English Version:




As a Principal Data Scientist at Inspari, you will hold a key position within the team, where your expertise is crucial in guiding and developing our clients to reach their highest potential through complex AI and Data Science challenges. You will be a frontrunner in transforming strategic visions into tangible AI solutions.




Your Responsibilities and Tasks:

Lead, develop, and provide consultancy on AI and Data Science projects to support value creation for our clients, from the initial idea phase to final implementation and adoption.
Decrypt and transform complex Data Science challenges into clear, value-creating solutions, ensuring effective communication of these solutions to both internal and external stakeholders.




In addition, you will:

Serve as a subject matter expert and mentor for team members and play a central role in enhancing internal competency as a Principal Data Scientist and consultant.
Contribute to improving and developing our team and strategy within AI & Data Science.
Engage in presales activities, facilitate workshops, and initiate education within AI and Data Science.
Actively contribute to the company's extensive product portfolio.




To remain at the forefront of the latest knowledge and technology in AI and Data Science, you will be dedicated to continuous self-development.




Your Qualifications:

The ideal candidate for this role has deep experience in AI and Data Science with a strong track record as a technical leader.




Additionally, you have:

Significant consulting experience, totaling at least 5-10 years, along with relevant higher education.
Robust technical experience with cloud services such as OpenAI, Microsoft Azure, including Azure Machine Learning, Azure Databricks, Data Lake and Blob storage, or similar platforms like AWS or Google Cloud.
Experience with MLOps, including setting up CI/CD pipelines for deployment and maintenance of analytical models.
Extensive experience in programming with Python and proficiency in libraries like Pandas, PySpark, MLFlow, and scikit-learn.




We expect you to:

Have a keen ability to translate complex business requirements into ML/AI/GenAI implementations across business areas.
Possess strong analytical skills, demonstrated through advanced data analysis and applied statistics.
Be fluent in both Danish and English, written and spoken, and known as an excellent communicator who can convey complex concepts in an understandable manner to all stakeholders.
Have a deep understanding of business processes and be able to transform business needs into technical solutions.
Be proactive and curious, with a constant urge to improve processes and solutions.




Your Checklist:

Thrive in working at a high professional level where knowledge sharing is essential.
Are driven to translate complex issues into valuable AI-driven insights.
Will be part of a best-in-class company that effectively turns advice and strategic plans into action.
Wish to unfold your positive energy and sharp perspectives, making you a sought-after problem solver and sparring partner for colleagues and leaders at all levels.
Have a natural need and focus on constantly improving your skills.
Appreciate having great flexibility and the ability to plan your day independently.




We Offer You:

In addition to an exciting job and world-class colleagues, we offer:

Excellent career opportunities and personal development, including ongoing training and education.
The chance to be part of our unique Heartwork culture, where ambitions and expectations go hand in hand with passion and a sense of community.
The possibility of a flexible workday with home office options and an attractive salary reflecting your qualifications.
An active employee association with a wide range of activities.




Location and Travel Activities:

Your primary workplace will be at our office in Kongens Lyngby, supported by a hybrid work model with minimal travel activities.




Contact Us As Soon As Possible

We conduct interviews continuously and hire when we find the right match. If you have questions about the position, feel free to reach out to:




Steffen Krogsgaard, Head of Recruitment, krog@inspari.dk, +45 61 95 67 25




We promise to treat our dialogue with great confidentiality.

Show more

  • Du drives af at omsætte komplekse problemstillinger til værdifulde AI-drevne indsigter.
  • Du vil være en del af en best-in-class virksomhed som især formår at skabe handling bag rådgivningen og de strategiske planer.
  • Du ønsker at udfolde din gode energi og skarpe perspektiver, som gør dig til en eftertragtet problemløser og sparringspartner for kolleger og ledere på alle niveauer.
  • Du har et naturligt behov og fokus på hele tiden at dygtiggøre dig.
  • Du holder af at have stor fleksibilitet og mulighed for selv at planlægge din hverdag.


Vi tilbyder dig:

Udover et spændende job og kolleger i verdensklasse kan vi tilbyde dig:

  • Fremragende karrieremuligheder og personlig udvikling, inklusive løbende træning og uddannelse.
  • At blive en del af vores unikke Heartwork-kultur, hvor ambitioner og forventninger går hånd i hånd med passion og fællesskabsfølelse.
  • Mulighed for en fleksibel hverdag med hjemmearbejde og en attraktiv løn, der afspejler dine kvalifikationer.
  • En aktiv personaleforening med et bredt spektrum af aktiviteter.


Lokation og rejseaktiviteter:

Din primære arbejdsplads vil være på vores kontor i Kongens Lyngby, understøttet af en hybrid arbejdsmodel og med en minimal grad af rejseaktivitetet.


Kontakt os snarest muligt

Vi afholder samtaler løbende og ansætter, når vi har fundet det rette match. Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at række ud til:


Steffen Krogsgaard, Head of Recruitment, krog@inspari.dk, +45 61 95 67 25


Vi lover at behandle vores dialog med stor fortrolighed.


English Version:


As a Principal Data Scientist at Inspari, you will hold a key position within the team, where your expertise is crucial in guiding and developing our clients to reach their highest potential through complex AI and Data Science challenges. You will be a frontrunner in transforming strategic visions into tangible AI solutions.


Your Responsibilities and Tasks:

  • Lead, develop, and provide consultancy on AI and Data Science projects to support value creation for our clients, from the initial idea phase to final implementation and adoption.
  • Decrypt and transform complex Data Science challenges into clear, value-creating solutions, ensuring effective communication of these solutions to both internal and external stakeholders.


In addition, you will:

  • Serve as a subject matter expert and mentor for team members and play a central role in enhancing internal competency as a Principal Data Scientist and consultant.
  • Contribute to improving and developing our team and strategy within AI & Data Science.
  • Engage in presales activities, facilitate workshops, and initiate education within AI and Data Science.
  • Actively contribute to the company's extensive product portfolio.


To remain at the forefront of the latest knowledge and technology in AI and Data Science, you will be dedicated to continuous self-development.


Your Qualifications:

The ideal candidate for this role has deep experience in AI and Data Science with a strong track record as a technical leader.


Additionally, you have:

  • Significant consulting experience, totaling at least 5-10 years, along with relevant higher education.
  • Robust technical experience with cloud services such as OpenAI, Microsoft Azure, including Azure Machine Learning, Azure Databricks, Data Lake and Blob storage, or similar platforms like AWS or Google Cloud.
  • Experience with MLOps, including setting up CI/CD pipelines for deployment and maintenance of analytical models.
  • Extensive experience in programming with Python and proficiency in libraries like Pandas, PySpark, MLFlow, and scikit-learn.


We expect you to:

  • Have a keen ability to translate complex business requirements into ML/AI/GenAI implementations across business areas.
  • Possess strong analytical skills, demonstrated through advanced data analysis and applied statistics.
  • Be fluent in both Danish and English, written and spoken, and known as an excellent communicator who can convey complex concepts in an understandable manner to all stakeholders.
  • Have a deep understanding of business processes and be able to transform business needs into technical solutions.
  • Be proactive and curious, with a constant urge to improve processes and solutions.


Your Checklist:

  • Thrive in working at a high professional level where knowledge sharing is essential.
  • Are driven to translate complex issues into valuable AI-driven insights.
  • Will be part of a best-in-class company that effectively turns advice and strategic plans into action.
  • Wish to unfold your positive energy and sharp perspectives, making you a sought-after problem solver and sparring partner for colleagues and leaders at all levels.
  • Have a natural need and focus on constantly improving your skills.
  • Appreciate having great flexibility and the ability to plan your day independently.


We Offer You:

In addition to an exciting job and world-class colleagues, we offer:

  • Excellent career opportunities and personal development, including ongoing training and education.
  • The chance to be part of our unique Heartwork culture, where ambitions and expectations go hand in hand with passion and a sense of community.
  • The possibility of a flexible workday with home office options and an attractive salary reflecting your qualifications.
  • An active employee association with a wide range of activities.


Location and Travel Activities:

Your primary workplace will be at our office in Kongens Lyngby, supported by a hybrid work model with minimal travel activities.


Contact Us As Soon As Possible

We conduct interviews continuously and hire when we find the right match. If you have questions about the position, feel free to reach out to:


Steffen Krogsgaard, Head of Recruitment, krog@inspari.dk, +45 61 95 67 25


We promise to treat our dialogue with great confidentiality.

Title: Machine Learning/AI konsulenter
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Er du konsulent med erfaring i Machine Learning/AI, og er du bosiddende i Danmark, med minimum 5 års professionel erfaring fra IT relaterede projekter ude hos kunder, og har du ikke før haft kontakt med os, så kunne et partnerskab med emagine måske være interessant for dig?

emagine er et high-end konsulenthus med hovedkvarter i København, der leverer skræddersyede ydelser og ekspertise ved brug af et netværk af ekspertkonsulenter.

Som freelance konsulent kan du blive inddraget i opgaver, enten som ekspertrådgiver, som en del af et emagine team, eller som en betroet konsulent ude på opgave i en af vores kunders organisation.

I Danmark har vi kontorer i København, Aarhus og Aalborg, med over 900 konsulenter ude på opgaver lige nu. I Europa har vi over 5.000 konsulenter på opgave.

Tilmeld dig vores database og få muligheden for at arbejde med nogle af de mest innovative virksomheder i branchen.

At blive medlem af vores konsulentdatabase har mange fordele, herunder:


Adgang til en bred vifte af projekter med internationale virksomheder, så du kan anvende dine færdigheder og ekspertise til projekter, der betyder noget.
Opgaver, der matcher dine færdigheder og ekspertise, hvilket sikrer, at du arbejder på projekter, der stemmer overens med dine styrker.
Kurser og kompetenceudvikling på alle niveauer med særlig erfaring inden for undervisning i projekt- program- og porteføljeledelse.
Muligheder for at udvide din portefølje af projekter og fremme din karriere


Som konsulent med Machine Learning/AI kompetencer, bør du have erfaring med en del af følgende:


Artifical Intelligence (AI)
Machine Learning (ML)
Retrieval-augmented generation (RAG)
Python
Deep Learning
SQL
Neurale Netværk
Large Language Model (LLM)
Microsoft Azure AI Studio
AutoGen
Docker
R
Algoritmer
NLP Engineering
Kubernetes

Title: Principal Data Scientist - AI & Data Science
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Er du passioneret omkring AI og Machine Learning? Vil du være med til at løse kritiske forretningsudfordringer med innovative løsninger? Vi søger en erfaren Principal Data Scientist, der kan drive AI- og ML-projekter fra koncept til produktion og fungere som teknisk leder for vores voksende team.

Om rollen

Som Principal Data Scientist vil du fungere som en seniorressource på kundeprojekter, hvor du arbejder hands-on med at forstå forretningskontekster, designe, bygge og evaluere AI- og ML-systemer. Du vil arbejde tæt sammen med forretningsinteressenter, data science-teamet og vores softwareudviklere for at skabe værdiskabende løsninger.

I rollen vil du have en vigtig teknisk lederfunktion, men uden direkte personaleansvar. Du vil derimod være en central sparringspartner og mentor for teamet, sætte strategiske retninger og etablere best practices for data science-udvikling.

Dine ansvarsområder


Forstå kunders forretningskontekster og omsætte forretningsbehov til tekniske løsninger.
Designe, bygge og evaluere AI- og ML-systemer, der løser konkrete forretningsudfordringer.
Samarbejde tæt med softwareudviklingsteamet om implementering og CI/CD-processer.
Lede end-to-end udviklingen af data science-projekter fra koncept til produktion.
Påvirke strategi og etablere best practices for data science-udvikling.
Yde teknisk mentorskab til junior data scientists.
Kommunikere komplekse tekniske resultater til både tekniske og ikke-tekniske interessenter.


Minimumskvalifikationer


Videregående uddannelse inden for Statistik, Datalogi, Matematik eller et relateret felt.
Flere års erfaring inden for data science, inklusiv erfaring i en senior rolle.
Ekspertviden om statistisk modellering, ML og datamanipulation.
Stærke færdigheder i Python, SQL og en bred data science værktøjskasse.
Flydende dansk - både skriftligt og mundtligt, da vi arbejder med Generative AI-projekter på dansk.
Dokumenteret erfaring med at bygge og implementere ML-modeller i produktionsmiljøer.
Evne til at omsætte forretningsbehov til tekniske løsninger.
Grundlæggende kendskab til CI/CD og softwareudviklingsprocesser.


Foretrukne kvalifikationer


Erfaring med SAP AI (via BTP eller SAP Business AI).
Erfaring med AI-tjenester via Azure eller andre hyperscalere.
Kendskab til CI/CD og MLOps-processer.
Erfaring med Generative AI og LLM-teknologier.
Konsulenterfaring med kundekontakt og projektstyring.


Hvad vi tilbyder


En mulighed for at arbejde med cutting-edge AI-løsninger i en innovativ og dynamisk organisation.
En kultur, hvor faglig sparring, læring og innovation er i fokus.
Mulighed for at påvirke strategien og etablere best practices inden for data science.
Fleksible arbejdsforhold og mulighed for hjemmearbejde.
Et team af dygtige og engagerede kolleger, der brænder for AI og ML.


Vil du være med?

Er du klar til at lede transformative projekter sammen med et af de mest innovative teams inden for dokumenthåndtering og forretningsoptimering? Send os et par ord om dig selv sammen med dit CV – vi vender tilbage hurtigst muligt! Vi beder venligst om, at du ikke inkluderer et billede i dit CV. Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!

Har du spørgsmål?

Hvis Du Har Spørgsmål Til Stillingen Eller NTT DATA Business Solutions Som Arbejdsplads, Er Du Velkommen Til At Kontakte

Mikkel Boel Faurby

Talent Attraction & Development Consultant

📧 Email: Mikkel.Faurby@nttdata.com

📞 Telefon: +45 26 86 88 07

Om NTT DATA Business Solutions

NTT DATA er anerkendt som en Global Top Employer i både 2024 og 2025!

NTT DATA Business Solutions er en international og hastigt voksende IT-virksomhed og en af verdens førende SAP-partnere. Vi leverer alt fra rådgivning til implementering af SAP-løsninger – herunder drift og support. I Norden beskæftiger vi ca. 500 medarbejdere fordelt på kontorer i Danmark, Norge, Sverige og Finland.

Mens verden taler om digital transformation, er vi i fuld gang med at transformere os selv og vores kunder. For os er AI, AR, VR, IoT, robotteknologi, droner, blockchain-teknologi og 3D-print ikke bare buzzwords – de er en del af vores virkelighed. Disse teknologier integreres løbende i vores løsninger, og vi stræber efter at dække det hele.

Title: Machine Learning Platform Engineer
Description:
Are you passionate about Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence and excited to work at the intersection of Cloud Infrastructure and cutting-edge ML/AI solutions in a fast paced business? This is your chance to embed with our Fundamental Modelling (FM) team, developing large-scale ML/AI models using and supplying terabytes of meteorological data to drive insights and competitive advantage in energy trading.




About the Role

We’re seeking a hands-on ML Platform Engineer to work directly with the Head of Fundamental Modelling as a strategic business partner, while reporting to the Manager of Cloud Development ensuring an anchor in the wider technical organization.

Your mission: Enable our FM and Quant Trading teams to focus entirely on sophisticated modelling and meteorology solutions by ensuring platform infrastructure and operations run seamlessly in the background.

You’ll help maintain and expand our hybrid infrastructure using Azure Cloud and on-premise high-performance computing (HPC) resources, ensuring the right balance of performance, agility, reliability and cost for each use case.




Key Responsibilities

Develop and manage the ML platform for large-scale data and complex ML models.
Implement MLOps best practices to streamline development and deployment.
Optimize the platform’s performance and efficiency across Azure Cloud and on-premise HPC.
Ensure smooth transition of ML and Big Data applications from development to production.
Proactively solve infrastructure issues and improve platform reliability.
Partner with data scientists and engineers to enable successful deployment and monitoring.
Drive platform improvements to meet business and technical needs.




We expect that you are familiar with several of the topics below and are ready to embrace learning the rest in your job with us!

Experience building and maintaining ML platforms in data-intensive environments.
Strong experience with Azure Cloud, Docker, and Kubernetes.
Expertise in GPU-based ML training and high-memory computing.
Experience with HPC infrastructure and cloud integration.
Ability to assess and recommend the best infrastructure solutions.
Strong problem-solving and communication skills.
Experience with time-series or geospatial data is a plus.




Personal Competencies

Collaborative: You work well with data scientists and engineers to solve challenges together.
Business-driven: You seek to understand business needs and deliver effective solutions.
Proactive: You anticipate problems and address them before they escalate.
Customer-focused: You ensure the FM team can rely on the platform without friction.
Adaptable: You adjust strategies based on changing business and technical requirements.
Clear communicator: You explain technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.




Did we pique your interest?

Click the "APPLY" button - we are continuously looking for talented people to join our team.

Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
KAYAK, part of Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG), is the world’s leading travel search engine. With billions of queries across our platforms, we help people find their perfect flight, stay, rental car and vacation package. We’re also transforming business travel with a new corporate travel solution, KAYAK for Business.

As an employee of KAYAK, you will be part of a travel company that operates a portfolio of global metasearch brands including momondo, Cheapflights and HotelsCombined, among others. From start-up to industry leader, innovation is in our DNA and every employee has an opportunity to make their mark. Our focus is on building the best travel search engine to make it easier for everyone to experience the world.

The Marketing Measurement team's mission is to improve KAYAK's ability to measure the efficiency of marketing efforts. This role works closely with marketing leaders to make better data-informed strategic marketing decisions.

As a Senior Data Scientist on this team, you will have the opportunity to develop the frameworks and roadmaps to tackle marketing measurement challenges in an efficient way, work with the stakeholders to align on priorities, and closely work your team to build the robust measurement and experimentation solutions!

In this role, you will:



Manage into end to end experimentation from formulating hypotheses, experiment design to collecting right data, doing power analysis to finally then implementing and analyzing experiment results
Support in the initiatives towards building a robust framework for efficiently creating and evaluating creative, bidding and landing page experiments
Develop new models and advanced analytics techniques to measure and optimize the marketing spend in a robust manner
Support the development of less senior scientists, collaborates with team members to assure timely delivery of high-quality work
Build standardized and scalable solutions, and lead from front in setting up the best practices



Please apply if you have:



Advanced degree (Masters, PhD) in Data Science, Statistics or a related field.
Extensive experience with data manipulation and extraction using relational databases (SQL)
Ability to write high quality, scalable, maintainable code (Python, R)
Strong story-telling and presentation skills to understand and communicate in the language of business partners, mostly within Marketing
Strong foundation in experimentation methods and causal inference techniques
Experienced in marketing science measurement methodologies like Causal impact, geo-lift on Google, and Marketing mix models
Proactive work style, needing minimal guidance and demonstrating good judgment
Has a keen sense of success criteria and demonstrates success through end-to-end QA. Independently adheres to strong testing and validation principles
Passionate about large data sets in marketing, finance, and economics. Skilled in paid marketing data, time-series analysis, econometrics, and regression models



Benefits:



Work from (almost) anywhere for up to 20 days per year
Focus on mental health and well-being:

Company-paid therapy sessions through SpringHealth
Company-paid subscription to HeadSpace
Company-wide week off a year - the whole team fully recharges (and returns without a pile-up of work!)
No meeting Fridays

Paid parental leave
Generous paid vacation + time off for your birthday
Paid volunteer time
Focus on your career growth:

Development Dollars
Leadership development
Access to thousand of on-demand e-learnings

Travel Discounts
Employee Resource Groups
6 weeks paid vacation
Pension plan contributions
Private health & life insurance
Lunch provided five days per week & breakfast once a week
Professional espresso machine
Awesome office in the city centre of Copenhagen
Monthly social events, yoga, Thursday bars


Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

At OpenTable/KAYAK, we aspire to be a workplace that fosters inclusion and reflects the diverse communities we serve. Hiring people with different backgrounds and perspectives is critical to innovation and to how we deliver great experiences for our users, partners, and teams. We strive to be an open and welcoming environment so that no matter who you are, you can be yourself.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform job responsibilities, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation(s).

As an employee of KAYAK, you will be part of a travel company that operates a portfolio of global metasearch brands including momondo, Cheapflights and HotelsCombined, among others. From start-up to industry leader, innovation is in our DNA and every employee has an opportunity to make their mark. Our focus is on building the best travel search engine to make it easier for everyone to experience the world.

The Marketing Measurement team's mission is to improve KAYAK's ability to measure the efficiency of marketing efforts. This role works closely with marketing leaders to make better data-informed strategic marketing decisions.

As a Senior Data Scientist on this team, you will have the opportunity to develop the frameworks and roadmaps to tackle marketing measurement challenges in an efficient way, work with the stakeholders to align on priorities, and closely work your team to build the robust measurement and experimentation solutions!

In this role, you will:


  • Manage into end to end experimentation from formulating hypotheses, experiment design to collecting right data, doing power analysis to finally then implementing and analyzing experiment results
  • Support in the initiatives towards building a robust framework for efficiently creating and evaluating creative, bidding and landing page experiments
  • Develop new models and advanced analytics techniques to measure and optimize the marketing spend in a robust manner
  • Support the development of less senior scientists, collaborates with team members to assure timely delivery of high-quality work
  • Build standardized and scalable solutions, and lead from front in setting up the best practices


Please apply if you have:


  • Advanced degree (Masters, PhD) in Data Science, Statistics or a related field.
  • Extensive experience with data manipulation and extraction using relational databases (SQL)
  • Ability to write high quality, scalable, maintainable code (Python, R)
  • Strong story-telling and presentation skills to understand and communicate in the language of business partners, mostly within Marketing
  • Strong foundation in experimentation methods and causal inference techniques
  • Experienced in marketing science measurement methodologies like Causal impact, geo-lift on Google, and Marketing mix models
  • Proactive work style, needing minimal guidance and demonstrating good judgment
  • Has a keen sense of success criteria and demonstrates success through end-to-end QA. Independently adheres to strong testing and validation principles
  • Passionate about large data sets in marketing, finance, and economics. Skilled in paid marketing data, time-series analysis, econometrics, and regression models


Benefits:


  • Work from (almost) anywhere for up to 20 days per year
  • Focus on mental health and well-being:
    • Company-paid therapy sessions through SpringHealth
    • Company-paid subscription to HeadSpace
    • Company-wide week off a year - the whole team fully recharges (and returns without a pile-up of work!)
    • No meeting Fridays
  • Paid parental leave
  • Generous paid vacation + time off for your birthday
  • Paid volunteer time
  • Focus on your career growth:
    • Development Dollars
    • Leadership development
    • Access to thousand of on-demand e-learnings
  • Travel Discounts
  • Employee Resource Groups
  • 6 weeks paid vacation
  • Pension plan contributions
  • Private health & life insurance
  • Lunch provided five days per week & breakfast once a week
  • Professional espresso machine
  • Awesome office in the city centre of Copenhagen
  • Monthly social events, yoga, Thursday bars

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

At OpenTable/KAYAK, we aspire to be a workplace that fosters inclusion and reflects the diverse communities we serve. Hiring people with different backgrounds and perspectives is critical to innovation and to how we deliver great experiences for our users, partners, and teams. We strive to be an open and welcoming environment so that no matter who you are, you can be yourself.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform job responsibilities, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation(s).

Title: R/D Assistant
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Us

REDUCED is committed to producing high-quality, upcycled savory taste solutions. REDUCED is looking for a dedicated Intern, the focus of the role will be to carry out different fermentation trials and perform chemical and microbiological analysis of the products obtained from these trials.

Position Overview

You’ll be pivotal in executing and organizing fermentation trials in a BSL-2 microbiological laboratory, and microbiological and chemical analysis (enzymatic assays, HPLC and GC-MS). The role requires that you have in-depth microbiological knowledge, knowledge of good microbiological practices, and fermentation.

Key Responsibilities


Plan, design, and execute fermentation trials. You need to be able to carry out these tasks autonomously making sure to have a correct set-up and correct controls. You need to be organised, plan well and in advance. You need to work in a sterile environment, and avoid any contamination. You need to know how to prepare micrbiological media, assess microbial growth via plate counting, and OD measurements, and have a basic microscopy knowledge.
Carry out chemicals and microbiological analysis. You need to prepare samples for enzymatic assays, HPLC and GC-MS analysis. This can involve sample preparation such as correct dilution, filtration, manual derivatisation, preparation of mobile phases and chemicals needed for these analysis. You need to be able to prepare microbiological media, and work in a BSL-2 lab


Who We’re Looking For

You are structured with a sharp eye for detail, you are analytical, and operate in an organised manner. You ensure your safety and safety of the samples you produce. You work tidly, keep good track of the protocols, samples, and data deriving from various trials and analysis you execute. You are a fast learner and enjoy working in the lab.

The Ideal Candidate Has The Following Qualifications


Minimum a Bachelor’s degree in Food Science, Microbiology, Molecular Biology, or related discipline.
Strong knowledge of microbiology and food microbiology.
Knowledge of statistical analysis (e.g., Excel, Rstudio, MatLab, Pyton).
Fluent in English.


Personal Attributes


Strong drive and adaptability suited for a dynamic R&D workplace.
Good with numbers and classic microbiological calculations
Enjoys practical work as well as data analysis.
Good at planning and working in a structured manner.
Independent and proactive attitude.
Excited to learn new things.
Not afraid to try and fail


Reports To: Fermentation Scientist

Apply Now!

If you’re ready to take on this challenge at REDUCED and work in a cool and dynamic setting, we’d love to hear from you!
Show more

Title: Data Scientist, Computer Vision
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Data Scientist in our Computer Vision section, you will develop and deploy deep learning models to improve the understanding, alignment and correspondence between 3D models of the construction site and video data gathered using our vSLAM system. As part of an R&D team, you will work on discovery of new solutions through research and rapid prototyping, and translating the findings into delivery of high quality solutions to complex computer vision problems.

Your background

We believe you…


Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
Have a hands-on experience with software development using C++, Python or C#. It is important that you have reached solid coding standards and strive for continuous improvement.
Have a machine learning experience or trained in the area. Hands-on experience with PyTorch and MLFlow is a plus.
Have computer vision experience or trained in the area. Hands-on experience with OpenCV is a plus.
Can work both independently and as part of a team.


Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our machine learning solutions.

Our tech...


C++
OpenGL
Python
PyTorch
MLFlow
Kubernetes


We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

What To Expect As a Daluxian

In our organization the way from idea to product is short, combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.

You will become a part of a highly skilled team of passionate individuals driven by the wish to explore new and reshape existing technologies. As Dalux is a software company, we want half of the company to consist of Software Developers. All our software development happens at our head office at Vibenshuset in Copenhagen.

We offer...


Central location in Copenhagen, focus on work/life balance without any overtime, and no dress code.
An active social environment with monthly events and social clubs.
Flat communication in our organization, where the way from idea to product is short combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.
You’ll join a highly specialized, international team with room for creativity and professional growth.
Strong focus on diversity and inclusion – your ideas are heard, and opportunities are available to all.
Attractive employee benefits such as health insurance, lunch plan, coffee and fruit, free fitness facilities, and parking garage.
Focus on your development and well-being, with support for both professional goals and personal growth.


Ready for the next step

If Dalux sounds like a place where you could develop and contribute to the high-quality software, we would gladly accept your application. We will be having ongoing interviews.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Simone Jena Berg Christensen.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Dalux’ products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the world’s 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. Our user-friendly digital tools and Building Information Modelling-technology (also known as BIM) is used in more than 160 countries globally.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Application deadline:

Ongoing

Title: Machine Learning Engineer, Computer Vision
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Machine Learning Engineer in our Computer Vision section, you will be a key part in delivery of the solutions into production. You will participate in the full lifecycle of the ML systems we build, while spearheading the model deployment, performance monitoring and maintenance, to ensure the reproducibility of our experiments and traceability of our pipelines in production. As part of the R&D team, you will be expected to keep up to date with the state-of-the-art in the ML/CV area as well as new techniques and processes.

We believe you…


Have 3+ years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, MLOps Engineer, or similar.
Have a proven track record of bringing machine learning models to production.
Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
Can work both independently and as part of a team.


Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our machine learning solutions.

Title: AI Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Amsterdam, Rotterdam, Copenhagen hybrid




DEPT®/AI has a single mission: to make the best work in the industry using AI to enhance everything we do. This role sits within our Global Data & AI practice, which has deep expertise in leveraging AI. The team includes data strategists, consultants, data scientists and analysts that work alongside DEPT® teams around the world across different services – from commerce, to full-funnel media, content engineering to internal operations. You will be solving some of the hardest and most challenging problems facing some of the best loved brands in the world – and doing this alongside an experienced team.




Job Purpose

We are seeking for a talented and passionate Mid-Level AI Engineer to join our growing team. As an AI Engineer, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and deploying innovative AI solutions for our clients across various industries. You will collaborate with a team of experts to solve complex business challenges using cutting-edge AI technologies.




Key Responsibilities

Design and architect solutions using state-of-the-art frameworks and cloud technologies
Build machine learning models for marketing attribution, predicting customer propensity, segmenting customer groups based on behavioural data, and recommending products and/or content.
Fine-tune Large Language Models to business-specific use cases.
Deploy MLOps pipelines together with our ML engineers.
Work closely with data engineers, fellow data scientists/AI engineers and consultants to ensure seamless integration and deployment of AI solutions that create business impact.
Communicate with clients about complex solutions in an understandable way, deliver progress reports and demonstrations of AI solutions.




What We Are Looking For

Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Information Management, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in AI development.
Strong understanding of machine learning, deep learning, and other AI techniques.
Proficiency in Python and relevant AI libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Experience with data processing and analysis tools (e.g., Pandas, SQL).
Experienced with cloud platforms such as Amazon Web Services, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform.
Ability to work with version control systems (e.g., Git).
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills.
Direct availability to start working in the Netherlands or Denmark.

Nice to have:

Experience with natural language processing (NLP) or computer vision (CV).
Knowledge of MLOps and model deployment pipelines.
Familiarity with AI ethics and responsible AI principles.
Experience working with large datasets and distributed computing.
Contributions to open-source AI projects.




WE OFFER:

The benefits depend upon the location where you apply from, so feel free to check with the recruiter.
A flexible, hybrid working policy (2 days from the office, depending on location).
Social and Cultural Events, plenty of opportunities to connect with colleagues through organised activities and celebrations.
Inspirational Talks, bringing the outside in with regular guest speakers and events.
Learning and Development, supporting your growth with continuous opportunities to learn and advance.
Buddy Programme: You will be paired with a ‘Buddy’ to help you through your first weeks’ at DEPT®.
A reputation for doing good. DEPT® has been a Certified B Corp® since 2021 and named ‘Agency of the Year’ at both The Lovies and The Webby Awards.
Awesome clients. Whether big or small, local or global — at DEPT® you’ll get the opportunity to work with clients of all sizes and across all industries. And we celebrate all of our successes together!
The opportunity for possibility. We want to enable you to do what you do best and help you develop your skills further with training, development and certifications.
Global annual DEPT® Cares Month in which employees come together and donate their skills to support local charities.




WHO ARE WE?

We are pioneers at heart. What does that mean? We are always looking forward, thinking of what we can create tomorrow that does not exist today. We were born digital and we are a new model of agency, with a deep skillset in tech and marketing. That’s why we hire curious, self-driven, talented people who never stop innovating.




Our culture is big enough to cope and small enough to care. Meaning, that with people across 30+ countries, we’re big enough to provide you with the best tools, global opportunities, and benefits that help you thrive. While acting small by investing in you, your growth, and your team, and giving you the autonomy to solve our client's problems, no matter where you are in the world.




DEPT® is committed to making a positive impact on the planet and since 2021 has been Climate Neutral and B Corporation certified.




DIVERSITY, EQUITY & INCLUSION

At DEPT®, we take pride in creating an inclusive workplace where everyone has an equal opportunity to thrive. We actively seek to recruit, develop, nurture, and retain talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, with varying skills and perspectives.




Not sure you meet all qualifications? Apply, and let us decide! Research shows that women and members of underrepresented groups tend not to apply for jobs when they think they may not meet every requirement, when in fact they do. We believe in giving everyone a fair chance to shine.




We also encourage you to reach out to us and discuss any reasonable adjustments we can make to support you throughout the recruitment process and your time with us.

Want to know more about our dedication to diversity, equity, and inclusion? Check out our efforts here.
